Resident
2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 11/16/2017
Very safe and clean community. The walls are a little thin, can typically hear the neighbors at night. But they are very nice and considerate. Staff are attentive and accommodating. Loved how pet friendly they were. Love the payment app for rent!
Very safe and clean community. The walls are a little thin, can typically hear the neighbors at night. But they are very nice and considerate. Staff are attentive and accommodating. Loved how pet friendly they were. Love the payment app for rent! Read less

Report
Verified Resident
2009 - 2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 11/14/2017
This is a very quiet apartment complex for the most part. The office staff is great and maintenance work is always completed within a day or two from when I submit a request. The owners have made many improvements in the property over the years.
This is a very quiet apartment complex for the most part. The office staff is great and maintenance work is always completed within a day or two from when I submit a request. The owners have made many improvements in the property over the years. Read less

Report
Verified Resident
2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 11/08/2017
The Flats@5512 is a great location, safe, well maintained and the staff is very responsive. When we moved in we were very happy to find the apartment so clean and well maintained. We are previous tenants and specifically passed up on the new locations to be able to return to this community!
The Flats@5512 is a great location, safe, well maintained and the staff is very responsive. When we moved in we were very happy to find the apartment so clean and well maintained. We are previous tenants and specifically passed up on the new locations to be able to return to this community! Read less

11

Verified Manager11/09/2017

Thank you for sharing your AMAZING review. We are truly happy you are enjoying us and love that it is for the 2nd time. Too cool! Best, The Flats@55twelve Apartments

How was this review?
Useful
Thanks for voting!
Report
Verified Resident
2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 11/04/2017
The ethereal coziness, yet location to modern convieniences are great. I enjoy walking the sidewalks or hitting the on-site trail. The scenic nature of the pond, forest, and Zen Garden provide a great escape from a hectic life. However on days I feel like shopping or dining-out, there are dozens of retailers located within walking distance. The Flats at 5512 lies in a 10 Mile radius to I-40, I-85, 147, and 15-501 roadways, and RDU International Airport is just 12 miles away! It really is the perfect medium for homebodies and wanderlusters! The Flats at 5512 is really a home away from home. Being a transplant to the RDU the people make this a community. Diversity and respect are common thread here. Including the office personnel, maintenance team, and residents celebrate each other through general conversations, community events, and outings!
The ethereal coziness, yet location to modern convieniences are great. I enjoy walking the sidewalks or hitting the on-site trail. The scenic nature of the pond, forest, and Zen Garden provide a great escape from a hectic life. However on days I feel like shopping or dining-out, there are dozens of retailers located within walking distance. The Flats at 5512 lies in a 10 Mile radius to I-40, I-85, 147, and 15-501 roadways, and RDU International Airport is just 12 miles away! It really is the perfect medium for homebodies and wanderlusters! The Flats at 5512 is really a home away from home. Being a transplant to the RDU the people make this a community. Diversity and respect are common thread here. Including the office personnel, maintenance team, and residents celebrate each other through general conversations, community events, and outings! Read less

Verified Manager11/07/2017

Thank you for your review of the Flats@55Twelve! We are so glad that you find the location to be convenient and that you are enjoying the quiet, serene community! We hope you stay here for years to come!

Report
Verified Resident
2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 10/23/2017
The staff are amazing... Though, my experience with the staff is not a unique one, some residents don't appreciate the staff as much as I. I have yet to feel un-welcomed by the staff. It's largely one of the reasons for selecting the complex as my residence. I would only suggest that they dust the roof of an apartment before renting it... however, I also moved it quite swiftly after touring... there may not have been enough time for the dusting.
The staff are amazing... Though, my experience with the staff is not a unique one, some residents don't appreciate the staff as much as I. I have yet to feel un-welcomed by the staff. It's largely one of the reasons for selecting the complex as my residence. I would only suggest that they dust the roof of an apartment before renting it... however, I also moved it quite swiftly after touring... there may not have been enough time for the dusting. Read less

Verified Manager10/25/2017

Thank you for your review! We are so glad you have moved into The Flats at 55Twelve and that you feel welcomed by the team! I'm sorry to hear of the dust in your apartment. Please know, in the future, if there is ever something missed, we would be more than happy to help if you let us know about it.

Report
Resident
2016 - 2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 10/19/2017
Great and very nice place to live. The staff are very good. The service requests are taken effectively. The only drawback I could see is the closets which are very small and half part of one of closets is not accessible. Overall nice place to live at.
Great and very nice place to live. The staff are very good. The service requests are taken effectively. The only drawback I could see is the closets which are very small and half part of one of closets is not accessible. Overall nice place to live at. Read less

11

Verified Manager10/05/2017

Thank you for your review of The Flats@55twelve! We also look forward to having you join our community!

How was this review?
Useful
Thanks for voting!
Report
Verified Resident
2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 09/26/2017
The move-in process has been very easy. The staff are friendly and welcoming without being aggressive (as is the case at other apartment complexes). The grounds are well-kept and there is plenty of parking, plenty of sunlight, a beautiful pool, and my apartment was well taken care of before my move-in. I enjoy this location - it's central to where I spend my week and it's in immediate proximity to almost every store and restaurant you can think of.
The move-in process has been very easy. The staff are friendly and welcoming without being aggressive (as is the case at other apartment complexes). The grounds are well-kept and there is plenty of parking, plenty of sunlight, a beautiful pool, and my apartment was well taken care of before my move-in. I enjoy this location - it's central to where I spend my week and it's in immediate proximity to almost every store and restaurant you can think of. Read less

Thank you for sharing your experience at The Flats at 55Twelve! We are so glad that you find the community to be in a nice, convenient location. I will also pass along the compliments to our office and maintenance teams! It is great to hear that you have found them to be friendly, quick, and efficient! Please feel free to continue sharing your experiences with your friends and coworkers! Respectfully, Kathy Kenyon Business Manager The Flats at 55Twelve

I just can't wait :)

Hopefully it's good weather that week so you can relax in a hammock at the Zen Garden or by the pool, while taking a break from unpacking! Please feel free to continue sharing your experience with your friends and family! Thank you, Kathy Kenyon Business Manager - The Flats at 55Twelve

Report
Resident
2014 - 2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 07/12/2017
I have lived at the Flats for 4 years now and the Fogelman Management Group is the best management group I have seen thus far (and this is the 4th management group this complex has had in 4 years). Maintainance is on point, the office staff is professional and courteous. There are activities for all ages scheduled by the management office. The location is excellent for shopping and dining. Overall, a great place to live!
I have lived at the Flats for 4 years now and the Fogelman Management Group is the best management group I have seen thus far (and this is the 4th management group this complex has had in 4 years). Maintainance is on point, the office staff is professional and courteous. There are activities for all ages scheduled by the management office. The location is excellent for shopping and dining. Overall, a great place to live! Read less

Resident
2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 07/10/2017
I absolutely love living at the flats! The apartment is beautiful and so spacious. I'm on the first floor and never hear my upstairs neighbors. The grounds are kept pristine. The pool and fitness center are great. Love the staff, they are always willing to help. In a great area with lots of shopping. I can't say enough good things :)
I absolutely love living at the flats! The apartment is beautiful and so spacious. I'm on the first floor and never hear my upstairs neighbors. The grounds are kept pristine. The pool and fitness center are great. Love the staff, they are always willing to help. In a great area with lots of shopping. I can't say enough good things :) Read less

Report
Verified Resident
2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 05/12/2017
Just recently moved in and everything seems to be fine as of right now. I had a maintenance request that was quickly dealt with. I notified the office staff and the next day they completed the project. Everyone in the office is nice friendly, offering help where it is needed. While inside the apartment you really don't hear much going on externally, but I could also just be living next to really quiet people.
Just recently moved in and everything seems to be fine as of right now. I had a maintenance request that was quickly dealt with. I notified the office staff and the next day they completed the project. Everyone in the office is nice friendly, offering help where it is needed. While inside the apartment you really don't hear much going on externally, but I could also just be living next to really quiet people. Read less

Verified Manager03/21/2017

Thank you for your feedback! We appreciate your comments and hope you will remain a resident for years to come!

How was this review?
Useful
Thanks for voting!
Report
Resident
2014 - 2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/15/2017
I've been here for 2+ years. Perfect location nestled in the woods, close to shopping, rural farmlands/Duke forest and convenient drive to both Duke and UNC. Also very safe. Although the management has changed several times and my apartment doesn't have all the new upgrades, I still enjoy living here. The staff are always very kind whenever I interact with them. The community seems nice- lots of new families. It's also very quiet in my building which is a major plus. There is a mandatory valet trash fee that I wasn't happy about, but I'm over it now since the pros outweigh this.
I've been here for 2+ years. Perfect location nestled in the woods, close to shopping, rural farmlands/Duke forest and convenient drive to both Duke and UNC. Also very safe. Although the management has changed several times and my apartment doesn't have all the new upgrades, I still enjoy living here. The staff are always very kind whenever I interact with them. The community seems nice- lots of new families. It's also very quiet in my building which is a major plus. There is a mandatory valet trash fee that I wasn't happy about, but I'm over it now since the pros outweigh this. Read less

Verified Manager03/21/2017

Thank you for your feedback! We appreciate your comments and hope you will remain a resident for years to come!

How was this review?
Useful
Thanks for voting!
Report
Resident
2016 - 2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/15/2017
My wife, 2 year old little girl and I have lived here for over a year and just signed another year lease. We are extremely pleased with The Flats. The pool area is great especially the grills that are available. The zen garden and the tennis courts are a favorite of our little girl. She loves to swing in the hammocks and riding her tricycle on the tennis courts. We also often put her in the wagon and take her to the playground. Sometimes we can't park directly in front of our apartment, but this is because we are growing in numbers in the apartments. The staff is very kind and courteous and prompt in any requests that are made. We were going to have a little cookout one time and the staff provided us with an eight foot table to put all of our food on. They also provided extra trash bags to make sure we had everything we needed. I have great neighbors and have met many great people in the complex. Great place to live and I have recommended it to many friends. - Todd Moody
My wife, 2 year old little girl and I have lived here for over a year and just signed another year lease. We are extremely pleased with The Flats. The pool area is great especially the grills that are available. The zen garden and the tennis courts are a favorite of our little girl. She loves to swing in the hammocks and riding her tricycle on the tennis courts. We also often put her in the wagon and take her to the playground. Sometimes we can't park directly in front of our apartment, but this is because we are growing in numbers in the apartments. The staff is very kind and courteous and prompt in any requests that are made. We were going to have a little cookout one time and the staff provided us with an eight foot table to put all of our food on. They also provided extra trash bags to make sure we had everything we needed. I have great neighbors and have met many great people in the complex. Great place to live and I have recommended it to many friends. - Todd Moody Read less

Verified Manager03/21/2017

Thank you for your feedback! We appreciate your comments and hope you will remain a resident for years to come!

How was this review?
Useful
Thanks for voting!
Report
Resident
2015 - 2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/15/2017
I have loved living here at the Flats! The management staff is wonderful and very accommodating! They are willing to work with you about any issues you might have, all with a smile on their face. The community is very dog friendly, and welcomes dogs in the main office as well. I also love that there are "dog waste" areas throughout the entire complex, with free dog waste bags. The noise is not bad, but of course living in any apartment complex you are going to hear some form of noise from neighbors. Our connecting wall between apartments seems pretty thin, but nothing that is intolerable! Maintenance is great and responds quickly to requests. Overall it is a GREAT place to live!
I have loved living here at the Flats! The management staff is wonderful and very accommodating! They are willing to work with you about any issues you might have, all with a smile on their face. The noise is not bad, but of course living in any apartment complex you are going to hear some form of noise from neighbors. Our connecting wall between apartments seems pretty thin, but nothing that is intolerable! Maintenance is great and responds quickly to requests. Overall it is a GREAT place to live! Read less

Report
Resident
2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/15/2017
I have not lived at The Flats for long but so far I have had a great experience. The office staff and management are friendly and very responsive. I really enjoy the resident events they host (like wine and chocolate !) The complex has two dog parks, which was a huge plus. The grounds are attractive and well-maintained, though in the past couple weeks I have noticed a couple areas that need attention. However, it is still early spring and the growing season can be unpredictable. My apartment is updated and very clean and spacious. Overall, I have no complaints and I find the place to be an excellent value and one of the better places I have lived!

We are so happy to have you at the Flats @ 55twelve. Thank you for this.

How was this review?
Useful
Thanks for voting!
Report
Resident
2016 - 2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/15/2017
The Flats is an awesome place to live! There is an amazing pool and pool deck, a great fitness room, a laundry room if you don't have a unit of your own, dog parks, a zen garden with hammocks, and so many other amenities. I really appreciate the kindness of the staff. They are always willing to help. The other day, one office worker was about to leave after the office had been closed for the day. From his car, he saw me go to the door and see that it was locked. He got out of his car and offered to open it back up to get my package for me. He was so kind and willing to take out his personal time to help me out! I was so appreciative. The maintenance staff is VERY timely, and they go above and beyond to help out their residents. I can't say enough good things about The Flats, there is nothing negative about living here.

Verified Manager03/21/2017

Thank you for your feedback! We appreciate your comments and hope you will remain a resident for years to come!

How was this review?
Useful
Thanks for voting!
Report
Resident
2014 - 2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/15/2017
I really enjoy living in The Flats. The new management has been WONDERFUL. They've really made an effort to get to know the residents. If I have a maintenance issue, it's fixed right away. This place is also pet friendly and has two dog parks. Whenever I need to pick up a package, I always take my dog to the office, and everyone there comes out to say hello and gives her treats. I know a majority of my neighbors, so most of the people are friendly. I had an issue with a neighbor, but management was able to help out with both parties, and the issue was resolved. Sometimes I can hear my neighbors, but it's never been a big deal. You have to expect to hear other people when living in any apartment complex. I also love the huge porches that come with every unit. Many of the apartments come with an outdoor storage unit, right outside of your apartment. You can also rent additional storage units or garages.
I really enjoy living in The Flats. The new management has been WONDERFUL. They've really made an effort to get to know the residents. If I have a maintenance issue, it's fixed right away. This place is also pet friendly and has two dog parks. Whenever I need to pick up a package, I always take my dog to the office, and everyone there comes out to say hello and gives her treats. I know a majority of my neighbors, so most of the people are friendly. I had an issue with a neighbor, but management was able to help out with both parties, and the issue was resolved. Sometimes I can hear my neighbors, but it's never been a big deal. You have to expect to hear other people when living in any apartment complex. Report
Resident
2016 - 2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/15/2017
I have lived here since June 2016 and experienced the management change. The new management and its staff are very responsive and friendly/personable. They are quick to respond to work orders and communicate with the residents whenever there are changes or ongoing events. The complex has a very nice pool//grill area, decent gym, zen garden, dog parks car wash area and other amenities! It is conveniently located near many shops and restaurants and is also right in between Chapel Hill and Durham. The airport is also about 20 minutes away.

Verified Manager03/21/2017

Thank you for your feedback! We appreciate your comments and hope you will remain a resident for years to come!

How was this review?
Useful
Thanks for voting!
Report
Resident
2016 - 2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/15/2017
I have lived here since June of 2016 and have been extremely pleased overall. Overall the complex is rather quiet and feels very safe, which is important to me since I am outside quite a bit walking my dog. I have only had minor issues in my apartment, like a leaky garbage disposal or sink, both were promptly addressed by the maintenance staff. The management has also been very good about working with me to schedule times with me to enter my apartment- this has been very important to me since I don't kennel my dog during the day and need the heads up. So if you have a dog- it's pet friendly, if you care about location- it's perfect for commuting to Duke, if you want apartment life, but no craziness- I would highly recommend.
I have lived here since June of 2016 and have been extremely pleased overall. Overall the complex is rather quiet and feels very safe, which is important to me since I am outside quite a bit walking my dog. The management has also been very good about working with me to schedule times with me to enter my apartment- this has been very important to me since I don't kennel my dog during the day and need the heads up. So if you have a dog- it's pet friendly, if you care about location- it's perfect for commuting to Duke, if you want apartment life, but no craziness- I would highly recommend. Read less

Verified Manager03/21/2017

Thank you for your feedback! We appreciate your comments and hope you will remain a resident for years to come!

How was this review?
Useful
Thanks for voting!
Report
Resident
2012 - 2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/08/2017
I have lived here since January 2012 and hope to continue living here. I recommend The Flats @ 55Twelve. I have been here through ALL the management changes, some good and some bad. The current management team Fogleman has been great as well as maintenance. I hope they all stay. Continuity of management and clear and concise communication between management and residents will be a positive towards the negativity issues that have been voiced here. The apartments are over 14+years old and have been maintained under the circumstances well, of course, some better than others due to resident wear and tear. I lived in Bldg. 6 from January 2012 until August 2016 when I moved to Bldg. 12 to an upgraded apartment. The apartment I moved to was not maintained as well as the apartment I had in Bldg. 6; but current management has corrected the issues I had. Each bldg. has its on issues as far as tenants above, beside, and across from you. I am giving no excuses for any one party; but if you only inform management of an issue(s) once and do not follow up--there are 200+ other residents, I am sorry they may forget. On the other side, if there are break-ins or property being stolen--residents need to know if management knows of these situation(s). No nobody knows all the residents in their individual bldg. let alone the other bldgs. but, you can be aware of your surroundings. We are all responsible for the upkeep and care of The Flats, we being management and residents. I live in bldg. 12 and I recognize the cars of the tenants in my bldg. and the ones that are not the normally vehicles. The location of shopping, restaurants, close proximity to Durham, Chapel Hill, 40, and 85 you cannot beat this location. It is quiet and back of the main through fare. I have enjoyed living here. Sure some times better than others, but I still will recommend The Flats. I apologize for the long review; but I wanted to give an honest review. If I had to do it all over again including the management changes, I would do it in a heartbeat. The Flats @ 55Twelve in my opinion is still a great place to live.
I have lived here since January 2012 and hope to continue living here. I recommend The Flats @ 55Twelve. I have been here through ALL the management changes, some good and some bad. The current management team Fogleman has been great as well as maintenance. I hope they all stay. Continuity of management and clear and concise communication between management and residents will be a positive towards the negativity issues that have been voiced here. The apartments are over 14+years old and have been maintained under the circumstances well, of course, some better than others due to resident wear and tear. I lived in Bldg. 6 from January 2012 until August 2016 when I moved to Bldg. 12 to an upgraded apartment. The apartment I moved to was not maintained as well as the apartment I had in Bldg. 6; but current management has corrected the issues I had. Each bldg. has its on issues as far as tenants above, beside, and across from you. I am giving no excuses for any one party; but if you only inform management of an issue(s) once and do not follow up--there are 200+ other residents, I am sorry they may forget. On the other side, if there are break-ins or property being stolen--residents need to know if management knows of these situation(s). No nobody knows all the residents in their individual bldg. let alone the other bldgs. but, you can be aware of your surroundings. We are all responsible for the upkeep and care of The Flats, we being management and residents. I live in bldg. 12 and I recognize the cars of the tenants in my bldg. and the ones that are not the normally vehicles. The location of shopping, restaurants, close proximity to Durham, Chapel Hill, 40, and 85 you cannot beat this location. It is quiet and back of the main through fare. I have enjoyed living here. Sure some times better than others, but I still will recommend The Flats. I apologize for the long review; but I wanted to give an honest review. If I had to do it all over again including the management changes, I would do it in a heartbeat. The Flats @ 55Twelve in my opinion is still a great place to live. Read less

Verified Manager04/03/2017

Thank you for sharing this review. We will work to make this an even better place to live.

Report
Resident
2015 - 2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/06/2017
This is our third year living at the Flats and we love it. It's gotten more crowded in the last year so parking is sometimes an issue, but we usually find a spot close to our building. The maintenance staff is courteous and prompt and we've never had major problems in the apartment. I love the valet trash as well but I'd like to see a permanent fixture outside each apartment to put it in. Taking the trash can in and out is kinda gross and a pain.
This is our third year living at the Flats and we love it. It's gotten more crowded in the last year so parking is sometimes an issue, but we usually find a spot close to our building. The maintenance staff is courteous and prompt and we've never had major problems in the apartment. I love the valet trash as well but I'd like to see a permanent fixture outside each apartment to put it in. Taking the trash can in and out is kinda gross and a pain. Read less

Report
Resident
2016 - 2017 Not Recommended Reviewed 03/05/2017
I have lived here for a year and would not recommend anyone moving here. Since I have been here my apartment has flooded due to heavy rain 3 times and the issue has not been fixed. The just replace the padding under the carpet and dry it but that has yet to solve the problem. I have had a number of issues with appliances from the dishwasher to the hood over the stove and the stove/oven not working. I also thought this was a safe area but I have been broke into due to the poor lock system here.

2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/02/2017
We've only lived here for about a month, but so far, it's great! All our maintence issues have been handled promptly, and the staff is always very friendly and smiling. Parking is much easier than most apartment complexes I've lived at, and it's very quiet. The Zen Garden is one of the coolest places; it's quiet and has free wifi, places to charge your devices, and hammocks and lounge chairs to relax in. Valet trash is super great, too!

How was this review?
Useful
Thanks for voting!
Report
Resident
2016 - 2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/02/2017
We have lived here for about six months and so far we like it. I have lived in lots of apartments, and I think there are good and bad things about every one. The good for these: It's actually pretty quiet overall. I very rarely hear my neighbors, traffic, or outside noise. The majority of my neighbors seem nice. The staff are nice and I think they are trying to make improvements to the public spaces. The location can't be beat in my opinion. The bad: Occasionally parking can be difficult for certain apartment locations. For my apartment (not sure about others), they really should replace the carpet. While the appliances in the kitchen are nice, the cabinets aren't very well done (the paint tends to chip off), but that's more appearance than functionality. The traffic for New Hope Commons can be intense on the weekends, but I guess that's the price for being so close to shopping and restaurants. Overall, they are good apartments.
We have lived here for about six months and so far we like it. I have lived in lots of apartments, and I think there are good and bad things about every one. The good for these: It's actually pretty quiet overall. I very rarely hear my neighbors, traffic, or outside noise. The majority of my neighbors seem nice. The staff are nice and I think they are trying to make improvements to the public spaces. The location can't be beat in my opinion. The bad: Occasionally parking can be difficult for certain apartment locations. For my apartment (not sure about others), they really should replace the carpet. While the appliances in the kitchen are nice, the cabinets aren't very well done (the paint tends to chip off), but that's more appearance than functionality. The traffic for New Hope Commons can be intense on the weekends, but I guess that's the price for being so close to shopping and restaurants. Overall, they are good apartments. Read less

How was this review?

Report
Resident
2016 Recommended Property Reviewed 12/23/2016
I am a victim of five extreme white collar criminals and I view the flats as a refuge from the nightmare that has been my life full of violent threats, stalking, extreme prolonged sex abuse, and domestic violence (one insane woman I have called the police on in three different states, and was working on getting a restraining order toward). The world can be cruel and unusual for oh so long, and I am starting to feel a sense of safety here with the friendly people I have met. Safety is the number one thing needed for mental health, so even as a victim of complex PTSD, I am starting to feel better. I feel like an abused animal coddled by a community of goodness. I have enjoyed the lake. Lauren & Angela were wonderful to me, and Roderick (?) is an adorable dreamboat. The middle aged man whose name I haven't caught yet is excellent as well. Everyone I've met in my building have been perfect. Thank you for the protection, flats!!!!!
I am a victim of five extreme white collar criminals and I view the flats as a refuge from the nightmare that has been my life full of violent threats, stalking, extreme prolonged sex abuse, and domestic violence (one insane woman I have called the police on in three different states, and was working on getting a restraining order toward). The world can be cruel and unusual for oh so long, and I am starting to feel a sense of safety here with the friendly people I have met. Safety is the number one thing needed for mental health, so even as a victim of complex PTSD, I am starting to feel better. I feel like an abused animal coddled by a community of goodness. I have enjoyed the lake. Lauren & Angela were wonderful to me, and Roderick (?) is an adorable dreamboat. The middle aged man whose name I haven't caught yet is excellent as well. Everyone I've met in my building have been perfect. Thank you for the protection, flats!!!!! Read less

Report
Verified Resident
2015 - 2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 11/07/2016
I've lived in this complex for over a year, and still like living here! It's close do both downtown areas of Durham and Chapel-Hill, and it close to 40 and 85. The staff here are very welcoming, and the neighbors are great. Most of the individuals are very friendly. The grounds are well lit at night, and I feel very safe in this neighborhood. I also like that there are 2 dog parks & that the complex is very "dog friendly". The large porches are one of my favorite things about the apartments.

11

Verified Manager11/03/2016

Thank you for taking the time to review our community! We are glad to head you are enjoying your residency, and we are here if there is anything you may need! Your Flats at 55Twelve Team

How was this review?
Useful
Thanks for voting!
Report
Resident
2015 - 2016 Recommended Property Reviewed 10/20/2016
Living here has been a real pleasure. Before I moved here 2 years ago, I lived about 3 miles away in a similarly beautiful, wooded and peaceful environment and have felt right at home here. When I first moved in, I was immediately impressed by the cleanliness, the professionalism of the other residents, the security(well lit and responsive to issues) and the landscape/grounds maintenance. The pool is large, pristine and with ample furnishings. A large double propane brick barbecue area adjoins the pool and is a wonderful place for parties and get togethers. There is very large gym with tons of equipment adjacent to the pool, open 24 hours a day. Also adjacent are a laundry facility and business center, also open 24 hours a day. The appliances and fixtures in my place are in excellent condition and if I have any problems with them, or anything in my place, the personable staff is quick to acknowledge and respond. My residence is very quiet and restful. The only sounds I hear are of the birds singing, the crickets and the occasional geese. There have been 2 management companies since I have been here and I have known both their on-site staff personally. All the staff are easy to reach, approachable, fair and handle complaints and requests in timely manners. For me, the Flats is a wonderful residence.
Living here has been a real pleasure. Before I moved here 2 years ago, I lived about 3 miles away in a similarly beautiful, wooded and peaceful environment and have felt right at home here. When I first moved in, I was immediately impressed by the cleanliness, the professionalism of the other residents, the security(well lit and responsive to issues) and the landscape/grounds maintenance. The pool is large, pristine and with ample furnishings. A large double propane brick barbecue area adjoins the pool and is a wonderful place for parties and get togethers. There is very large gym with tons of equipment adjacent to the pool, open 24 hours a day. Also adjacent are a laundry facility and business center, also open 24 hours a day. The appliances and fixtures in my place are in excellent condition and if I have any problems with them, or anything in my place, the personable staff is quick to acknowledge and respond. My residence is very quiet and restful. The only sounds I hear are of the birds singing, the crickets and the occasional geese. There have been 2 management companies since I have been here and I have known both their on-site staff personally. All the staff are easy to reach, approachable, fair and handle complaints and requests in timely manners. For me, the Flats is a wonderful residence. Read less

11

Verified Manager10/20/2016

Thank you so much for your kind words and for taking the time to review our community! We are thrilled to hear you are happy to be residing at the Flats, and we are here if there is anything you may need!

How was this review?
Useful
Thanks for voting!
Report
Resident
2016 Recommended Property Reviewed 10/19/2016
I have lived in this complex for about three months and have been very impressed by the community. The complex was recently purchased by another organization and the transition has been smooth. The quality of staff service has also increased with a new team in the leasing office.

11

Verified Manager10/19/2016

Thank you for taking the time to review our community! We are happy to hear you are enjoying your residency and are here if there is anything you may need!

How was this review?
Useful
Thanks for voting!
Report
Resident
2016 Recommended Property Reviewed 10/12/2016
Overall I have enjoyed living here. It's very quiet and the grounds are clean and well maintained. When I first applied for a unit, I explained my urgency in needing to move in ASAP. The staff accommodated me and I signed my short term lease within 24 hours. Maintenance requests are completed in a timely manner. The staff have always been courteous to me. I usually end up speaking with Lauren over the phone or via email and her customer service is top notch. There is nothing to complain about at this complex. I do have a suggestion though, which is to make residents that own inoperable cars that have not moved in 6 months or more and have expired tags, to make those residents move their cars to less heavily used parking spaces. It's annoying and frustrating when you have to walk across the parking lot to your unit with tons of grocery bags or a small child during inclement weather when closer spaces are being taken up by cars that haven't moved in months. Some cars don't even have license plates. Other than that, great place to live.
Overall I have enjoyed living here. It's very quiet and the grounds are clean and well maintained. When I first applied for a unit, I explained my urgency in needing to move in ASAP. The staff accommodated me and I signed my short term lease within 24 hours. Maintenance requests are completed in a timely manner. The staff have always been courteous to me. I usually end up speaking with Lauren over the phone or via email and her customer service is top notch. There is nothing to complain about at this complex. I do have a suggestion though, which is to make residents that own inoperable cars that have not moved in 6 months or more and have expired tags, to make those residents move their cars to less heavily used parking spaces. It's annoying and frustrating when you have to walk across the parking lot to your unit with tons of grocery bags or a small child during inclement weather when closer spaces are being taken up by cars that haven't moved in months. Some cars don't even have license plates. Other than that, great place to live. Read less

I like the backsplash and new appliances that come with this style, I would recommend it. Maintenance Staff: Anytime I've needed anything....done. Same day. These guys don't mess around! Nice too! Summary: If you were to have a bad experience with the people or service here, I would immediately question your character. Apartment is very nice, and safe. Location is great for avoiding traffic to/from Durham/Chapel Hill during rush.

Please reach out to the leasing office and we would love to address any issues you might have. We will continue to maintain a beautiful landscaped community you can feel proud to come home to. As for new residents, we have not changed the qualifications since the Evergreens. Again, please reach out to the leasing office if you have any concerns/issues and we will address those. flats55twelve@greystar.com or 919.489.8788 Sincerely, Community Manager

11

Verified Manager06/23/2016

Thank you for your review. We strive to make The Flats at 55Twelve a wonderful place to call home. We hope you will enjoy the amenities and the location for many years to come. Sincerely, Community Manager

How was this review?
Useful
Thanks for voting!
Report
Resident
2015 - 2016 Recommended Property Reviewed 05/23/2016
I have lived at the Flats for a year now and have mostly loved it. I would definitely recommend it to anyone else who wants to live in this area and is on a budget. The trees and greenery is nice considering you're located close to wal-mart and a lot of other stores and restaurants. Apartment is a pretty nice size (I have a 1BR) for the cost. The appliances are mismatched and the backsplash isn't tile, it is stick on, but it looks pretty good still. The neighbors are fairly quiet and it is a pretty calm complex. The only complaint I really have is with the "valet trash." Why do I need to pay $25 a month for someone to take my trash to the dumpster? They don't do recycling so I have to make a couple trips a week to the dumpster anyways. Plus the managers threatened to fine us $25 for leaving our trashcans in the breezeways. Their suggestion was to put the trash cans on our porches if we didn't want to keep them in our house. So instead of leaving the trash can where 5 other people can see it, they want me to put it on my porch where 100 people can see it, that makes a lot of sense. Most of the staff is very nice and knowledgeable and the maintenance has always been very prompt and goes above and beyond (one time I had asked them there to fix a cabinet door and mentioned that my tub was draining slow so they took the extra time to unclog my tub drain!). I would stay here if I could but I am moving away :(
I have lived at the Flats for a year now and have mostly loved it. I would definitely recommend it to anyone else who wants to live in this area and is on a budget. The trees and greenery is nice considering you're located close to wal-mart and a lot of other stores and restaurants. Apartment is a pretty nice size (I have a 1BR) for the cost. The appliances are mismatched and the backsplash isn't tile, it is stick on, but it looks pretty good still. The neighbors are fairly quiet and it is a pretty calm complex. The only complaint I really have is with the "valet trash." Why do I need to pay $25 a month for someone to take my trash to the dumpster? They don't do recycling so I have to make a couple trips a week to the dumpster anyways. Plus the managers threatened to fine us $25 for leaving our trashcans in the breezeways. Their suggestion was to put the trash cans on our porches if we didn't want to keep them in our house. So instead of leaving the trash can where 5 other people can see it, they want me to put it on my porch where 100 people can see it, that makes a lot of sense. Most of the staff is very nice and knowledgeable and the maintenance has always been very prompt and goes above and beyond (one time I had asked them there to fix a cabinet door and mentioned that my tub was draining slow so they took the extra time to unclog my tub drain!). I would stay here if I could but I am moving away :( Read less

1

anonymous 06/23/2016

I have lived here for a little over a year. Staff is wonderful, very courteous, kind and understanding. I can't say enough about the staff or maintenance staff or I would take up too much space. Maintenance is always very prompt, and also very courteous and kind. They always come in with a smile on their face and never complains. Out of all the places I have lived, this is one of the best.

Verified Resident

Was greeted warmly. Office personnel friendly and efficient. Apartment suits my needs. I rented this apartment without seeing it. I had to be in Durham to be on call for a medical procedure and did not have a lot of time. I look at about 20 apartment groups on line. This is the one that had an available apartment to meet my needs. So far, the staff have been courteous, helpful and professional. My apartment is the right size for my needs and I can afford it. The residents have bee friendly and greet me. I have had several chats with them. I plan to try the swimming pool, exercise room and other amenities offered including the coffee in the office. At this point, I can see no reason for not recommending this apartment complex to someone else. It has an interesting name. Does anyone in the office know the history behind the name? Really, I have nothing else to say so I hope this now at least 200 words.

11

Verified Manager04/13/2016

Hello, My team and I strive to make The Flats @ 55Twelve a beautiful community. We are glad you are enjoying your home! Best Regards, Management Team

How was this review?
Useful
Thanks for voting!
Report
Resident
2008 - 2016 Not Recommended Reviewed 03/30/2016
This property has pros and cons. The Good: Great maintenance team-best we've had so far. This also continues to be a great location with great neighbors. The Bad: We miss the social events that the Evergreens staff used to host. The garbage fee is a rip off. We are also disappointed with the renovations-some of the changes make no sense (making the pool deck less shady) and the construction is very disruptive. The contractors who replaced the rotting wood on our porch left cigarette butts and nails everywhere. We were taken aback by the threat to return packages not picked up within three days during the holiday season when a lot of people are traveling. Overall: In general, we feel as though the Greystar staff works very hard, but that the new owners don't really care about the quality of life for residence or employees; if they cared, they wouldn't have fired all of the great people who managed this property for years and they wouldn't have added the ridiculous garbage fees-or changed the garbage collection process multiple times in one year. Also, this property has had 4 property managers in 3 years so the staff aren't that familiar with the property or longtime residents. Moreover, they don't really have much power to change things that aren't working. This is a safe, convenient place to live. If you are looking for social events or for staff members who can address complaints, however, I would go with a complex that is locally owned or at least not owned by a large investment company in Chicago.
This property has pros and cons. The Good: Great maintenance team-best we've had so far. This also continues to be a great location with great neighbors. The Bad: We miss the social events that the Evergreens staff used to host. The garbage fee is a rip off. We are also disappointed with the renovations-some of the changes make no sense (making the pool deck less shady) and the construction is very disruptive. The contractors who replaced the rotting wood on our porch left cigarette butts and nails everywhere. We were taken aback by the threat to return packages not picked up within three days during the holiday season when a lot of people are traveling. Overall: In general, we feel as though the Greystar staff works very hard, but that the new owners don't really care about the quality of life for residence or employees; if they cared, they wouldn't have fired all of the great people who managed this property for years and they wouldn't have added the ridiculous garbage fees-or changed the garbage collection process multiple times in one year. Also, this property has had 4 property managers in 3 years so the staff aren't that familiar with the property or longtime residents. Moreover, they don't really have much power to change things that aren't working. This is a safe, convenient place to live. If you are looking for social events or for staff members who can address complaints, however, I would go with a complex that is locally owned or at least not owned by a large investment company in Chicago. Read less

Resident
2015 - 2016 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/15/2016
I enjoy the grounds and walking around the neighborhood. It is very relaxing and I feel safe no matter what time of day. Report
Resident
2013 - 2016 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/09/2016
This is a nice place to live. The staff is friendly and they are always making improvements. It is convenient to lots of shopping and very close to I-40.
This is a nice place to live. The staff is friendly and they are always making improvements. It is convenient to lots of shopping and very close to I-40. Read less

Verified Manager04/11/2016

Thank you for noticing the beautiful upgrades we have made to your community. We appreciate you making the Flats at 55Twelve your home!

11

Verified Manager02/23/2016

We have read your issue and hope that we can improve in your perception. All applicants are informed of the Valet Waste fee during the application period. The cost and benefits of this service are made clear on the Welcome Home Letter that is sent out prior to the lease signing and the addendum presented at the time of lease signing. We do all we can to be clear and make sure all residents are aware. We discourage our residents from smoking or using glass in the shared common areas. While we can't be everywhere at all times, we do have a grounds-keeping service Monday-Friday to keep our neighborhood remain beautiful. Please be sure to let us know directly when you see any broken glass within the community. Our goal is to make sure that we have well-informed residents and have an open door policy if you have concerns. It is our sincere hope that you would come to the office to discuss your concerns so that we can discuss how we might improve your lifestyle here at the Flats at 55 Twelve. We value our residents and hope that together, we can move towards a solution that will entice you to remain with us for a long time to come.

How was this review?
Useful
Thanks for voting!
Report
Resident
2015 Not Recommended Reviewed 12/24/2015
I just signed my lease there and I am already unhappy. I initially told the leasing agent that I DID NOT want white appliances . At that time I was told that the package was 60 dollars . However when I contacted management I was told the fee was 125 dollars. That pretty messed up considering the apartments are supposed to be upgraded. White appliances are not considered to be apart of any upgrade. I was told that they would follow up and still nothing! I also think that it's odd that they don't offer dryer and washers but try to push renters to lease from an outside source that is some how affiliated with the complex. Oh yes and I have to mention the valet service it is a complete waste of money. I would prefer to dump my own trash and save 25 dollars . Charges that are in addition to rent 125 for upgraded appliances =1500 25 for valet service =300 30 for washer and driver rental =360 Over a 12 month lease !

11

Verified Manager12/27/2015

Thank you for your feedback. Our goal at The Flats at 55 Twelve is to present a professional service for our residents and guests at all times. If our team failed to meet your customer service expectations, we sincerely apologize; however the team has addressed your concern immediately and we agreed to look into your concerns you may have after the Holidays. Thank you for your understanding!

How was this review?
Useful
Thanks for voting!
Report
Resident
2015 Not Recommended Reviewed 12/18/2015
I really hate to complain, but I've been pretty disappointed with this property as of late. While I love my apartment, and very much enjoy my neighbors, this complex fails to live up to it's potential. It's located right off a busy intersection, making it convenient for commuting to work or to go out in either Durham or Chapel Hill. It's within walking distance to Starbucks and a shopping center and is far enough away that it's not bothersome. I hear my neighbors through my kitchen wall sporadically, but they have young children and it's not troublesome. The apartment itself was pretty much just like I saw on a tour -which I appreciated. The carpets are changed for each new resident and all the appliances work well enough. The only issue I had with the apartment itself was a few little things like a difficult dishwasher to get started, and some minor cosmetics, but nothing too serious. The neighborhood is friendly with lots of dogs. There's a dog park great for pets right in the complex. The rest of the grounds are kept pretty well, although there have been issues with trash. I understand the dump at the back of the complex is often locked resulting in residents dumping their trash outside of the compactor. The valet trash is $25/month (a little overpriced in my opinion) and runs 4 days a week. They're pretty strict about having your empty complex-provided container stowed out of sight -they'll fine you $25 for the container and an additional $25 for each bag of garbage for each time they see it during the day. As far as safety goes, it's usually pretty safe. Sometimes I hear shouting, loud music, and whatnot at night but nothing overly concerning. The only problems I personally have had have been when things occurred that were not reported to residents. One of my neighbors said that their friends motorcycle was taken overnight and that management relayed no information to residents. Furthermore, there was a day where I thought I heard gunshots (endorsed by my neighbors) but we received an email saying it was already being investigated. While there haven't been overbearing safety issues, just be careful in the area. Maintenance is very straightforward when you talk to them directly. They'll do what you ask and more if you're nice. The guys in maintenance who work here are fantastic. When I first moved in, Carly was fantastic and helpful. While she remains so, I've seen more and more new people and can't keep them straight and have been having more and more problems. Each time I've gone to the front office to deal with an issue, it has been circular conversations ending without result. Office staff is friendly if you have a routine thing (like rent) but anytime I've needed to get something taken care of, I've been taken through the ringer and been made to jump through hoops. Management is not my job, I shouldn't be responsible for what they fail to follow through with. For example, it took over 3 months for my first maintenance requests to be addressed. It took me three visits to the front office to have someone come out. They've lost packages that were signed for and are not eager to assist me when I need help. I won't go into the detailed history of each issue, but I'll describe one. Today the laundry room wasn't functioning. When nobody answered the office phone, I walked over to talk to them but nobody was there. When I tried both (again) an hour later? Still nothing. Then there was a sign on the door that said they'd be back by 2:30. When I showed up around 3, not a soul was found. Finally another half hour later, on my 4th visit to the front office and after nearly 4 hours of trying to contact them, I got in and was asked to come back. I opted to wait for 45 minutes to speak with someone. After describing my frustration, I was met with hostility and told the responsibilities of her job and that there was no issue for me to address. I was given a phone number for the coin operated machines to inform them that their machines didn't work. The coin machine company told me to tell management to call them. I am not a communications middleman and did not appreciate having my time wasted this way. I was given a key to a guest apartment to do laundry at long last. At this apartment, the beds looked as though there were people who had just slept there and an unflushed toilet. After spending over 4 hours to get ahold of a management representative, I was responded to aggressively and unprofessionally. I have a long patience, but it's been wearing down with each interaction at the office. I'll be the first to admit, I probably seemed irritated, but I expect any professional to work courteously to find a solution -not combatively. I love my apartment. It's just managed carelessly. If that were to change, I would recommend this place in a heartbeat. But a little improvement is needed first.
I really hate to complain, but I've been pretty disappointed with this property as of late. While I love my apartment, and very much enjoy my neighbors, this complex fails to live up to it's potential. The only problems I personally have had have been when things occurred that were not reported to residents. One of my neighbors said that their friends motorcycle was taken overnight and that management relayed no information to residents. Furthermore, there was a day where I thought I heard gunshots (endorsed by my neighbors) but we received an email saying it was already being investigated. While there haven't been overbearing safety issues, just be careful in the area. Maintenance is very straightforward when you talk to them directly. They'll do what you ask and more if you're nice. The guys in maintenance who work here are fantastic. When I first moved in, Carly was fantastic and helpful. Each time I've gone to the front office to deal with an issue, it has been circular conversations ending without result. Office staff is friendly if you have a routine thing (like rent) but anytime I've needed to get something taken care of, I've been taken through the ringer and been made to jump through hoops. Management is not my job, I shouldn't be responsible for what they fail to follow through with. For example, it took over 3 months for my first maintenance requests to be addressed. When nobody answered the office phone, I walked over to talk to them but nobody was there. When I tried both (again) an hour later? Still nothing. Then there was a sign on the door that said they'd be back by 2:30. When I showed up around 3, not a soul was found. Finally another half hour later, on my 4th visit to the front office and after nearly 4 hours of trying to contact them, I got in and was asked to come back. I opted to wait for 45 minutes to speak with someone. After describing my frustration, I was met with hostility and told the responsibilities of her job and that there was no issue for me to address. I was given a phone number for the coin operated machines to inform them that their machines didn't work. The coin machine company told me to tell management to call them. I am not a communications middleman and did not appreciate having my time wasted this way. I was given a key to a guest apartment to do laundry at long last. At this apartment, the beds looked as though there were people who had just slept there and an unflushed toilet. After spending over 4 hours to get ahold of a management representative, I was responded to aggressively and unprofessionally. I have a long patience, but it's been wearing down with each interaction at the office. I'll be the first to admit, I probably seemed irritated, but I expect any professional to work courteously to find a solution -not combatively. I love my apartment. It's just managed carelessly. If that were to change, I would recommend this place in a heartbeat. But a little improvement is needed first. Read less

11

Verified Manager12/20/2015

Thank you for sharing your concerns. We value our residents and we would like to resolve this situation to the best of our abilities. In order to address your specific needs, please contact us at 919.489.8788 or flats55twelve@greystar.com. We look forward to speaking to you soon. -Management

Report
Resident
2014 - 2015 Not Recommended Reviewed 12/18/2015
This place is the absolute worst. The office staff has no idea what they're doing. They do not respond to contact until you harass them constantly. Never answer the phone. "Lose" packages constantly. But now they have this new policy that they'll discard your packages if you don't pick them up immediately. The only good people who work here are the maintenance guys, only because they know their limitations. The gym is so hot it's unhealthy, the wifi never works, the television sounds are shite and didn't have remotes for the first 9 months I lived here. The pool is disgusting. It's probably cleaner to jump in a kiddie pool full of dog piss. The apartment walls are thin. Appliances that are supplied are shoddy. Molding is garbage installed by a toddler. Honest to God, the worst part about this complex is the staff. It's a revolving door of hostile idiocy. DO NOT LIVE HERE.

Report
Resident
2015 Not Recommended Reviewed 12/18/2015
For a while I thought I was the only one. Now I see from this website that I'm not alone. I really dislike the staff here. They threaten to send back packages if you don't pick them up within a couple of days. They fine you for forgetting to take in the nonsense trash bins at the right hour. There isn't any office center any longer. The wifi never works. The TVs in the gym are broken almost all of the time. The gym is super hot. There are never any towels. Even their "Manager" responses to complaints on this website are asinine. They don't leave a name, they don't give a manager's phone # or email address, and they don't even show evidence that they read the complaint. Don't you think that residents are posting here precisely because they don't get satisfaction from contacting the front office staff?

Report
Resident
2009 - 2015 Not Recommended Reviewed 12/12/2015
The management team before the summer of 2014 was of truly superior quality. Since then the complex has been sold, and it's been downhill all the way. There is a shopping center nearby, sure, but little in it besides a bookstore that would much interest a person of taste. Incredibly, there is no gas station in the nearby center, either. Also, if you are coming from Chapel Hill, a left turn onto Mt. Moriah Road can take quite a while around 5:00 PM. The great management team before mid-2014 was the reason to be at what was then called the Evergreens at Mt. Moriah The team present now is most definitely why you do NOT want to be there, though in fairness there is one person on the team at the moment (not the manager) who is actually OK. Staff turnover has been amazing since mid-2014. Every time you walk in, prepare to meet somebody new. There might be more staff stability at your local fast food restaurant. The maintenance guys at present (who knows about next week!) are nice and fairly competent. I wonder how long they're going to stay. The actual apartments themselves are reasonably attractive, if pricey. I have always loved the crown molding in the living room. Hats off to the entire pre July 2014 team, especially Damon and Victoria (and earlier on, Sheena), where ever you are. You knew our names, called them easily, and created a family-like atmosphere at the Evergreens. I miss you. So does everybody else who hasn't moved out. Amendment to my review: As I write this I have moved out of the Flats. I took good care of my apartment all along but also made an extra effort to clean the place as I exited, partly because that's who I am and partly because I so distrusted the management team. Nevertheless they found a way to eat up my entire deposit and refund me nothing. I was charged a fortune to clean the appliances, which is amazing since I kept them in immaculate condition and even wiped them down one last time on the very day I left just to be sure. A friend was with me on my last day at the Flats and he helped me double check my apartment for cleanliness. He thought I was leaving the place in great shape. So of course he was astounded when, some weeks later, I told him that the management team had kept my entire deposit.

2015 Not Recommended Reviewed 12/10/2015
This place is HORRIBLE! The number one issue I have is the fact the expect us to bring the valet trash bin into our home when it was just left outside the door of my apartment. They've even stated that they will fine us if residents don't take in the trash bin. Why would you fin residents for a trash bin that is meant to be OUTSIDE OF YOUR APARTMENT! On top of that the valet trash company doesn't even pick up the trash on time. But they have the nerve to say they'll walk around to see who leaves the trash bin outside! A load of crap and if I'm ever charged they won't hear the last of it from me! Also the lady who is the accountant for the company is very rude, and needs to learn how to send apporpriate emails to residents. I can't wait for May to get her so that I can leave.

How was this review?
Useful
Thanks for voting!
Report
Resident
2015 Not Recommended Reviewed 11/23/2015
This apartment is run by people who can only be described as completely and utterly unprofessional and incompetent. The discontinuity of amenities and lack of communication not only provides endless frustration, but comes with a sense of passive-aggression. There is internet in the pool and gym area, though it does not work. For the first two months, the televisions in the gym and pool were not functional. The trash people come as scheduled, but leave notes on your door if your garbage bag does not fit completely into the trash can in addition to the cigarette butts they leave on your doormat. Similarly, management leaves a note on your door if you do not place your outdoor garbage can inside immediately after pickup. Each time I have needed to bring something up to the management, I have had to meet with someone new who could not explain past reasoning, many of whom have not yet mastered elementary arithmetic or grammar. Maintenance fixes any issue you ask them to fix, as long as you ask 3 times. I believe they may be in cahoots with Beetlejuice. However, they will enter your apartment unannounced to check for toilet leaks, so I guess you're in the clear there. The apartment keeps safety a top priority and sends out emails promptly when construction noises sound concerning. However, when there are a series of break-ins and two stolen vehicles, they won't say anything for over a month. If it weren't for the inability of management to manage these properties, I would recommend this to a friend. I love my apartment and my neighbors, but there is a reason why so many people are moving out.
This apartment is run by people who can only be described as completely and utterly unprofessional and incompetent. The discontinuity of amenities and lack of communication not only provides endless frustration, but comes with a sense of passive-aggression. There is internet in the pool and gym area, though it does not work. For the first two months, the televisions in the gym and pool were not functional. The trash people come as scheduled, but leave notes on your door if your garbage bag does not fit completely into the trash can in addition to the cigarette butts they leave on your doormat. Similarly, management leaves a note on your door if you do not place your outdoor garbage can inside immediately after pickup. Each time I have needed to bring something up to the management, I have had to meet with someone new who could not explain past reasoning, many of whom have not yet mastered elementary arithmetic or grammar. Maintenance fixes any issue you ask them to fix, as long as you ask 3 times. I believe they may be in cahoots with Beetlejuice. However, they will enter your apartment unannounced to check for toilet leaks, so I guess you're in the clear there. The apartment keeps safety a top priority and sends out emails promptly when construction noises sound concerning. However, when there are a series of break-ins and two stolen vehicles, they won't say anything for over a month. If it weren't for the inability of management to manage these properties, I would recommend this to a friend. I love my apartment and my neighbors, but there is a reason why so many people are moving out. Read less

18

anonymous 12/05/2015

They just took over the place very recently. Give them a chance. Get to know them. They are nice people. Treat them with respect and they will treat you with respect. Didn't your momma ever teach you that!?!? It's a hard job. If you don't like it, then leave. We don't need you. The residents are the problem here. Not the management. Bad residents.

tomjones01 12/01/2015

I base my review off of my interactions with them; I wouldn't complain if I didn't think this was the only way to make them hear me. They can be doing their best and still not be doing their jobs. Think about it this way: say you needed knee surgery and the surgeon said everything was going to be great, told you how it would be no problem and got you to sign on. Then you roll into the operating room and the surgeon says &quot;oh btw, couldn't find a scalpel so we're using a chainsaw. Also no anesthesia, heres a towel to bite on, and you realize what you were told was not was about to happen. Then you wake up from the operation and they tell you they fixed your knee, but also amputated your leg. But the surgeon did his best! He just didn't know what he was doing. And you go to him pleading and he shrugs it off but appears sympathetic. Would you complain? What if you got to know him? He could be a great guy, but he still screwed up. I don't care if the management is the nicest group in the world if they can't do their jobs. If they don't know what they're doing and can't get things done, they need to be replaced by people who do and can. It's not personal, but they run my living space, are doing a terrible job, and come across as apathetic. And for the record, you reply to every negative review anonymously with the same exact phrase. My guess is that you work here and are taking it personally. If that's the case, just send out an email to all of us saying that we are only allowed to post positive reviews. Or attach a $25 fee to negative reviews. That should do it.

anonymous 11/30/2015

You are all a bunch of whiners. They're doing their best. Duh! You should take the time to get to know them before you complain.

Yep, my husband and I are leaving The Flats. We've been through two management changes in our short time living here, and with each change came more problems instead of resolution of problems. BUT we adore Carly and wish we could take her with us to our next apartment complex. She is a gem, and we hope Greystar recognizes her as such, and treats her accordingly. Verified Manager10/09/2015

We strive to create a great community and appreciate your feedback. We schedule food trucks and events each month and receive great feedback. Some events will be fully provided by the management team, other events will not be free, and some, like the Happy Hour at a nearby restaurant, will be a combination. We hope all of these events will give residents a chance to gather, meet neighbors, and get to know the area around your community. We would love to hear your ideas on other resident functions you would like to see in the near future, so please contact our leasing office at 919.489.8788 or email us at flats55twelve@greystar.com Sincerely, The Flats at 55Twelve Management

Resident
2014 - 2015 Recommended Property Reviewed 10/03/2015
Honest speaking, I don't like the previous leasing office. No email response. (weeks delay even they reply), Keep painting the outside wall/ground, Shut down the original trash collection center, and provide trash bin to each household (of course, charge the extra trash-fee and force us to keep the trash within our apartment overnight/through the weekend) etc. Luckily, we have the management team changed this May. The new leasing office team worked very efficiently and care about us. They not only solved my bill issues caused by previous leasing office, but also offers very timely response to my maintanence request. Holding happy hours, delivering safety note to each department before bad weather, etc. Although some staff are still new to here and are still in the learning process, I can feel their willingness to make this place better. As an international student far away from the home country, this makes me feel very warm and I would strongly recommend The Flats @55Twelve

Verified Manager09/15/2015

Thank you for sharing your concerns. We value our residents and we would like to resolve this situation to the best of our abilities. In order to address your specific needs, please contact us at 919.489.8788 or flats55twelve@greystar.com. We look forward to speaking to you soon. -Management

How was this review?
Useful
Thanks for voting!
Report
Resident
2014 - 2015 Not Recommended Reviewed 09/02/2015
Well located with decent amenities, but somewhat expensive compared to other similar complexes. The location is also a blessing and a curse: convenient to downtown Chapel Hill and Durham, but right behind a shopping center that has some truly terrible traffic and seemingly confuses drivers to no end. Be cautious when coming from the highway, especially during the holiday seasons. The biggest letdown is the management and administration. Bills are frequently incorrect or arrive after they're due, yet they attempt to levy fees for late/underpayment. Emails and phone calls often go without response, and visiting the office is a bit of a crapshoot. They've also made a number of changes that were unpopular or controversial: 1. Valet trash is a nice perk, but it's mandatory. You will pay an extra $25 on top of your rent for this service whether you care for it or not. 2. The volleyball court was removed without notice and replaced by a fountain. It looks okay, but it's entirely useless compared to the volleyball court, and doesn't make much sense since it's behind two buildings rather than in a generally visible area. 3. All the nice shade around the pool was taken away for some reason. 4. There were some benches placed around the grounds, but they were all taken away as well. From the standpoint of the units themselves, you could do worse. The exteriors are in decent enough shape and the newly renovated interiors appear pretty decent based on the pictures (they are not renovating units for current residents, so I haven't seen it in person). The administrative frustrations and inconveniences make it difficult to recommend this location, though, especially considering the premium you'll be paying.
Well located with decent amenities, but somewhat expensive compared to other similar complexes. The location is also a blessing and a curse: convenient to downtown Chapel Hill and Durham, but right behind a shopping center that has some truly terrible traffic and seemingly confuses drivers to no end. Be cautious when coming from the highway, especially during the holiday seasons. The biggest letdown is the management and administration. Bills are frequently incorrect or arrive after they're due, yet they attempt to levy fees for late/underpayment. Emails and phone calls often go without response, and visiting the office is a bit of a crapshoot. They've also made a number of changes that were unpopular or controversial: 1. Valet trash is a nice perk, but it's mandatory. You will pay an extra $25 on top of your rent for this service whether you care for it or not. 2. The volleyball court was removed without notice and replaced by a fountain. It looks okay, but it's entirely useless compared to the volleyball court, and doesn't make much sense since it's behind two buildings rather than in a generally visible area. 3. All the nice shade around the pool was taken away for some reason. 4. There were some benches placed around the grounds, but they were all taken away as well. From the standpoint of the units themselves, you could do worse. The exteriors are in decent enough shape and the newly renovated interiors appear pretty decent based on the pictures (they are not renovating units for current residents, so I haven't seen it in person). The administrative frustrations and inconveniences make it difficult to recommend this location, though, especially considering the premium you'll be paying. Read less

Report
Resident
2015 Recommended Property Reviewed 08/19/2015
My husband and I live in a newly remodeled one bedroom apartment at The Flats @ 55Twelve. The staff has been extremely helpful and understanding. We enjoy access to the tennis courts, pool and business center for FREE printing. Any time we have filed a maintenance request, it is always taken care of right away and usually followed up by a courtesy call. The location is great and close to shopping and restaurants. We rarely hear our neighbors, but people are friendly which is a plus. One morning last week, the entire staff was waiting outside the two exits handing out breakfast. It's the little things that count. My husband and I are very happy here!

How was this review?
Useful
Thanks for voting!
Report
Resident
2013 - 2015 Not Recommended Reviewed 07/29/2015
I am extremely disappointed with this apartment complex. We have been living here for a while now, and we were here when the complex was The Evergreens at Mount Moriah. While cosmetic changes have been made to make the complex look nice, the management has been terrible. The Greystar management team is incredibly rude, and they do not address problems promptly. We have been given the runaround for several months now about a concern that we had. We have also made maintenance requests, and all we received was a note that they had an incorrect number. The maintenance issues have yet to be addressed, and they have made no efforts to rectify the situation. We have been charged incorrect amounts since Greystar began managing the property, and it has yet to be rectified, regardless of multiple attempts on our part to contact them and fix the situation. When we go into the office with concerns, the management team acts as if it is a great inconvenience, with the exception of when there are prospective residents in the office. This complex has changed so much, and I absolutely would not recommend living here. I have never experienced so much chaos, stress, and such a lack of professionalism from Greystar management.
I am extremely disappointed with this apartment complex. We have been living here for a while now, and we were here when the complex was The Evergreens at Mount Moriah. While cosmetic changes have been made to make the complex look nice, the management has been terrible. The Greystar management team is incredibly rude, and they do not address problems promptly. We have been given the runaround for several months now about a concern that we had. We have also made maintenance requests, and all we received was a note that they had an incorrect number. The maintenance issues have yet to be addressed, and they have made no efforts to rectify the situation. We have been charged incorrect amounts since Greystar began managing the property, and it has yet to be rectified, regardless of multiple attempts on our part to contact them and fix the situation. When we go into the office with concerns, the management team acts as if it is a great inconvenience, with the exception of when there are prospective residents in the office. This complex has changed so much, and I absolutely would not recommend living here. I have never experienced so much chaos, stress, and such a lack of professionalism from Greystar management.
