11

Verified Manager08/04/2015

I am sorry to hear about your experience. Greystar prides themself on providing great customer service. Please contact the office so we can discuss in depth. We look forward to helping resolve the situation.

How was this review?
Useful
Thanks for voting!
Report
Resident
2009 - 2015 Not Recommended Reviewed 07/28/2015
I have lived in this apartment complex for several years now. It was previously called The Evergreens at Mt. Moriah and I loved it. Perfect location, and I stuck around even when the rent increased slightly because the management team was awesome. It's now called The Flats @ 55Twelve and has been through two different management companies so far. It's currently being run by Greystar and they are awful. Our water bill drastically increased with the first change in management (to Hawthorne), and then increased even more with this second change in management (to Greystar). They claim it's because the water company installed new individual pump systems, but this is the same reason that the Hawthorn staff gave, and I find it hard to believe that the water company would bother installing new pump systems in every single unit within the span of two months. Anyway, no explanation for the water bill, so we're stuck paying about double what we used to. More seriously, I have always paid for rent and the water bill by check. Never once have I given the leasing office my bank account number or routing number, yet this month I discovered that they had executed an unauthorized bank transfer to pay for last month's water bill. I can only assume that they were able to do this by looking at a previous check I had written. A few days after they transferred money out of my account, they deposited the check that I had written to pay for that same water bill (for the exact same amount). Both my husband and I called them to find out what was going on and informed the manager that there had been an unauthorized bank transfer out of our account by them; the manager said that she was "dealing with a couple other emergencies" that day and would call us back. Completely unprofessional. Whatever their excuse is, I don't know how they can justify not only making an unauthorized bank transfer, but then also depositing my check for that same water bill a few days later. (Current tenants - check your bank accounts!) Such a shame - it's a beautiful complex in a killer location, but the management is seriously terrible. Can't wait to move out of here.
I have lived in this apartment complex for several years now. It was previously called The Evergreens at Mt. Moriah and I loved it. Perfect location, and I stuck around even when the rent increased slightly because the management team was awesome. It's now called The Flats @ 55Twelve and has been through two different management companies so far. It's currently being run by Greystar and they are awful. They claim it's because the water company installed new individual pump systems, but this is the same reason that the Hawthorn staff gave, and I find it hard to believe that the water company would bother installing new pump systems in every single unit within the span of two months. Anyway, no explanation for the water bill, so we're stuck paying about double what we used to. More seriously, I have always paid for rent and the water bill by check. Completely unprofessional. Whatever their excuse is, I don't know how they can justify not only making an unauthorized bank transfer, but then also depositing my check for that same water bill a few days later. (Current tenants - check your bank accounts!) Such a shame - it's a beautiful complex in a killer location, but the management is seriously terrible. Can't wait to move out of here. Read less

Verified Manager07/28/2015

We do apologize for the inconvenience you have experienced. We had unfortunately lost our Internet connection and were not able to assist you immediately without computer access. We had literally just gotten back online within about 3-5 minutes prior to your 2nd call. We are investigating the problem with your payment posting twice. Thank you for your patience and understanding while we work on getting this resolved for you. Kindest regards, The Flats @ 55Twelve Team

Report
Resident
2015 Recommended Property Reviewed 07/22/2015
I visited The Flats before checking reviews because I know how some individuals can develop a level of hate for someone or something due to one bad experience. I had no issues with the staff and was notified of any issues going on in the complex. I then read the reviews and it seemed like many of the issues began before the newest management. To criticize them the way some reviewers have, is pretty wrong. I am now a resident and truly like leaving here. If you're looking to move here, you should check this place out before you take the word of anyone, including mines.

The Flats at 55 Twelve

Report
Resident
2010 - 2015 Not Recommended Reviewed 07/19/2015
This place used to be the best kept secret in Durham. The complex was privately owned and the management were hired directly from the owners. In these days, this place used to be called " evergreens at mount Mariah". The management were nice, friendly and would go out of their way to help and used to know the tenants by name. For some reason, probably greed, the owners decided to hire a company to run the complex and this is when the best kept secret turned into a scary nightmare. Two managements changed since then and both are horrible. The leasing staff are rude, not professional and racist. Water bills have doubled for no good reason. Pest control does not exist. No more treats for the tenants in the leasing office. PCs in the business office have ants all over them because some guy decided to eat there and did not clean after themselves and when you bring this to management they do nothing to solve the problem. We used to borrow DVDs from the leasing office, a service that does not exist anymore. My advice is save your money and look elsewhere in the area. This complex has previously recieved recognition from this site for being one of the most highly recommended complexes nationwide, right now it is ranked below Durham average. This fact speaks a lot by itself. Please, don't move here unless you like the location which is " to be fair" is great and very convenient.
This place used to be the best kept secret in Durham. The complex was privately owned and the management were hired directly from the owners. Two managements changed since then and both are horrible. The leasing staff are rude, not professional and racist. Water bills have doubled for no good reason. Pest control does not exist. We used to borrow DVDs from the leasing office, a service that does not exist anymore. My advice is save your money and look elsewhere in the area. This complex has previously recieved recognition from this site for being one of the most highly recommended complexes nationwide, right now it is ranked below Durham average. This fact speaks a lot by itself. Please, don't move here unless you like the location which is " to be fair" is great and very convenient. Read less

11

Verified Manager07/24/2015

Hi, We are sorry to hear your thoughts on our wonderful community. We have just changed management and are now proudly Managed by Greystar! Our employees are trained extensively and strive to put our residents first. We do offer pest control and as an added luxury, Valet Waste. The door to door trash pick up service is, in fact, billed with your water/ sewer bill. Your bill has not doubled, it just covers more!! We cancelled the DVD service due to a lack of resident interest as many of our residents use Hulu, Netflix and Prime. We do have a FREE Starbucks coffee bar in the office. Our business center does not have ants, as it is on the WEEKLY pest control schedule with the rest of the neighborhood. we would love to have you come to one of our resident activities to see if you might give us another chance! Best Wishes, The Flats at 55 Twelve

Report
Resident
2015 Recommended Property Reviewed 07/18/2015
I'm new to the Flats and almost didn't move in because of the negative reviews. I sat down with the office staff and spoke with them about my concerns. Since moving in, I have nothing but good to say. The entire staff has been very professional and helpful. It's quiet and clean which is important to me. Yes, I have had a few maintenance issues since moving in but the staff has been very quick to make the needed repairs. I have nothing to complain about. Most important, I'm glad I made the decision to listen to the staff and move in to this community.

anonymous 07/29/2015

It's pretty pointless trying to approach management about your water bill. I've tried multiple times (because my water bill, too, has doubled for no apparent reason) and all they do is offer to put in a service request to check for leaks, and then they say that everything is working fine. It's impossible to actually get face time with the manager because she's always &quot;busy&quot; (probably because she spends so much time writing responses to these reviews).

Verified Manager07/24/2015

Dear Resident, We are sorry to hear that you feel that way. Please bring your bill in to the office so that we can look at it and make any corrections if necessary. Your maintenance request is very important to us as we are here for you. if it was not fixed to your satisfaction, please resubmit it. We did implement Valet Waste which picks up your trash from your front door Sun-Thursday as long as it is out before 8pm (they pick up 8pm-12am and the trash must be in the black trash can provided), This was done for the convenience of our residents and many of our residents are pleased with the service. We hope that you will become one of them. We just had a poolside BBQ last week to introduce the team to the neighborhood and will have many more activities planned in the coming weeks. We hope that you will join! You are always welcome to come in to the office and address any issues that you may have and we will respond accordingly. Best, Beata, Community Manager The Flats at 55 Twelve

Resident
2014 - 2015 Not Recommended Reviewed 07/03/2015
I have been living here since last year and was so happy. The new Greystar management is absolutely horrible. There are new people in the office everyday. The new manager is unprofessional and has poor communication abilities. The staff is very unorganized, rude and makes up stories. They are going to charge $25 for valet trash collection. The manager is telling the residents that they cannot opt out of this service because it will be against Fair Housing Act. This woman has no knowledge of the law!!! Stay away from this place. I hate the management already within one month's time. If you are just looking for an apartment, there are several cheaper options in the area. There was a maintenance guy who lived on site for a decade. Greystar let him go after he had done so much work for this complex. The new maintenance people are lazy and disrespectful. Trash compactor is always loaded with trash. If an apartment complex cannot provide a very basic trash receptacle, what else can they provide.

Verified Manager07/24/2015

We are sorry that you have had that experience. We do uniformly charge for Valet Waste.This is an amazing time-saving service, that many of your neighbors love. The permanent office team is here. The Greystar Team is here for the Residents of the Flats at 55 Twelve. We regularly run the trash compactor and will be sending out a reminder to the neighborhood that furniture does not belong in the compactor as it will clog it. We appreciate your living with us and hope that we can change your opinion of how we serve our Residents! Best Wishes, The Flats at 55 Twelve

Report
Resident
2014 - 2015 Not Recommended Reviewed 07/01/2015
This place is garbage!! When I first moved in the management was great (Hawthorne) and the staff was friendly and caring. Maintenance was great and they hosted community events all the time. Ever since the new management has arrived (Greystone) this has become a miserable place to live. The office staff treats you as you are child and has no respect, care, courtesy, professionalism, or any other quality that should be found in a front office. They are constantly trying to pour money in upgrades while everything else falls apart (e.g. they built a cover to wash your car under but the water hose is broke and they laugh at you when you ask to fix it. They put in new gas grills that NEVER work!! I feel so disconnected with the property since new management has taken over and it seems to only getting worse. Its a great location but I strongly suggest you look at all the other great apartment complexes in the area before renting here.

Verified Manager07/24/2015

We are sorry to hear that you feel that you have been treated that way. Our goal as a professionally managed Greystar community is to always treat our residents, guests, and vendors with dignity and respect. The hose has been replaced and the grills are working. We remind our residents to turn off the gas after using the grills so that should not be a problem going forward. We want you to feel that you are welcome to come into the office at any time to discuss your needs and we will address them accordingly.As our Resident, you are our highest priority!! Come have a Starbucks with us anytime, Beata Community Manager

Resident
2013 - 2015 Not Recommended Reviewed 06/24/2015
New management (Greystar) is much worse than previous management (Hawthorne), which was much worse than previous management. Complex is constantly under construction (buildings, clubhouse/gym/pool, landscaping), so there is non-stop noise all day every day, and walls are thin. Management is only concerned with signing new people up, and shows no regard for tenants -- it's run like a business rather than a place where people actually live. Front office seems annoyed any time they have to talk to someone that lives here. Cannot wait to get out of here.

Verified Manager07/24/2015

Dear Resident, It is true that we are doing upgrades to the community. These upgrades are being done for the benefit of our existing, as well as future residents.We apologize for the noise that it creates, however, we do have firm daily completion times.We want you to have a place that you are proud to call home and invite people to. You are always welcome to come into the office and voice your concerns with us. We are listening and responding accordingly. I hope to meet you soon! Beata Community Manager

Report
Resident
2011 - 2015 Not Recommended Reviewed 06/11/2015
The original management when we moved in was fantastic. The original staff really got to know the residents and always greeted people by name. They hosted wine tastings, pool parties, holiday parties, held contests and drawings and really made it feel like home. However, there have been two new management companies in the past year. The office and maintenance staffs come and go so often that I have no idea who works here and they do as little as possible to make it feel like a welcoming place. In fact, garbage is often overflowing the compactor and dumpsters which is the first thing you see when you come in one of the entrances. While they have upgraded several of the apartments (which I'm sure look nice), you had better want to live in a construction zone when you're here. Work crews are frequently blasting music and yelling all day long and into the evening. The building shakes as they drop carpet rolls, hammer counters/cupboards, and drag appliances up and down the stairs. I often pick up nails in the parking lot and have seen several cars with flat tires. It's a never ending process as they renovate apartments each time someone moves out. A few years down the road, once all the apartments have been renovated, I'm sure this will get better and the apartments will all look great. However, until they have a solid management staff and the renovations are complete, I can't recommend living here. After 4 years here we will be moving out next month.
The original management when we moved in was fantastic. The original staff really got to know the residents and always greeted people by name. They hosted wine tastings, pool parties, holiday parties, held contests and drawings and really made it feel like home. However, there have been two new management companies in the past year. The office and maintenance staffs come and go so often that I have no idea who works here and they do as little as possible to make it feel like a welcoming place. In fact, garbage is often overflowing the compactor and dumpsters which is the first thing you see when you come in one of the entrances. While they have upgraded several of the apartments (which I'm sure look nice), you had better want to live in a construction zone when you're here. A few years down the road, once all the apartments have been renovated, I'm sure this will get better and the apartments will all look great. However, until they have a solid management staff and the renovations are complete, I can't recommend living here. After 4 years here we will be moving out next month. Read less

Verified Manager07/24/2015

Dear OP, We do apologize for the construction activities. Progress is often not without challenges, however, we are determined to provide a great place for our residents to call home and are quite sad that you are leaving. Our resident calendar comes out next month and we have some really fun things planned. were you able to attend our pool party last week? If you did, you got a chance to meet the permanent team and hopefully enjoyed a good burger! We hope that you will consider renewing your lease and giving us a change to show you what Greystar is all about!! Best! The Flats at 55 Twelve

Report
Resident
2011 - 2015 Not Recommended Reviewed 06/06/2015
Downhill with the new management. The gym is as hot as a sauna. AC doesn't work. This is the south, for crying out loud. They don't replace the gym towels with any regularity, and the wipes are always dry. They now have decided to lock doors when they show people around the property (NOT done by previous management). It's impossible to get a cup of coffee or pick up packages on the weekend (the only time many of us CAN pick up packages because of our work). Grounds are not maintained. Kids leaving trash and even bicycles all over the place. Trash fees are obscene and service is deplorable. We pay 32 dollars (25+7) for "valet" trash service. What does that mean? It means that bags pile up all over the place, because the trash compactor is full or broken and it means that garbage "juice" is leaked all over the place, staining the walkways, because of careless handling. Ants, ants, ants! ALL THE TIME. No exterminator CAN get rid of them. The old management had a warm, ebullient personality. These folks seem very cold and distant. Just my personal observation. Others may have their own impression. We are handing in our 60 days notice soon. Hallelujah!

12

Verified Manager07/24/2015

Hi! We read your review and wanted to explain that we lock the doors when we are out on tour to protect your packages as well as the sensitive personal information housed in our office. A tour generally doesn't take more than 25 minutes and we are open on Saturdays from 10 am-5pm. We do have a regular landscaping schedule that keeps our neighborhood beautiful. We will be sending out a copy of our Community rules as a reminder to everyone. We understand that you are displeased with the Valet Waste service, however, they do have rules on how the service works. You may view their FAQ's here: http://www.valetwaste.com/residents/resident-faqs/ If your apartment/perimeter needs pest control, please let us know so that we can schedule pest control service for your home. The AC in the gym is working so feel free to use it at anytime! Best, The Flats at 55 Twelve

Report
Resident
2014 - 2015 Not Recommended Reviewed 05/29/2015
The Flats (previously Evergreens) has gone down hill fast. Between poor ownership and poor management this is a bad place to live. The neighbors are friendly but stay away from the front office. They are so disorganized and can't get anything done. From the time I moved in we saw a sign that listed the following: new clubhouse, refurbished interiors, outdoor grilling bar, resort style pool, new fitness equipment, luxury pool seating, upgraded pet park, pup washing station, and community garden. Of those, only one is done (the fitness equipment) and it took nearly 8 months for that to get done. The pet park upgrades are laughable, two metal hoops stuck in the ground with fresh mulch, and the "upgraded pool" is a mini pillow on each old lounge chair. I'm now on my third management company since moving in, and it keeps getting worse. The latest company, Greystar, greet you with looks that say "why are you in here?" I've wanted to talk to someone about my rent for three weeks now and each time I go in they give me the same excuse that someone who is not in the office today will get back to me. Needless to say, they never get back to me. I'm just fed up with this community. I once was excited to live here, but now I'm excited to give my 60-day notice.
The Flats (previously Evergreens) has gone down hill fast. Between poor ownership and poor management this is a bad place to live. The neighbors are friendly but stay away from the front office. They are so disorganized and can't get anything done. Of those, only one is done (the fitness equipment) and it took nearly 8 months for that to get done. Verified Manager07/24/2015

Dear Resident, Please know that you are welcome to visit, call or email us in the office to make sure that your concerns are addressed. I am here Monday- Friday 9am-6pm to speak with you. It is our intention to provide you with superior service and a wonderful place to live! Best, Beata Community Manager

Resident
2015 Not Recommended Reviewed 05/17/2015
This apartment has been owned by 2 groups and managed by three companies in under 14 months. What's going on? Toxic property? This is the owner's "mission statement": "The companies strive to create value and realize superior returns for its investors, strategic partners, and their own account through management of a diverse portfolio of commercial and multifamily real estate properties." http://oakrealtygroup.com/index.html If you like what you're reading, then move here.

Verified Manager07/24/2015

We are now Proudly Managed by Greystar. This is our Mission Statement! To Enrich the Lives We Touch by Doing Things the Right Way We maintain a constant focus on our Pillars of Excellence, which are the foundation of everything we do - from corporate decision making to resident relations. These measurable standards of success are part of how we are redefining excellence in apartment living. Our success is also based on our strict adherence to the Core Values that make up the backbone of Greystar. Together, these Pillars and Values provide a roadmap for our decisions and a benchmark for our actions. Check us out! www.greystar.com

Report
Resident
2015 Recommended Property Reviewed 05/14/2015
I don't understand why there is a smear campaign going on against this apartment complex on all review websites by current residents. I have lived here for 8 weeks now and I still love the place. It has been nothing but quiet, any issues I have had have been fixed punctually, and all of the renovations are coming together but the rent is still super cheap because of it. The pool area is finished and looks amazing, they are also getting a flat screen for it. Also, I haven't meet a single person living here that I was uncomfortable with. Bobby (maintenance) and Bianca (office) are friendly, hardworking, and very genuine people. They are so caring and don't deserve for their credit to be diminished by bad reviews. As for the apartments themselves, my rent is very low for the square feet. I also like how it is set up with a long hallway separating the bedrooms from the living room, which is nice when my fiance is sleeping and I want to watch TV. Seriously just come check it out yourself, its in the same location as the more expensive apartments, and you'll see all of this is true. This is an undervalued apartment, went to every other apartment in area and this was the cheapest. Hope this is helpful.

Report
Resident
2014 - 2015 Recommended Property Reviewed 05/14/2015
I have had nothing but good experiences here. The staff have all been nice and helpful. They have been putting a great effort into updating everything; have recently repainted the exteriors of all buildings, tidied up the landscaping and improved one of the 2 dog parks. Right now they are in the process of renovating the clubhouse, which was already very nice. It includes a pool, a gym, laundry room and shared office space with two computers and a printer, which I have found very useful. It is amazingly quiet here and convenient to colleges, shopping and the I-40 freeway. It is also surrounded by trees on 3 sides and there is a pond, so you can access a little nature. It's not far to Duke Forest hiking trails (2-3 minute drive to Whitfield). Apartments come with a small storage space, I rented a garage for more storage. Have met mostly very nice residents here.

We do adjust rent rates to be inline with the cost of maintaining our beautiful apartments. We are always committed to giving you the best resident care that we can at all times. If you have any specific concerns that you need to have addressed, please feel free to come in to the office. Best, The Flats at 55 Twelve

Report
Prospective Resident
Visited 2015 Recommended Property Reviewed 05/04/2015
I came upon The Flats while searching for a place to relocate to with my company. My first opinion of the the property was that they have put a lot of money into renovating the facility. You could tell the paint on the buildings was new and that they were still upgrading some of the features. It's nice to see a place that cares about appearance especially when that expands from the outside to the inside as well. I was greeted promptly at the door by what must be one of the friendliest people I've come across in searching properties. Her name was Natasha and she was the Asst Mgr at the property. I have been in the service and sales business for over 10 years and it's always refreshing to meet someone who enjoys what they do and also knows the property and surrounding area. I've found that it's important to find people knowledgeable about the area when relocating since it can take a while to research the area alone. She was professional and willing to answer any of my questions regardless how asinine they may have seemed. I can only imagine that a company fortunate enough to have her as an employee must have big plans for her future. Some of the other great amenities they offer is a lap pool with lanes as sometimes they can be harder to find than you'd think. The pool deck itself offered some great features as well like a couple of grills and some very comfortable lounge chairs. My biggest complaint about this facility was that the fitness room seemed to be lacking. It was either laid out weirdly or they were missing some equipment that could have been helpful. In conclusion I would suggest anyone looking for a new place to call "home" should check this place out.
I came upon The Flats while searching for a place to relocate to with my company. My first opinion of the the property was that they have put a lot of money into renovating the facility. You could tell the paint on the buildings was new and that they were still upgrading some of the features. It's nice to see a place that cares about appearance especially when that expands from the outside to the inside as well. I was greeted promptly at the door by what must be one of the friendliest people I've come across in searching properties. Her name was Natasha and she was the Asst Mgr at the property. I have been in the service and sales business for over 10 years and it's always refreshing to meet someone who enjoys what they do and also knows the property and surrounding area. I've found that it's important to find people knowledgeable about the area when relocating since it can take a while to research the area alone. She was professional and willing to answer any of my questions regardless how asinine they may have seemed. I can only imagine that a company fortunate enough to have her as an employee must have big plans for her future. In conclusion I would suggest anyone looking for a new place to call "home" should check this place out. Read less

Verified Manager07/24/2015

Report
Resident
2014 - 2015 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/30/2015
This apartment is by far the best that I have lived in and I've lived in quite a few. I was a little concerned when the owners changed because there seemed to be so many unnecessary changes, but it seems to have all worked out. I was concerned that when I renewed my lease that my rent would skyrocket because of all the paving, painting, and renovations that were done but to my surprise it did not. Maintenance is always very quick in responding to requests, often the same day. There is a mandatory valet trash service that I was skeptical of, but it seems to be working out alright. I almost never hear my neighbors, which has been a huge problem in other places. One of the reviews mentioned the cell tower, I really don't think it's a problem and a bunch of birds always perch on it which is awesome :) There are frequently duck and heron visitors on the pond and there is a lovely little trail around the pond, good for dog walking. I would definitely recommend The Flats @ 55Twelve.

I was a little concerned when the owners changed because there seemed to be so many unnecessary changes, but it seems to have all worked out. I was concerned that when I renewed my lease that my rent would skyrocket because of all the paving, painting, and renovations that were done but to my surprise it did not. I would definitely recommend The Flats @ 55Twelve. Read less

Report
Resident
2009 - 2015 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/21/2015
I have lived here since the summer of 2009 when the property was the Evergreens at Mt. Moriah. I have absolutely no complaints until Hawthorne took over in the summer of 2014. Recently they decided to offer a "valet trash" service. It's free until you renew your lease, then it will cost $25/month if you decide to keep it. BAD, BAD idea!! The "rules" state that garbage cannot be left out overnight and will be picked up Mon-Fri, 7 am until 9 am. They provided everyone with a nice black garbage can that can be left outside or brought inside. The problem is that people, of course, can't or won't follow the rules and management is not enforcing them. Thus, several times a week when I leave my apartment or come home, there is garbage piled up outside the apartment across from me. They do not put it in the garbage can, but just leave the bags sitting next to it. REALLY?? Are you kidding me? I have sent countless emails to the management and have been assured that they will give/have given warnings and will start fining them. However, in the several months that this service has been offered, there has been NO change. Another neighbor sits his garbage bag on top of the opened garbage can--for some reason, these people's garbage bags don't fit in the normal-sized garbage can that was supplied. Apparently, they don't have a garbage can in their apartment, so the bags expand too wide at the bottom. Why don't they just take the garbage can inside and use it? It's beyond my comprehension, but I am sick and tired of unsightly garbage in the breezeway. Also, many times, the pile up of garbage at the garbage compactor and around the recycle bins is disgusting. I think I will start taking pictures and send it to Hawthorne first and then to the newspapers.

Verified Manager04/19/2015

How was this review?
Useful
Thanks for voting!
Report
Resident
2012 - 2015 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/09/2015
When Hawthorne took over in July 2014, it was bit of a shock. We did not receive a heads up. I think for many who were still trying to wrap their heads around it all, the changes were not welcomed. At first, I was hesitant to what seemed like an aggressive takeover. But I say with confidence now that I am welcoming the changes and love where I live just as much if not more so than when I first moved in 3 years ago. Noise: Not sure if more or less stars is good for noise, but I do know is that noise has never been a problem. Grounds: I am rating the grounds based on their current state; under construction. All of the buildings were recently painted, the parking lots were sealed and repainted, and the clubhouse is currently getting overhauled. The flower beds are always well kept and they did a great job of salting the sidewalks this winter. Safety: Just yesterday the lights in the hallways were replaced with more and brighter bulbs. For the most part, the parking lots are well-lit, but there are a few places behind garages and towards the back of the property that are a bit dark. Sidewalks are always clear. Neighborhood: You cannot beat the location of this apartment complex. You are walking distance from New Hope Commons and bus lines, but you are nestled back far enough that it remains peaceful and quiet. I really enjoy being halfway between 15/501 and Erwin. Turn left out of the complex and you're right in the middle of shopping central and close to the highway. Turn right out of the complex and you're traveling down country roads. Also, not being right on either campus means that the grounds are not overrun with tons of undergraduate students. Maintenance: I've only had to report a few maintenance requests and all of them have been addressed promptly and the problems were solved. A lot of people are complaining about the valet trash service. I'd like to state that when I renewed my lease that I was able to opt out of this service, but am enjoying it. Staff: Yes, we all miss the old staff. But the new staff is just as friendly, especially Stephanie, Charles, and Bianca! They treat residents to social events and other surprises in the office. Just yesterday, Brett - the regional manager - introduced himself to me while I was working in the business center. The staff are concerned about their residents and want genuine feedback.
When Hawthorne took over in July 2014, it was bit of a shock. We did not receive a heads up. I think for many who were still trying to wrap their heads around it all, the changes were not welcomed. At first, I was hesitant to what seemed like an aggressive takeover. But I say with confidence now that I am welcoming the changes and love where I live just as much if not more so than when I first moved in 3 years ago. Noise: Not sure if more or less stars is good for noise, but I do know is that noise has never been a problem. Grounds: I am rating the grounds based on their current state; under construction. All of the buildings were recently painted, the parking lots were sealed and repainted, and the clubhouse is currently getting overhauled. The flower beds are always well kept and they did a great job of salting the sidewalks this winter. Safety: Just yesterday the lights in the hallways were replaced with more and brighter bulbs. For the most part, the parking lots are well-lit, but there are a few places behind garages and towards the back of the property that are a bit dark. Sidewalks are always clear. Neighborhood: You cannot beat the location of this apartment complex. You are walking distance from New Hope Commons and bus lines, but you are nestled back far enough that it remains peaceful and quiet. I really enjoy being halfway between 15/501 and Erwin. Turn left out of the complex and you're right in the middle of shopping central and close to the highway. Turn right out of the complex and you're traveling down country roads. Also, not being right on either campus means that the grounds are not overrun with tons of undergraduate students. Maintenance: I've only had to report a few maintenance requests and all of them have been addressed promptly and the problems were solved. A lot of people are complaining about the valet trash service. I'd like to state that when I renewed my lease that I was able to opt out of this service, but am enjoying it. Staff: Yes, we all miss the old staff. But the new staff is just as friendly, especially Stephanie, Charles, and Bianca! They treat residents to social events and other surprises in the office. Just yesterday, Brett - the regional manager - introduced himself to me while I was working in the business center. The staff are concerned about their residents and want genuine feedback. Read less

Soon all the projects are going to come together and be fabulous. We will celebrate together as a community and have an awesome summertime! Again, we are thankful for your courteous and complimentary review. Gratefully yours, The Flats @55Twelve Management Team

Report
Resident
2014 Not Recommended Reviewed 04/06/2015
This was once a nice place to live until July 2014. Everything changed, even the name changed, when Hawthorne bought the property or took it over or whatever. I will save all my complaints and get right to the point. I had to quit my teaching job and break my lease early to move home to Charlotte to take care of my mom. I did everything they asked me to do...two month's notice and two month's rent. I left there on 4 Nov 14 with an assurance that all was square. I did not owe them any more money. On 3 Dec 14, I received a bill in the mail stating I owed "The Flats" another month's rent and a termination fee. I was floored. I couldn't believe I had been lied to by what I thought was a reputable group of people. I called immediately and left two messages. No one returned my calls in December. I got busy over the intervening months with my mom and starting a new job back home. In March of 2015, I learn by U.S. mail that I have been turned over to a collection agency for the Dec. rent and a termination fee that I did not know existed until December. "The Flats" now claim I owe them almost $1000.00! I called a week ago Sunday (29 Mar 15) and was told that this issue would be "researched" and I would receive a call by Friday, 3 Apr 15. Of course, the call has not come and probably will not. This has caused me much distress as I value my credit rating and good name. "The Flats" are operated by liars and cheats who are money hungry and care nothing for the human beings who live or have lived on their property. I did right by these people and they stabbed me in the back and did the very thing I was most afraid they would do to me...lie, ignore me, and turn me over to a collection agency. I rated the property below as fairly as I could comparing it to how it used to be when it was the Evergreens at Mt Moriah.

Verified Manager04/07/2015

Please contact me directly concerning your situation. My email address is bbailey@hrpliving.com and I will be happy to look into this for you.

How was this review?
Useful
Thanks for voting!
Report
Resident
2014 - 2015 Not Recommended Reviewed 04/02/2015
I would highly discourage anyone from moving to this facility. The front office staff refuses to fix any issues within the house unless you threaten them. They make excuse after excuse about how the problems within the house are not their fault. If you choose to live here, do NOT be on the 3rd floor. The roofs on multiple buildings leak water into the home. This has lead to mold and mildew problems. So if you have allergies, be cautious. They make claims that they have volleyball and tennis courts. However, I do not think they have been maintained in years. The sand is hard and weeds are growing through the sand and cracks in the tennis courts. Very misleading to say that these are even remotely usable. As for the "upgraded gym," they essentially took out the weight machines and added a few bad pieces if cardio equipment. For those that only do cardio, this gym is actually very nice. However, for anybody that enjoys a full body workout, it is not possible. While the staff may be friendly upfront and to your face, they clearly do not care about anyones individual needs. Trying to speak with the property manager took over a week as she was "too busy with contractors." She was on site but did NOT have the time of day to talk to me for 10 minutes about health concerns in my home that was due to their neglect and lack of structural intelligence. The apartments are gross and dirty. The appliances are not in working order and the maintenance can take as long as 5 months to be looked at. The front office staff is an embarrassment. Extremely disappointed with this experience. I have requested that The Flats at 55Twelve be removed from any university housing lists in the area. I will be contacting Hawthorne Properties to hopefully have some real and useful changes made.
I would highly discourage anyone from moving to this facility. The front office staff refuses to fix any issues within the house unless you threaten them. They make excuse after excuse about how the problems within the house are not their fault. If you choose to live here, do NOT be on the 3rd floor. The roofs on multiple buildings leak water into the home. This has lead to mold and mildew problems. So if you have allergies, be cautious. They make claims that they have volleyball and tennis courts. However, I do not think they have been maintained in years. The sand is hard and weeds are growing through the sand and cracks in the tennis courts. Very misleading to say that these are even remotely usable. As for the "upgraded gym," they essentially took out the weight machines and added a few bad pieces if cardio equipment. For those that only do cardio, this gym is actually very nice. However, for anybody that enjoys a full body workout, it is not possible. While the staff may be friendly upfront and to your face, they clearly do not care about anyones individual needs. Trying to speak with the property manager took over a week as she was "too busy with contractors." She was on site but did NOT have the time of day to talk to me for 10 minutes about health concerns in my home that was due to their neglect and lack of structural intelligence. The apartments are gross and dirty. The appliances are not in working order and the maintenance can take as long as 5 months to be looked at. The front office staff is an embarrassment. Extremely disappointed with this experience. I have requested that The Flats at 55Twelve be removed from any university housing lists in the area. I will be contacting Hawthorne Properties to hopefully have some real and useful changes made. Read less

12

bluebirdnc 04/06/2015

Customer service is NOT their #1 focus. The almighty dollar is. I was told that &quot;it all comes down to the money&quot; by one of their many recent managers. What didn't &quot;The Flats&quot; focus on their tenants and the maintenance of the property they had before starting all these upgrades?

Verified Manager04/02/2015

Thank you for stopping by to review our property. My name is Brett Bailey and I am the Regional Manager for the Flats at 55 Twelve. I would love to correspond with you concerning any issues that are currently outstanding in your apartment or at the community in general. Many upgrades are currently taking place, including fitness center upgrades (they are focused on cardio, however, free weights are still available), pool upgrades, and a full clubhouse renovation. Additional upgrades are upcoming and we hope that you enjoy those as well. Customer service and resident retention are our #1 focus at all Hawthorne Residential Partners properties and I would love to discuss this with you and resolve any outstanding issues that you may have. Please reach out to me directly at bbailey@hrpliving.com. Thank you.

Report
Resident
2014 - 2015 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/05/2015
We lived here for a little over a year, and I must say we haven't run into any major problems although we've had several maintenance issues. Bobby in Maintenance has made sure every single issue has been fixed. He's very nice, swift, professional and went down the list to solve whatever we were dealing with. Find him if you have an issue with your apartment. Surely living in an apartment things aren't always going to be perfect. There are a lot of changes going on around here, including with the staff. To our surprise we just learned Stephanie the asst manager is no longer here, and now there's yet another manager in the office I wonder why. This is about the 4th manager since Hawthorne took over. We like Bianca, she's good. There are definitely a number of us who miss the old staff, but in life things change from time to time. Just hope the property manager has time to tend to resident issues, because customer service doesn't seem to be a focus of hers. It's a nice neighborhood, great location just not so sure of some of the people they're allowing to live here. They're changing all of the landscaping, where are all the flowers!! Change can be good, but change with no purpose means nothing. Hoping they have purpose with all the changes, and not just about revenue. You have to care about the (Residents) who live at this property, and those who will make this their home in the future.

Report
Resident
2014 - 2015 Not Recommended Reviewed 02/19/2015
Also look at "Evergreens at Mt. Moriah" - they recently changed the name (I think they want to avoid the bad reviews). DO NOT RENT FROM HERE. This place is a mess. I moved in just around the time of the new ownership, and if I had known what I know today, I would not have moved in. Now, there are some pros (which I'll list below), but for the most part, the cons win. Not all the issues of the community are at the hand of the property teams - the people who live here are also part of the problem. There is litter all over the place, they think the trash/recycle area is a dumping ground (literally - recently someone dumped furniture and a washer/dryer set), they horde, which goes out onto their patios, cigarette butts are all over the place, and most of all NO ONE pick ups their dog poo. It is everywhere. I feel really sorry for the kids trying to play. This is a slovenly community. As far a the property management that is a mess too. While I'm happy they are trying to do some upgrades, and respect the effort, they fail to communicate these upgrades to the tenants - sometimes not all, but if they do, it's with about 1 day notice. They expect tenants to respond quickly and be cheery about it. What's more, they start these project and either 1) don't finish them, or 2) are so delayed that the community is sitting around waiting for them to finish. Let's just say if I treated my paying clients like this, I'd be fired. Don't even get me started on the lack of lighting at night (a real safety issue for women). It's all summed up in the fact that they can't keep an employee. The turnover of the onsite staff is sad. As a side note, the apartments are all dated...makes making breakfast fun when the stove is lopsided, or the doors open b/c the whole floor is slanted. Everything about the management of this property is mediocre at best. Mediocrity is the standard. Pros: Bobby the maintenance guy - prideful in his work Not to noisy Competitive rent Cons: Management staff (the worst communicators - don't return calls/emails) Communication of community upgrades by staff Dog poo EVERYWHERE Dated apartments Litter-filled community Start projects but don't finish them

nature#1happy 05/04/2015

True .. management never responds to email or calls... so tired of trash in the breezeways... this is going to be an awful summer with trash out 24/7... it is embarrassing to take company on a walk.... looks like a section 8 complex. Bobby in maintenance is great... he was here when it was the Evergreens. During the Christmas Holidays it was the first time we could not have Holiday company.... litter all over.. painting and so called power washing... that was a joke... who does that during the Holidays.. or the winter for that matter... took forever. When we called about the litter it was the usual excuse. So we ended picking it up ourselves.... Miss the old management that answered every call and email and truly cared about the people living here... they would never have let trash sit in the breezeways like this.

bluebirdnc 04/06/2015

I agree that the tenants do dump garbage and junk on the property. On Monday mornings, the place around the dumpsters look like a landfill. I also agree that the management has turned over so many times and so often there should be a revolving door in the office. Communication is awful. We learned of the name change by seeing it mentioned on a piece of 8.5 x 11 piece of paper Scotch taped to the wall. I was away a lot in the summer of 2014 but heard that the paving of the parking lot was madness. People were given less than a 7 day notice of moving their vehicles (again on a piece of taped 8.5 x 11 piece of paper) for the paving. Some had their vehicles towed. Now I am having issues with management trying to swindle me out of almost $1000 after I have already moved out early, followed all their directions for breaking my contract early, double checking that we were all square before I left (I had to break my lease early to move home to care for my sick mother). Now, they have not returned my calls and have turned me over to a collection agency out of Dallas Texas. Don't be fooled by the manager's response at the bottom. That is how they operate...oh so gracious to your face then lie and stab you in the back. I am so glad the other writer has taken them off the UNC apartment finder!

anonymous 03/28/2015

That was a perfect response by the management. They are very nice and pleasant up front, but when it comes to taking care of any needs, it is all excuses. I have been walked in on twice by the maintenance crew. Despite this, they did not actually address the problem. Dealing with the front office is like pulling teeth. They put on a front and say your concern is important to them, then make you wait weeks for simple solutions. Sadly, they speak of an &quot;upgrade&quot; to the gym, when in reality, they removed most of the weights and lifting equipment to make the room look bigger. I am most certainly moving and will never recommend this place to anyone. I already had it removed from the UNC apartment finder documents. They may be trying to upgrade by redoing the parking lot and painting the houses, but this has taken 5 months and is still going on. They threatened to tow cars that are in the way for the parking lot construction. Which would be ok if not for giving just 2 days notice. Some people do leave town for more than 2 days at a time by the way. I cannot wait to leave. Only 2 months away!!!

Verified Manager02/19/2015

Dear Resident, The entire team apologizes for not meeting your expectations. We have been earnestly working towards improving these conditions including hiring a fulltime Groundsperson and implementing a "Pardon Our Construction" Communication Campaign attempting to notify residents in a more timely manner updates on renovations. Unfortunately, weather has also been a factor in delays. Cleanliness in our community is very important to us. We try to hold any violators responsible for pet waste and trash. Thank you for raising these issues and helping us to correct these matters so that we can be a success at The Flats at 55Twelve. Hawthorne Residential Partners cares about the safety and well being of its residents and employees. We have taken immediate steps toward resolving the lighting issues. Please contact the Property Manager so that we can further discuss any other matters of importance that you may have. We appreciate your giving us this opportunity to regain your confidence and trust. We care about our residents and do try to make a positive impact each day to ensure our residents can enjoy their homes. Best regards, Your Flats at 55Twelve Management Team

Report
Resident
2006 - 2015 Recommended Property Reviewed 01/17/2015
This is for the Flats at 55Twelve formally The Evergreens at Mt. Moriah, Durham, NC I've lived at the Evergreens 8 1/2 years. It has a great location, close to shopping, restaurants, Grocery stores. Lots of Duke, UNC, and other students live here. They keep the place clean, well taken care of the Pool, Gym workout. Well, all that started changing July 2014 when the Evergreens was sold to NEW Owners and ALL new Mgmt. It all went down hill as you can see the past reviews back to August 2014. Don't get me wrong the staff work hard especially the Maintenance crew, most noted Bobby he's been great for the past several years. The property is managed by Hawthorne Residential Partners. The primary problems seem to be caused by communication the New Owners and Hawthorne Residential Partners. The owners mean well I'm sure but they plan and schedule changes without much time for the Hawthorne Residential Partners Mgmt.to communicate it to the Most Importance people, The Tenants that live here every day and some cases years. I wont go into details but has caused unhappy residents and the staff who does their best. But, we've lost a Resident Manager, office staff, and even the maintenance Supervisor because of the issues and problems. Sure I've thought about moving, but I understand why most of the management problems are Not the Office personnel fault. And I've lived here almost 9 years now. I just wanted to give my onion here to point out starting in July 2014 most of the problems started. Oh, I almost forgot they changed the name to The Flats at 55 twelve Mt. Moriah. I'll always remember how great The Evergreens at Mt Moriah was and lives on in lots of people who came and went.

11

Verified Manager02/19/2015

Dear Resident, We are so happy that overall you have been satisfied with living at our community for 8 1/2 years. We agree it is a great location, beautiful setting and has nice amenities. It's exciting that we are renovating to make things even better for the years to come! Our residents are our treasured neighbors and we do care about your needs. Thank you for choosing to stay with us! A number of factors influence staff turnover and some times it is unavoidable. Yes, it is unusual to have that amount of turnover in that time period but can happen in today's economics and the transient area that we live in. Hawthorne Residential Partners did utilize some regional support staff on rotation, while interviewing to fill the positions. We are fortunate to have such support availability in our area. It helps during times of transition or when additional staffing is needed to meet the residents needs. We have hired a new Property Manager, Maintenance Supervisor and a Groundsperson. They are committed to Hawthorne Residential Partners philosophy, "Live the Difference" and happy to have the opportunity to work and live at such a fabulous community! Thank you again for sharing and being a good neighbor. Your Team at The Flats at 55Twelve

Report
Resident
2014 Not Recommended Reviewed 12/30/2014
I've heard that this apartment complex was nice "in the good olds days." Four problems NOW - and there are just my first impressions: 1. The gym is not quite as advertised and has the most bizarre of policies. Moved in, was told that there was a working gym and that towels would be available. Treadmills works sometimes; other times not. The towels are almost never there. Do yoga in the morning for all of the mommies that want it. Or do it somewhere other than the gym. Don't do it after work. Come on. Why should three people stretching their fannies keep us from exercising at 6:30-7:30pm on Tuesday night? This is ridiculous. It must change. 2. Maintenance is woefully understaffed. For many months, there was just one full time maintenance employee. How could this be possible at a property this size? 3. Personnel/staff changes about as often as your bipolar grandmother's mood. The on-site manager recently quit/transferred, after only a couple of months on the job. Some other young lady was fired. One maintenance guy recently quit and another went somewhere else. There is no continuity at this property. 4. There's been talk about raising our trash fee by 30 some odd dollars. I've already heard some of the residents with legal degrees talk about forming a class action if management goes through with this. Can YOU do better? Yeah; I think so.

I love the yoga class. It's one of the great perks of living here and the reason I decided to move here three years ago.

Verified Manager02/19/2015

Dear Resident, We sincerely do want to apologize for the breakdown in having your needs meet and expectations exceeded. We regret any inconveniences or problems that you may have been caused. We have added additional staff to the Property Management Team and are working hard to correct these situations and are committed to providing you with the highest level of service simply because our customers deserve the very best. Again, we are sorry for any of our mistakes and appreciate your patience as we continue to train and improve our service to our residents. Our management team wants our residents to feel comfortable and happy in their homes. Please reach out to the Property Management Team to discuss further as needed if any requests have not been completed and any others that may arise. Thank you for sharing and choosing The Flats at 55Twelve as your home. The Flats at 55Twelve Management Team

Report
Resident
2012 - 2014 Not Recommended Reviewed 11/13/2014
I generally am not one to write reviews, especially on apartments. I have lived in many apartment complexes before, and this is by far the worst experience I've ever had. The complex was great with old management; it was privately owned and the staff was fantastic. As soon as management changed, everything went downhill and fast. First of all, and most importantly, rent has increased significantly...and I am guessing they did this so they can make all of these unnecessary "renovations" like repaving our lots and repainting the buildings. Second, they are adding this "trash valet" charge onto our monthly rent for $25. Third, they are very poor at telling tenants about changes being made. I am an easy going person and very flexible when it comes to change, but this change of new property management has been a nightmare. I am definitely planning on moving out as soon as my lease ends. **Something to note: prior to the new management company, the ratings on this website for this apartment were superb, with almost 90% of people recommending it. That's a pretty big red flag, don't move here.
I generally am not one to write reviews, especially on apartments. I have lived in many apartment complexes before, and this is by far the worst experience I've ever had. The complex was great with old management; it was privately owned and the staff was fantastic. As soon as management changed, everything went downhill and fast. First of all, and most importantly, rent has increased significantly...and I am guessing they did this so they can make all of these unnecessary "renovations" like repaving our lots and repainting the buildings. Second, they are adding this "trash valet" charge onto our monthly rent for $25. Third, they are very poor at telling tenants about changes being made. I am an easy going person and very flexible when it comes to change, but this change of new property management has been a nightmare. I am definitely planning on moving out as soon as my lease ends. **Something to note: prior to the new management company, the ratings on this website for this apartment were superb, with almost 90% of people recommending it. That's a pretty big red flag, don't move here. Read less

I think they were just breaking up a party, but still...residents should be informed of such things.

anonymous 02/11/2015

Report
Resident
2014 Not Recommended Reviewed 10/29/2014
Anyone who is interested in this apartment complex, please also research "The Evergreens at Mt. Moriah". The is the name before the apartment changed hands a few months ago. I guess the management thinks once they change the name, no one will ever know how this once very friendly and resident-oriented community has become. I am a current resident and I would advise anyone to think twice before you sign your lease. Unless, you are happy with ever-changing policy, hidden and unannounced fees, and one day waking up with the old name of the apartment has gone. There are a lot apartment with newer amenities and cheaper rent near by. I can profess that as I am invited to my co-workers' places often. Think twice before you come here. I would. It is always wise to research extensively before you move in a place. Otherwise, it will be so much pain. If you do not think this post is legitimate. Come to visit the site in an unexpected time, maybe 5 or 6 pm or 8 or 9am for the overnight shift folks. Talk to the resident (especially those who live here more than 3 months), ask them how they feel about the new management, the water bill (my bill is 4 or 5 times more since the transfer, it turned out my water meter is broken and they have been charging me whatever they like), the unannounced trash fee and bill processing fee. Bill processing fee, I have never heard anything like that in my life. Anyway, my advice, think twice and research well. Remember, the old name is "the Evergreens at Mt. Moriah".

Report
Resident
2014 - 2015 Not Recommended Reviewed 10/11/2014
Its surprising to see how this apartment manages their review & rate, after changing the name from Evergreens at Mt. Moriah. I have a bad memory of this apartment. I could have stayed longer at US if I was not that disappointed with this apartment. First of all, they refused to steam clean saying that I was late to report to the office. Would you rent an apartment whose carpet is all dusty and stained without steam cleaning before you get in? Secondly, what stunned me was the power transmission tower soaring above the pond. I was expecting a beautiful pond after seeing the picture on the homepage. They had generator very near my apartment too. As I believed transmission tower is related to cancer, I was not comfortable while staying there. The third reason I moved out was the unreasonable water bill. I pay now half of the bill with my family. I was staying by myself at that time. The last thing I want to say is that my things were gone after the maintenance man came over in my absence. Nobody will believe that Bobby, the only man that everyone including me trusted at this apartment took my things. He didn't fix anything until I finally left. Anyone could come in to the apartment as they have keys. This fact horrified me specially at night time. The idea that US respects privacy was wrong. They still have not returned my deposit money which is only $100.- My message to the apartment management office: please consider tenants, who are mostly poor graduate students or internationals as human beings. Instead of decorating the external apartment, please ask what they need including cleaning laundry room and the broken inside of the apartment. No more fake smile but hire professionals for maintenance. Are you really concerned about your tenants?
Its surprising to see how this apartment manages their review & rate, after changing the name from Evergreens at Mt. Moriah. I have a bad memory of this apartment. Nobody will believe that Bobby, the only man that everyone including me trusted at this apartment took my things. He didn't fix anything until I finally left. Anyone could come in to the apartment as they have keys. This fact horrified me specially at night time. The idea that US respects privacy was wrong. They still have not returned my deposit money which is only $100.- My message to the apartment management office: please consider tenants, who are mostly poor graduate students or internationals as human beings. Instead of decorating the external apartment, please ask what they need including cleaning laundry room and the broken inside of the apartment. No more fake smile but hire professionals for maintenance. Are you really concerned about your tenants? Read less

Dear Resident, We are working diligently alongside Ocius to correct any issues with the water meters. We do not want anyone paying more for water than necessary, and certainly not for more than they are using. We would love to be able to explain our efforts in more detail; please stop by the office so that we can discuss what our progress on this issue looks like. -The Evergreens Staff

thiss place continues to go downhill. they Schedule evening "yoga" when normal people want to use the gym (in the evening after work). they don't announce any of this. WTF!!!!!!!!!! DON'T SCHEDULE EVENING YOGA. THIS IS SO ANNOYING. YOGA IS FOR WEENIES. they Pave driveway and give 1 day notice and provide no map to residents of where this will be (instead, you need to hunt down a map, because the written instructions in their notice are wrong). they tow away everyone else. don't fix the gym equipment they've been promising for months to replace. start charging ridiculous fees for trash thraty r much higher then old ones. wnhy am i paying more for a bill that never arrives? fire alartms outside of building go off unexpectedly and wont turn off. how to sleep? they change the name to something that reminds me of a detroit ghetto: "The Flats @ 55TWELVE" my hubbie and i are gonna move next month. thank god.

5

anonymous 10/11/2014

Actually, yoga has been happening for the last 6 years, starting under the old management. It used to be every week; now it is every other week (with alternate weeks at Hawthorne at the View). The schedule is posted in the gym. It is only 1 hour every other Tuesday. I LOVE yoga, it is the reason I moved here three years ago. It's one of the great perks of living here.

evergreensapts@hrpliving.com 10/11/2014

Dear Resident, We are happy to share the schedule for yoga with you; it is also posted in the gym if you need it. As to the paving: We apologize for the short notice; we tried to give as much notice as we could and apologize for the inconveniences the late notice caused. We are not towing anyone away, cars that are left in the designated paving area are being moved to areas that are not marked for paving that day. We would love to talk to you in more details about the valet trash we are implementing, the steps we are taking to resolve any issues throughout the community, and what the name change is going to look like when it takes effect in November. Please stop by the office to speak to us! -The Evergreens Staff

Report
Resident
2012 - 2014 Not Recommended Reviewed 10/07/2014
First and foremost we will not be renewing our lease. My wife and I have lived here for a while, and our experiences both with this new company have sucked! We're headed out of town this week and to our surprise we have to rearrange our planned trip because they are having the parking lots repaved. Great! Problem is, we just found this out yesterday and they have already started. We are now trying to figure out where and for how long to put both of our vehicles on such a short notice. Why not tell us before the day it happens? This place is nuts. My wife checked the mail 3 days in a row looking for our new combined "rent and water" statement. Of course, it was not there. If you don't pay on time, then they are quick to band down a bunch of fees. Which in this case we already feel as though we are being robbed! They threatened to have our vehicles towed "at owners' expenses", and will threaten you if you don't pay rent on time. How about sending the damn bill on time? I went to the office one day to pick up a package, and to discuss details on our lease, and it was as if I was an after-thought. They are so rude, very, very, very unorganized and inconsiderate. We used to frequent the clubhouse during a time when we felt welcomed, and right at home. The previous staff was more than welcome to assist you in whatever reason you were there. Not it has changed and become totally different for the worse. It makes no sense because no one is happy out here; and them the staff have on blinders. We like so many miss the old staff! They weren't perfect, but who is these days? They were great! Those staffs were the reason we chose to live here. This new company even changed the name of the community and did not even bother to tell anyone. What is next?? We really don't care to know. Not sure why everyone from the previous staff is gone except for one member and his name is Bobby. He's prompt, he's professional, he communicates well, he goes beyond the call of duty, and he always gets his job done and never complains. He rocks!! I even see this guy running around on weekends. Glad they decided to keep him around; because like many of us, we appreciate Bobby being here dearly. The new staff doesn't seem very friendly that includes the staff in the office and this other new tall guy who never speaks. Reconsider your options before choosing to live here. After marriage we were in the perfect community living a dream, in the perfect area being as though my wife commutes to school isn't very far at all. Now we are currently living in a nightmare, and both hope to be woken up sooner rather than later!!!

evergreensapts@hrpliving.com 10/10/2014

Dear Resident, We apologize that you feel your experience has been less that satisfactory. We are working to make sure everyone's needs are met and taken care of in a timely and kind fashion. We attempted to get the notice out about the paving as soon as we were given the notice, we apologize that it came at so late of a date. No cars will be towed at anyone's expense. Cars that are left in the designated paving area each day are being relocated to other areas on the property with as little hassle as possible. As to the name change -the change will not officially be changing until November 1st- but we also understand how difficult this period of transition is for everyone involved. We are striving to make the transition as easy as possible for our residents. If you would like to discuss these or other matters in further detail, please come visit us in the office and we will be happy to have a conversation with you. -The Evergreens Staff

Report
Resident
2013 - 2014 Not Recommended Reviewed 10/07/2014
Change is hard on some people, that's understandable. However, this is not the issue here. Numerous, unnecessary cosmetic changes have been promised to be made, while the necessary changes have been untouched. The new name "The Flats @ 55Twelve" is the newest unnecessary change. I think they were trying to be all hip, I'm not sure, but it missed the mark. It sounds like the name of a public housing project. I refuse to tell anyone I live at "The Flats" (insert gang signs). I honestly would have not looked at this place twice if it were named The Flats. The new manager is nothing to write home about, although the other staff I have dealt with are nice and are trying. Hawthorne's hostile takeover can be likened to a dog pissing all over everything to make it theirs. I feel like I am being pissed on so that they can say "See, it's mine! New name - all mine! Going to make a new pool - mine mine mine". When the reality is, I don't care about your pool, or your new clubhouse, and neither do a lot of people. The things that do matter, (i.e. dog waste receptacle pickup, clean areas etc.) goes completely ignored because they are too busy pissing on it all. I am thrilled my lease is up sooner than later and I will not be renewing. If this is how Hawthorne does business, I'm clearly not interested. I did not apply to live in The Flats with a manager who is in desperate need of customer service training, and dog waste baking in the hot sun behind me while I am playing tennis; but here I am all the same. Not for long.

Report
Resident
2014 Not Recommended Reviewed 10/07/2014
I posted a review few months ago when I first moved in. I was a happy camper then but everything changed. I find myself upset and annoyed when I come back home. Hard to relax and feeling angry and on guard most of the time. This new management is very disappointing. I have a lot to say but for one, I was awaken 7am this morning for this stupid and absurd parking lot thing. I was told rudely by the staff to move my car as they need to do stuff on it. We were not notified until Sunday night (Tuesday morning now) and I worked 12 hour shift that day. I feel like I am in a twilight zone. Where am I now? Am I living in a concentration camp? Am I supposed to stay by home and be ready for anything they like to do? How am I going to make a living and pay my rent if I do so? Don't get me started with my absurd water bill. I am exhausted for now, and I will write more when I recuperate. I love the location and the convenience but I feel like the management is making it harder and harder for me to stay. I guess I just need to start looking. Look further if you want to have a stress free environment! P.S. I just realized they changed the apartment name from Evergreens at Mt. Moriah into "The Flats @ 55TWELVE". I was not informed and I just happened to look out when I drove back to my apartment. Does it sound fishy and strange anyone? I have been telling people where I live, now the place does not even exist? Why was there a change? Was it because the recent rating for Evergreens is so bad that they have to have a clean slate? I am in shock and very puzzled.

We will not be charging anyone if we need to move their cars for paving purposes. As to the name change -we understand that the time of transition is difficult and we thank you for your patience as we cross this bridge as a community. We encourage you to come in to the office if you have any further concerns or would like to speak to us in more detail. -The Evergreens Staff

Report
Resident
2009 - 2014 Not Recommended Reviewed 10/03/2014
We have lived here for a long time. I don't want to stay the exact amount of time for fear they may punish us with some weird fees or something for our not so pleasant feedback but when I say a long time, I mean more than just a few years. Our plan was to stay for at least a few more. I have never thought about leaving until now. Of course we miss Natalie, Damon, Victoria, and all the staff members that left. The change was so abrupt we didn't even get a chance to say goodbye. We were away over the summer. Those people felt like family. I can't say that the new staff is good or bad because I am still very salty about them firing my people. My complaint is with the cleanliness of the neighborhood. The breezeways are overrun with spiderwebs, trash, dog poo and debris. Plain nasty and no one has cleaned since the new change. No one enforces the trash rules, and dogs are running around freely with no leash. The tennis court is being used as another dog park by tenants that do not care. I am convinced that anyone with the right amount of money gets approved because the neighborhood now has cars that ride through the parking lots playing loud booming music late at night. This was a quiet neighborhood for a long long time. It is not anymore. My new neighbor is trying to give me cancer. The amount of smoke in our breezeway should be illegal. That apartment will not be fit to rent once they move. Its a tobacco factory. I miss my old neighborhood. I looked forward to the Halloween party for the kids and then the adult costume party later that night. I loved the Christmas social with Santa Claus appearance. The annual yard sale, the Easter egg hunts. This place was a community of different cultures that came together and lived in harmony. I hate to make it sound like a utopia but that is what it was for us which is why we never thought about leaving. I hate the new name, I hate it all. I am sorry but look at some of the other apartment complexes because this place is not what it use to be. Hope the owner read these reviews and realize that some mistakes were made and make a real effort to right the wrongs.
