Report
Resident
2009 - 2014 Not Recommended Reviewed 10/03/2014
New Management are crooks and thieves. They did a hostile takeover of a good apartment complex with an excellent reputation and they are ruining everything while stealing as much money as they can before they run the whole operation into the ground. They repeatedly make mistakes on simple issues -- such as issuing correct leases, showing up to the wrong apartments for maintenance requests, charging the wrongs amounts, not doing things when they said they would do them. They are rude and childish: They constantly make excuses for things, blame old management for problems that are clearly their fault, WALK INTO MY APARTMENT WITHOUT EVEN KNOCKING. They are incompetent: Unable to respond to e-mails or take action via phone calls. The only way they do anything is if you confront them in person and show that you're really upset. And even then I think they only do it to get rid of you. They bungle important issues: Such as changing the apartment complex name without telling anybody -- appears we will now be called "The Flats @ 55twelve" which is the most stupid awful horrible name I think anyone could have every come up with and which reflects the awful stupidity of their management. They are crooks: They are now charging administrative and service fees charges that were NEVER stipulated in the lease. At one point they suggested they might do a trash service pickup but they lied about everything else with respect to when that charge might occur and also the amount to be charged. Furthermore, I logged onto my account on 9/30/14 to confirm there were no additional payments to be made. I wrote a check and deposited it this morning. Today I logged into check 10/03/14 and I notice there were charges posted LATER THAT DAY, on 9/30/14, which were also due that day. And so now I'll have late fees piled on that as well. U.n.b.e.l.i.e.v.a.b.l.e. Now I have to waste my time to get a lawyer and deal with this nonsense and put them in their place. It's just insane. Don't let the appearance fool you -- these are slum lords -- nothing more, nothing less. DO NOT MOVE HERE. I am leaving as soon as humanly possible now because of all of the anger and frustration they have caused.
New Management are crooks and thieves. They did a hostile takeover of a good apartment complex with an excellent reputation and they are ruining everything while stealing as much money as they can before they run the whole operation into the ground. They repeatedly make mistakes on simple issues -- such as issuing correct leases, showing up to the wrong apartments for maintenance requests, charging the wrongs amounts, not doing things when they said they would do them. They are rude and childish: They constantly make excuses for things, blame old management for problems that are clearly their fault, WALK INTO MY APARTMENT WITHOUT EVEN KNOCKING. They are incompetent: Unable to respond to e-mails or take action via phone calls. The only way they do anything is if you confront them in person and show that you're really upset. And even then I think they only do it to get rid of you. They bungle important issues: Such as changing the apartment complex name without telling anybody -- appears we will now be called "The Flats @ 55twelve" which is the most stupid awful horrible name I think anyone could have every come up with and which reflects the awful stupidity of their management. They are crooks: They are now charging administrative and service fees charges that were NEVER stipulated in the lease. At one point they suggested they might do a trash service pickup but they lied about everything else with respect to when that charge might occur and also the amount to be charged. Furthermore, I logged onto my account on 9/30/14 to confirm there were no additional payments to be made. I wrote a check and deposited it this morning. Today I logged into check 10/03/14 and I notice there were charges posted LATER THAT DAY, on 9/30/14, which were also due that day. And so now I'll have late fees piled on that as well. U.n.b.e.l.i.e.v.a.b.l.e. Now I have to waste my time to get a lawyer and deal with this nonsense and put them in their place. It's just insane. Don't let the appearance fool you -- these are slum lords -- nothing more, nothing less. DO NOT MOVE HERE. I am leaving as soon as humanly possible now because of all of the anger and frustration they have caused. Read less

Report
Resident
2013 - 2014 Recommended Property Reviewed 09/23/2014
My husband and I have lived here for 16 months. Yes, it was a definitely a change when Hawthorne Management took over (we truly loved the old staff!); however, when issues pop-up with the new management, we go to them immediately, and they are able to address and fix the issues right away. Instead of complaining about the issues on this website, we go directly to the source, and they help make things better. Hawthorne may have gotten off to a bit of a rocky start but improvements are already occurring -- change is good, people -- let's embrace it. Stephanie, Jessie, Andrea, and John are a really lovely staff, who are trying to make the transition as smooth as possible for all of us. From the looks of the upgrades coming our way, Evergreens is going to continue to be a very nice place to live, if not better. We look forward to being a part of it all!

Resident
2012 - 2014 Not Recommended Reviewed 09/04/2014
I'm joining the other voices here of tenants who are extremely upset about the hike in my water bill and also the fake "bill processing" fee. My new bill is 72% higher than my usual rate. It's terrible what has happened to this place with this new management team. Up until they took over, it was great - but now, it's awful. I hope that future renters pay close attention to the extreme anger - you don't want to live in a place that will make up fake fees and charges in order to profit from you. I can't even imagine how much they intend on going up on the rent when it comes to the next lease signing. I have no intention of staying here under this management. In addition to the highway robbery, I haven't seen any of these so-called renovations. Instead, what I see is filthy dirty walkways (the old management power washed them every few months),and a cancellation of regular pest control (that was in our leases - so they've broken our lease agreement). They must think we're completely stupid. Instead of these services, they put up shiny balloons every now and again. No doubt they'll somehow find a way to charge us for the balloons. Do yourself a favor and find another place to make your home. A place where you'll be treated like a valued tenant, and not like an idiot victim whose main function is to be sucked dry by these vultures.

anonymous 10/07/2014

evergreensapts@hrpliving.com 09/13/2014

Dear Resident, We apologize for all the confusion with Pest Control and the water bill! We do still have a pest control specialist on property every Tuesday. They rotate spraying the exteriors of the buildings every week, and if you ever run into an interior issues, let us know! Our specialist will attend to it the following Tuesday. Again, we apologize for not making that more clear. As far as the water bill, we have implemented no new fees. The previous company also charged a bill processing fee, they just didn't call it that. The water is all submetered, so you are paying for what your using, and no more. If you'd like to stop by the office, we'd be happy to explain in more detail. Thank you for your feedback, The Evergreens Staff.

Report
Resident
2013 - 2014 Not Recommended Reviewed 08/29/2014
DO NOT MOVE HERE. I moved to Evergreens in Oct 2013, very deliberately moving here because of the former amazing office and maintenance staff (all of whom were let go when OPM/Hawthorne took over early July 2014) and the fact that it was INDEPENDENTLY OWNED AND OPERATED by an excellent staff (after some bad experiences of my own and others I know with poor property management by these big management companies, such as Hawthorne, in the NC and Triangle area). Since the transition to the larger Hawthorne company (I have friends in other complexes who have already had poor experiences with them), everything has gone downhill. Like two of the previous (honest) reviews from the past few months, Hawthorne has lowered the standards of what made Evergreens worth the slightly inflated price of living here. You can probably tell the generic reviews on this site that somehow started beginning in July, when Hawthorne took over, of 'the nice office staff, great apartments' - don't be fooled by these, the majority of which you can easily guess are done by the new property managers. The response to utility or apartment issues used to be handled immediately and kindly - completely different now. They don't even empty the dog waste cans, which are rancid and overflowing - previously there was minimal waste and no smell. Similar with the trash. Yet they are increasing and requiring any dog to even visit your home to be DNA tested and lots of extra charges. Even pre-arranging issues to be taken care of with the office staff (ie lease renewal, general administrative items) results in a completely bungled, slow, and rude process. I am very disappointed in the downturn of this apartment, and so quickly. I used to recommend for many of my friends to seriously consider Evergreens as a place to live - I would NEVER do this now. I will leave here as soon as I am able. How disappointing this happened.

This is the most expensive apartment I have lived in but this apartment has more features compared to the similarly priced apartments in the nearby areas. The office staff will go above and beyond to make you feel welcome. One day, the office staff gave out breakfasts. The manager is extremely sincere in keeping in touch via email and the maintainence staff is very polite and competant. They gladly fulfilled some my requests to make the apartment more handicap accessible. I hope to have a pleasant stay here with my family during my educational program here in Chapel Hill.

I love going to the office, everyone is super friendly and helpful, they seem to be working towards making Evergreens more of a community. I have never seen a bug in my first floor apt. and any issues have been taken care of extremely fast. I hope to live here again when I move back to North Carolina. My one bedroom apt is spacious and I feel very safe here.

Report
Resident
2012 - 2014 Not Recommended Reviewed 08/16/2014
I've lived here for over two years and had really loved it. Under the old management, we had pest control come every three months - and I've never seen anything besides a few silverfish in my apartment. The grounds were tidy, and I felt like the management team cared. Now with the new management, within a few months, everything has gone downhill. They cancelled the pest control (and that was part of our rental agreement with the old management), the grounds and building maintenance has suffered, and now we got a notice that they are changing water companies - and they are combining our rent with the water bill. A whole bunch of us went onto the website for the new company, and it's all about making a profit for apartment owners. I know at least 6 of us who will move either before the lease is up, or when it's up, if they go up on the water - because it's a scam. If you pay the same price for water for almost three years, and then it goes up - COME ON - who are they kidding - do they think we're that stupid??? They try to deceive us by putting up shiny balloons and having food trucks come here, while they take away our benefits (pest control) and then try to squeeze more money out of us without raising the rent. If I were going to write a review last year, I would recommend that everyone come here. Now, with the new management - AVOID - they are scam artists who will make the management office look amazing, while they kick the renters in the face.

evergreensapts@hrpliving.com 09/13/2014

Dear Residnet, We apologize that there has been confusion over pest control and the water bill! Our pest control specialist is on property every Tuesday and rotates spraying the exterior of the buildings each week. If you ever have an interior problem, just let us know and our specialist will attend to it the following Tuesday. As far as the water bill, we would be happy to explain the details of the change to you! As far as the water bill is concerned, we'd love to explain it in more detail with you, so please stop by the office! We haven't added any fees that you weren't already being charged, they were just unamed with the previous company. All water is submetered, so you're only paying for what you use. Again, we'd love to explain further so please stop by the office any time! Thank you so much for your feedback! The Evergreens Staff.

I've lived at the Evergreens at Mt. Moriah Apartments for the previous 2 years and had an excellent experience! Even currently, with the new management by Hawthorne Residential Partners, they have been able to maintain a great living experience. When entering the office, workers are nice, friendly, and considerate. I would recommend Mt. Moriah for anyone interested in a housing experience with ample amounts of parking, great gym equipment, and pool area with grills and great landscaping. Great for young professionals or families wanting to be close to Duke University or UNC as well as close to major roads: 15-501 and Interstate 40. Very close to anything you may need!

Report
Resident
2014 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/12/2014
My wife and I lived here for a year and really enjoyed it! It is close to shopping yet not in the middle of a bunch of traffic. We could go to downtown Chapel Hill or downtown Durham in about 10-15 minutes and loved that Trader Joes was close by. Also, we have a dog and the dog park was near our apartment which was great for not having our own personal fenced in yard. We only had a few maintenance issues that were minor and the staff always was quick to respond. Also it was nice that they did preventative pest control sprays every few months to prevent bugs. Our neighbors were also very friendly and they had community parties every couple months. The staff was always friendly and helpful and made our experience definitely one to recommend. We had to move from the property for my new job in Cary, but out of all the places we lived, the Evergreens was the best!
My wife and I lived here for a year and really enjoyed it! It is close to shopping yet not in the middle of a bunch of traffic. 1

kdmoore86 05/03/2014

I agree that it is a very convient location to Chapel Hill and Durham and that the dog park is a nice ammedity. However, that is all that I agree on it. I had more issues with maintenance than I've ever had at an apartment complex. There were ton of issues throughout my stay. The too biggest issues for me are the fact that my apartment had to be "recleaned" prior to move-in due to improper cleaning before hand and the other being that I lived on the ground floor and had mildew and mold due to poor insulation.

How was this review?
Useful
Thanks for voting!
Report
Resident
2011 - 2013 Not Recommended Reviewed 04/08/2014
Horrible place to live. Major infestation. Mold, no insulation, high energy bills, fake care from staff about needs. Nothing gets resolved. Overpriced, a rip off.
Horrible place to live. Major infestation. Mold, no insulation, high energy bills, fake care from staff about needs. Nothing gets resolved. Overpriced, a rip off. Read less

Report
Resident
2013 - 2014 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/20/2014
Stayed here for about an year, had a great experience. Nice spacious apartments with a great pool, decent gym and other facilities which were really good. The service was really good, and maintenance was timely. Also the management personnel are very nice, courteous and remember you by name. There are a lot of community events for the major holidays, and other weekends too. Most of the other residents seem to be working professionals, a lot of families live here. Apartments themselves are clean and well-maintained, with great views of wooded areas. All the stores you need are nearby too.
Stayed here for about an year, had a great experience. Nice spacious apartments with a great pool, decent gym and other facilities which were really good. The service was really good, and maintenance was timely. Also the management personnel are very nice, courteous and remember you by name. There are a lot of community events for the major holidays, and other weekends too. Most of the other residents seem to be working professionals, a lot of families live here. Apartments themselves are clean and well-maintained, with great views of wooded areas. All the stores you need are nearby too. Read less

Report
Resident
2001 - 2014 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/13/2014
I have lived at the Evergreens for 10 years and I couldn't be happier. The grounds (especially where I am) are beautiful and the staff is always polite and attentive. I own a local business so I recognize the effort they put into all they do. We have a lovely community with a pool and clubhouse, workout center, tennis and volleyball. There are parties, movie nights, yoga classes - yippee!!! It's a fun, warm environment. I have a 2 bedroom, 2 bath (one with a garden tub) and a nice porch. The location is convenient to shopping and dining, etc. I would recommend(and have)the Evergreens to anyone. I attached some photos. One is a snowy day from my porch and another is a heron who comes every year to our pond. A sure sign of spring! I hope you find this review helpful to your search for a place to call home.
I have lived at the Evergreens for 10 years and I couldn't be happier. The grounds (especially where I am) are beautiful and the staff is always polite and attentive. I own a local business so I recognize the effort they put into all they do. We have a lovely community with a pool and clubhouse, workout center, tennis and volleyball. There are parties, movie nights, yoga classes - yippee!!! It's a fun, warm environment. I have a 2 bedroom, 2 bath (one with a garden tub) and a nice porch. The location is convenient to shopping and dining, etc. I would recommend(and have)the Evergreens to anyone. I attached some photos. One is a snowy day from my porch and another is a heron who comes every year to our pond. A sure sign of spring! I hope you find this review helpful to your search for a place to call home. Resident
2012 - 2014 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/12/2014
My wife and I have lived at the Evergreens for about two years now and we have enjoyed our time here. It is a very safe area, and close to shopping areas. Also right on border of Chapel Hill and very easy to travel to any of the points of the Triangle. The staff is wonderful and very friendly. They also have fun get togethers every couple of months, these of course are optional. Nice pool area and decent fitness area as well.
My wife and I have lived at the Evergreens for about two years now and we have enjoyed our time here. It is a very safe area, and close to shopping areas. Also right on border of Chapel Hill and very easy to travel to any of the points of the Triangle. The staff is wonderful and very friendly. They also have fun get togethers every couple of months, these of course are optional. Nice pool area and decent fitness area as well. Read less

Report
Resident
2012 - 2014 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/12/2014
I have lived at the Evergreens for a bit more than 2 years and love living here. I have a pleasant apartment that fits me perfectly. I wanted a place that was very safe as my prior living circumstance in Chapel Hill had repeated difficulties with safety. They have policeman living on the property which I like who patrol when they aren't working. One policeman lives in my building and is very nice. The staff are super!! They are friendly and helpful. Any maintenance problem is fixed immediately or at most the next day. They have replaced many things in my apt to make it just right and adjusted things for me since I am older and needed grab bars in the bathroom. They put up for me the handheld shower extender I like to use. The property is pretty with flowers, convenient to shopping, has a nice pool, small pond with gazebo, volleyball court, etc. The area surrounding it is nice to take a walk with an organic farm (Funny Girl Farm) just a short walk from here. My neighbors are very nice and they screen people who live here carefully. A PERFECT PLACE TO LIVE!!!!!!
I have lived at the Evergreens for a bit more than 2 years and love living here. I have a pleasant apartment that fits me perfectly. I wanted a place that was very safe as my prior living circumstance in Chapel Hill had repeated difficulties with safety. They have policeman living on the property which I like who patrol when they aren't working. One policeman lives in my building and is very nice. The staff are super!! They are friendly and helpful. Any maintenance problem is fixed immediately or at most the next day. They have replaced many things in my apt to make it just right and adjusted things for me since I am older and needed grab bars in the bathroom. They put up for me the handheld shower extender I like to use. The property is pretty with flowers, convenient to shopping, has a nice pool, small pond with gazebo, volleyball court, etc. The area surrounding it is nice to take a walk with an organic farm (Funny Girl Farm) just a short walk from here. My neighbors are very nice and they screen people who live here carefully. A PERFECT PLACE TO LIVE!!!!!! Read less

Report
Resident
2013 Recommended Property Reviewed 11/16/2013
I have lived in the Evergreens for roughly two years. Crime rate is good here. I have never had a problem, and have not noticed or heard of any problems either. I do notice that people on the balconies create noise, but have not had any problems with the noise. the community parties are nice, and a good way to meet neighborhood people. Not happy with all of the rent increases, but overall it is a nice place to stay. maintenance is not bad. the mold in the windows is super annoying. all in all the evergreens is a good place to stay if you would like a quiet environment.
I have lived in the Evergreens for roughly two years. Crime rate is good here. I have never had a problem, and have not noticed or heard of any problems either. I do notice that people on the balconies create noise, but have not had any problems with the noise. the community parties are nice, and a good way to meet neighborhood people. Not happy with all of the rent increases, but overall it is a nice place to stay. maintenance is not bad. the mold in the windows is super annoying. all in all the evergreens is a good place to stay if you would like a quiet environment. Report
Resident
2013 Recommended Property Reviewed 07/16/2013
I absolutely love it here and am baffled to read the previous post! I moved here recently after living in Manhattan (NYC) for 8 years so I know that that does make me a bit biased since NYC is a completely different experience than NC (NYC has teeny tiny apartments for outrageous amounts of money, sooo many safety issues, noise issues constantly...the list is endless), BUT I chose to live in those conditions because I loved the city and that's really what you get/have to deal with in NYC. Had I know that A PLACE LIKE EVERGREENS EXISTED, I probably would've made the journey South a LOT sooner!!! NC is an entirely different ballgame compared to my time living in various apartments in NYC and I knew that I was going to get more for my money down here but I had no idea it would be as wonderful as Evergreens - this is the nicest place I've lived bar-none! Meshell and Natalie in the leasing office are absolute SAINTS! Seriously, they should be canonized! Anytime I have a question or an issue, they handle it seamlessly, promptly and I am never treated as if I'm annoying, even though I know for a fact that I have been, according to my husband :). The leasing agents genuinely want to help the tenants and genuinely want us to have a lovely living experience. As soon as I met Meshell, I knew I would enjoy living at Evergreens because I'd finally be dealing with someone who worked so efficiently and all bundled up with a beautiful smile! Rental companies are notorious for being terrible to deal with so Meshell and Natalie and the rest of their team have truly broken the stereotype. The apartment itself is incredibly spacious and clean. It may not be all granite-countertopped-out with beautiful fixtures but it all works and if you decorate the right way, you can make the place a palace! I really love my 1-bedroom and have had so much fun furnishing it along with furnishing the balcony...speaking of the balcony - I overlook the pool and was initially worried that it would be too noisy but I have never ever had an issue. Sure, there may be occasional music when they throw a pool and/or movie party but all tenants are welcome to attend said gatherings and are given advance notice. The music ends at a totally respectable hour, too (I think there's only been 1 party since I've moved in). I have had friends and family visitor often and they are just as much in awe as me over this place (they all happen to be homeowners in Charleston, SC as well as Pittsburgh, PA) - so if a homeowner (of a really nice home) is jealous of MY apartment, then you know Evergreens is pretty great! The parking situation is perfect and I've had plenty of valuables in my car and have never felt that the car would be broken into or that it would be messed with in some way. I've had my car stolen in the past and another car broken into when I've lived other places so I can totally commiserate with the people who have had issues but again, I've never had a feeling that I've needed to worry about my car or the possessions inside of it. The place is very safe and the tenants seem to be the types of people who would keep an eye out for one another. Yes, I can sometimes hear the neighbor above me and both tenants above and below have dogs but I honestly have ziltch to complain about. However, if I did, I know the management would handle it perfectly. As far as tenants go, in general, everyone is lovely. We all say "hello" to each other, my fellow gym rats and I are now friends and everyone at the pool is always respectful (if someone wants to swim laps, people move aside) - the pool is honestly never crowded - in fact, there are days when no one is there at all, which is crazy to me. There are two nice grills and my husband and I, along with some other couples, use them and then sit outside to eat nice meals by the pool. There are elderly/retired couples, families, grad students and young professionals - a truly wonderful group of tenants...drug dealers and class-less folk are non-existent. The landscaping is beautiful and they frequently have people come to upkeep the grounds...the gym is awesome - as my part-time job, I'm a marathon running coach and also a personal trainer - the equipment is really nice and if there's a line to use a machine, the wait is never ever long and the business center with 2 nice computers is right around the corner so I've always felt that I could just surf the internet for a bit until a machine opens up. There is no reason to complain about the gym being busy - just like ANY gym, between 5-7pm it gets popular but nothing crazy - any other times of the day it's practically empty. I'm aware that I've written a novel here :) But I wanted to be very thorough because when I was apartment-hunting, I really needed the input since I was moving so far from home. Evergreens is a really wonderful place to live and I'm truly enjoying it and know for a fact that I will continue to. A HUGE thank-you to Meshell at Evergreens for welcoming me into this lovely community from Day 1 and making me feel at home in NC!
I absolutely love it here and am baffled to read the previous post! I moved here recently after living in Manhattan (NYC) for 8 years so I know that that does make me a bit biased since NYC is a completely different experience than NC (NYC has teeny tiny apartments for outrageous amounts of money, sooo many safety issues, noise issues constantly...the list is endless), BUT I chose to live in those conditions because I loved the city and that's really what you get/have to deal with in NYC. The apartment itself is incredibly spacious and clean. It may not be all granite-countertopped-out with beautiful fixtures but it all works and if you decorate the right way, you can make the place a palace! The music ends at a totally respectable hour, too (I think there's only been 1 party since I've moved in). I have had friends and family visitor often and they are just as much in awe as me over this place (they all happen to be homeowners in Charleston, SC as well as Pittsburgh, PA) - so if a homeowner (of a really nice home) is jealous of MY apartment, then you know Evergreens is pretty great! However, if I did, I know the management would handle it perfectly. As far as tenants go, in general, everyone is lovely. We all say "hello" to each other, my fellow gym rats and I are now friends and everyone at the pool is always respectful (if someone wants to swim laps, people move aside) - the pool is honestly never crowded - in fact, there are days when no one is there at all, which is crazy to me. There are two nice grills and my husband and I, along with some other couples, use them and then sit outside to eat nice meals by the pool. There are elderly/retired couples, families, grad students and young professionals - a truly wonderful group of tenants...drug dealers and class-less folk are non-existent. The landscaping is beautiful and they frequently have people come to upkeep the grounds...the gym is awesome - as my part-time job, I'm a marathon running coach and also a personal trainer - the equipment is really nice and if there's a line to use a machine, the wait is never ever long and the business center with 2 nice computers is right around the corner so I've always felt that I could just surf the internet for a bit until a machine opens up. There is no reason to complain about the gym being busy - just like ANY gym, between 5-7pm it gets popular but nothing crazy - any other times of the day it's practically empty. I'm aware that I've written a novel here :) But I wanted to be very thorough because when I was apartment-hunting, I really needed the input since I was moving so far from home. Evergreens is a really wonderful place to live and I'm truly enjoying it and know for a fact that I will continue to. A HUGE thank-you to Meshell at Evergreens for welcoming me into this lovely community from Day 1 and making me feel at home in NC! Read less

Report
Resident
2012 - 2013 Not Recommended Reviewed 07/11/2013
I lived here for a year. When I first moved in I was really excited because of all the great reviews on here, but it didn't take long to realize I made a huge mistake. This review is going to be long because of the horrible experience I had. First when you move in they give you keys for the apt and the mailbox. They gave us two different sets of keys, and told us they would have a locksmith make us another set. That never happened, so we just got a copy of the apt key and shared the mailbox key. The mailbox was jam packed with mail that looked like it had been collecting for over a year (They told us after we moved out that the mail person wouldn't deliver our mail to the mailbox since he knew we moved because they let him know when people were moving). The entire time we lived here we constantly got mail for about 6 different people, and even after returning them and writing our names in the box we still got their mail. When you first move in they give you this sheet for you to write down all the damages that were there when you moved in (in my opinion the damages from previous owners should just be repaired, but whatever). We ended up with a pretty long list, and when we turned it in they told us they would fix all the things we listed. That never happened. We lived there the entire time with our kitchen light fixture broken in the closet. The quality of our apartment was lousy. The carpet looked bad after a few months despite us taking care of it. The sliding door for the laundry room came off the tracks constantly. If you look under the counter at the inside of the cabinets you will notice the cheap workmanship. The fixture holding the drawers is plastic and breaks really easily. Looking at the walls you can see holes that were poorly covered and painted over. The blinds are really cheap and break easily. Things constantly broke, and had to be replaced by us because otherwise they would stay broken. We first moved in during the summer, so of course we had the AC on most of the time. It never seemed to cool the apt and it was ALWAYS on. We called them to come look at it probably 15 times the entire time we lived there, and each time they just refilled the coolant and left. The AC would freeze over and then it leaked and damaged some of the things we had stored in that closet (TIP Do not store things in the closet with the AC). Our electric bill was close to 200$ (they promised our average would be around 80 when we signed the lease?) and we decided to buy our own thermostat. Problem solved. The maintenance guys are not the brightest. One time they told me that it is normal for a thermostat to be ten degrees off, what? On the topic of maintenance I will say they do respond pretty quickly, but dumb and dumber rarely know what they are doing and never actually resolved any of our issues. While we were living there in the winter we noticed and extreme amount of condensation on the windows and window sills. This led to mold. They actually put in one of the monthly newsletters that this was normal and we should just wipe them daily. I think the cause of this is drafty windows. Drafty windows might cause the high electric bills as well. The mold situation was also apparent in the bathroom. The seals around the tub were this cheap rubber that came off when it was wet. We constantly sprayed bleach, but the mold must of been growing behind the tub in the cracks. The same thing happened around the sink in the bathroom. I am not sure what they used to seal these things, but it all just peeled anytime it got wet. The noise was ridiculous. We could here our neighbors anytime they were home. The upstairs neighbor loved stomping, and dropping heavy things. Anytime someone was on their balcony we could hear them through the closed windows, and our upstairs neighbor had people over all the time. I understand that noise is normal for apartments, but this was beyond normal. The balcony has no privacy. We paid more to have the nice view of the pond, but there were these crazy rednecks who let their kids and dogs run free all the time making as much noise as possible(these rednecks also had one of the storage units you can rent, and they used it as their personal driveway constantly blocking off the parking lot. Again letting their small children run out in front of cars. They had this old car the would turn on periodically to rev it, and it was so loud you could hear it all the way inside the apt. They were also constantly spray painting vehicles out there like a redneck paint service). The balcony is open to the neighbors across from you, so they can see and hear anything you are doing. The rail was painted, and when it rained the paint would flake off and get everywhere. After the paint had come completely off this weird green algae like stuff started growing on it. Needless to say we rarely used the balcony. Deliveries. We both work normal 9-5ish jobs, so we always missed deliveries. There were multiple times (more than I could count on hands and feet) that the office would be open, but no one in there. I would stand and wait for ten minutes and still see no one. They have different events at the pool for holidays or games. They play music so loud we could hear it in our apartment which was all the way in the back of the complex. The pool is nothing special. I think the deepest it goes is 4 feet. It was always full of kids anytime I wanted to swim, so I maybe went twice. I never used the gym, but the one time I was going to try and use it all the working machines were being used. One other big problem was the security. We had so many solicitors come knocking at our door. There was this scam artist trying to sell me magazines to help fund his "school" trip, and when I asked him to leave he proceeded to stand outside my door. Luckily my boyfriend was coming home for lunch, and got him to leave. We never had anything stolen that we noticed, but there were a bunch of sketchy people in our building. This one apartment clearly was home to drug dealers (smells in the breezeway, random people in and out at all hours) and their car sat in the parking lot with a flat tire right in front of the entrance for months. We never had problems with them, but who wants to live near stuff like that? We originally moved in because the housing market was really bad, and it was a last option. Please don't make the same mistake! We actually paid the last few months of rent while living in our new house because we wanted to be out so bad. I could go on and on about how much I disliked this place. I really wish I had seen a real review before moving in. It seems that most of these reviews are fake (maybe the staff?). For the price of this place it really is not worth it. We still have not heard anything back about deposits or anything and its been two months since our lease ended.
I lived here for a year. When I first moved in I was really excited because of all the great reviews on here, but it didn't take long to realize I made a huge mistake. This review is going to be long because of the horrible experience I had. First when you move in they give you keys for the apt and the mailbox. They gave us two different sets of keys, and told us they would have a locksmith make us another set. That never happened, so we just got a copy of the apt key and shared the mailbox key. The mailbox was jam packed with mail that looked like it had been collecting for over a year (They told us after we moved out that the mail person wouldn't deliver our mail to the mailbox since he knew we moved because they let him know when people were moving). The entire time we lived here we constantly got mail for about 6 different people, and even after returning them and writing our names in the box we still got their mail. When you first move in they give you this sheet for you to write down all the damages that were there when you moved in (in my opinion the damages from previous owners should just be repaired, but whatever). We ended up with a pretty long list, and when we turned it in they told us they would fix all the things we listed. That never happened. We lived there the entire time with our kitchen light fixture broken in the closet. The quality of our apartment was lousy. The carpet looked bad after a few months despite us taking care of it. The sliding door for the laundry room came off the tracks constantly. If you look under the counter at the inside of the cabinets you will notice the cheap workmanship. The fixture holding the drawers is plastic and breaks really easily. Looking at the walls you can see holes that were poorly covered and painted over. The blinds are really cheap and break easily. Things constantly broke, and had to be replaced by us because otherwise they would stay broken. We first moved in during the summer, so of course we had the AC on most of the time. It never seemed to cool the apt and it was ALWAYS on. We called them to come look at it probably 15 times the entire time we lived there, and each time they just refilled the coolant and left. The AC would freeze over and then it leaked and damaged some of the things we had stored in that closet (TIP Do not store things in the closet with the AC). Our electric bill was close to 200$ (they promised our average would be around 80 when we signed the lease?) and we decided to buy our own thermostat. Problem solved. The maintenance guys are not the brightest. One time they told me that it is normal for a thermostat to be ten degrees off, what? On the topic of maintenance I will say they do respond pretty quickly, but dumb and dumber rarely know what they are doing and never actually resolved any of our issues. While we were living there in the winter we noticed and extreme amount of condensation on the windows and window sills. This led to mold. They actually put in one of the monthly newsletters that this was normal and we should just wipe them daily. I think the cause of this is drafty windows. Drafty windows might cause the high electric bills as well. The mold situation was also apparent in the bathroom. The seals around the tub were this cheap rubber that came off when it was wet. We constantly sprayed bleach, but the mold must of been growing behind the tub in the cracks. The same thing happened around the sink in the bathroom. I am not sure what they used to seal these things, but it all just peeled anytime it got wet. The noise was ridiculous. We could here our neighbors anytime they were home. The upstairs neighbor loved stomping, and dropping heavy things. Anytime someone was on their balcony we could hear them through the closed windows, and our upstairs neighbor had people over all the time. I understand that noise is normal for apartments, but this was beyond normal. The balcony has no privacy. We paid more to have the nice view of the pond, but there were these crazy rednecks who let their kids and dogs run free all the time making as much noise as possible(these rednecks also had one of the storage units you can rent, and they used it as their personal driveway constantly blocking off the parking lot. Again letting their small children run out in front of cars. They had this old car the would turn on periodically to rev it, and it was so loud you could hear it all the way inside the apt. They were also constantly spray painting vehicles out there like a redneck paint service). The balcony is open to the neighbors across from you, so they can see and hear anything you are doing. The rail was painted, and when it rained the paint would flake off and get everywhere. After the paint had come completely off this weird green algae like stuff started growing on it. Needless to say we rarely used the balcony. Deliveries. We both work normal 9-5ish jobs, so we always missed deliveries. There were multiple times (more than I could count on hands and feet) that the office would be open, but no one in there. I would stand and wait for ten minutes and still see no one. They have different events at the pool for holidays or games. They play music so loud we could hear it in our apartment which was all the way in the back of the complex. The pool is nothing special. I think the deepest it goes is 4 feet. It was always full of kids anytime I wanted to swim, so I maybe went twice. I never used the gym, but the one time I was going to try and use it all the working machines were being used. One other big problem was the security. We had so many solicitors come knocking at our door. There was this scam artist trying to sell me magazines to help fund his "school" trip, and when I asked him to leave he proceeded to stand outside my door. Luckily my boyfriend was coming home for lunch, and got him to leave. We never had anything stolen that we noticed, but there were a bunch of sketchy people in our building. This one apartment clearly was home to drug dealers (smells in the breezeway, random people in and out at all hours) and their car sat in the parking lot with a flat tire right in front of the entrance for months. We never had problems with them, but who wants to live near stuff like that? We originally moved in because the housing market was really bad, and it was a last option. Please don't make the same mistake! We actually paid the last few months of rent while living in our new house because we wanted to be out so bad. I could go on and on about how much I disliked this place. I really wish I had seen a real review before moving in. It seems that most of these reviews are fake (maybe the staff?). For the price of this place it really is not worth it. We still have not heard anything back about deposits or anything and its been two months since our lease ended. Read less

15

anonymous 04/08/2014

I will have to agree with the negative reviews. We lived there for 2 years and had to get out of there due to the insane amount of roaches we saw. Despite us calling and the nasty Orkin staff coming monthly, the issue was never resolved. We just needed to leave. Whenever we complained, the staff and the manager there asked us to keep the apartment clean. That was very insulting considering that we are a very clean couple. Crime was at its peek, the manager informed everyone that every building will have a camera, that never happened. It is all lies lies and no care at all from the staff. The owner is just as bad and has a chip on his shoulder and refuses to address any issues. Our energy bill was ridiculous. The apartment was freezing during winter and hot during summers. Nothing works, all their appliances are old and the staff especially the manager are very cocky. I would stay away from this place. It is a scam of luxury but in reality any cheap apartment would give more amenities than they did to us. Stay AWAY.

anonymous 03/11/2014

I agree. My apartment lacked proper insulation, which, caused insane energy bills. Walls are paper thin and air leaks around the windows. Also, beware if you are a pet owner. Yes, they are pet friendly with dog parks and such but they take advantage of pet owners. You will pay a pet deposit (non-refundable and this is not the only deposit to be made), pet rent (every month) and most likely will have to pay extra at move out. I had to pay for "pet stain removal" when moving out after I had already steam cleaned the carpet and my dog is mature and no longer had accidents while living there. I felt that it was unfair because I only found out about it a year after move out and could not defend myself. To keep from bill being sent to collections, I just paid it off. Expect to pay about $1000 extra to live there if you have pets.

anonymous 07/21/2013

They say they return your deposit within thirty days. We ended our lease 5/31 and we received the check 7/18. It's funny how after I write a negative review all of a sudden my deposit check comes(Along with mail that I have been missing for 2 months). The law says the deposit minus any fees must be returned within 30 days, and if longer time is needed for repairs we must have a written notice within the thirty days. In addition to it being late, they deducted $200 from our deposit for half of the repair to oven? The picture of the supposed oven damage has a time stamp of October 2011, and the picture is just the inside of an oven and it's so dark you can't see a thing. There is no proof that it was actually our apartment, and you can't see any damaging evidence. After calling I learned someone moved in 6/19, so if the oven needed repairs it would have to have been done before then, so why not just mail the check when you are dealing with it? Because it was just a made up excuse to take our money because you are mad at our review, or just crooked. What kind of repair costs exactly $400 even? Not to mention we rarely cooked at home, and the oven worked fine when we actually did. The ovens in the apartment don't even look like they cost $200 new, so why would a repair be so expensive? The entire situation was unprofessional, and it was handled in the most unprofessional way. Luckily we never have to deal with renting again, but for those of you who do really consider my review. Not the fake ones posted by the managers whenever a real review is posted that points out how bad they are.

anonymous 07/13/2013

Understand your frustration. My son lived there from 2005 to 2006 and had his car stolen, there were no cameras on the property, and they did offer a discount for a garage after this (for the second car of course). However, he told them he would more than likely be leaving due to job offer (yes a year lease which he fulfilled) but refused deposit. Not the safest place to live and they to my knowledge never installed cameras or gate into the complex. Was nice we thought and convenient at the time, but a pain with crime (yes there were other car breakins and apartment breakins), and lack of respect for him giving notice and then when knew for sure refused deposit. I feel your pain.

Verified Manager07/11/2013

Hi. My name is Natalie Cook the property manager at the Evergreens. I'm sorry that you had a bad experience at our community. I've worked here for 8 years and I truly do care about my resident's experience with us. I want people to leave feeling that they have enjoyed their stay. Unfortunately, it's difficult to make everyone happy. I completely understand how frustrating it would be to have a noisy neighbor or someone not following the community rules. I believe I know who you are talking about by the pond and have already made major efforts to fix this and to my knowledge it's better. Living in a shared community can be challenging at times with all the different personalities and it's our responsibility to handle these situations and if we were slow to get this one under control then I apologize. As far as safety, our community is in a great part of Durham. That being said, I still encourage residents to take their normal precautions to ensure their safety. We have no soliciting signs displayed, security cameras and also have 2 onsite courtesy officers to try to help us keep things in order here. Usually this works, but some solicitors do not care and will go door to door anyways. (not often) Right when we realize this we have an employee or officer immediately escort them off the property. We process criminal background checks on everyone living at the community and you will not be allowed to move in if you do not pass. If there's a situation that you noticed that seems serious I hope that you will email me directly so that I can look into it. As far as your deposit, all deposits should be refunded within 30 days. I went back through our records and I can't find anything that hasn't been refunded. Please email me at info@evergreensnc.com so I can look into it for you. If I have to bring it to you myself I will. Again, my sincerest apology for your unhappiness with our community. If I could change it I would, but I will however review these comments in detail with my staff and try to make sure we are on top of everything in the future to make sure others don't leave feeling this way. You're welcome to contact me about the deposit and I'd be happy to discuss anything on here also. Best of luck to you with everything. Take care. Natalie

How was this review?

Thanks for voting!
Report
Resident
2013 - 2014 Not Recommended Reviewed 05/30/2013
I don't know what the person below me is talking about, but the evergreens is great. The staff is friendly and always willing to help (love Victoria, so sweet!). They really make an effort to establish a community and maintain high standards for the property overall. Daymond (sp?) stayed after 5 on a Sunday when I signed my lease (I had an urgent moving situation). They have 2 dog parks, which is great when you're busy. The apartments are nice. I'd give them a B because they're pretty quiet, well insulated, and have nice floor plans. I can hear my upstairs neighbor walking occasionally and if some ninny is playing their bass super loud in the parking lot, but those are exceptions and not the norm. The apartments actually have overhead lighting, that is hard to come by around here. I wish they were cheaper, but I guess they high prices keep the partying, drinking undergrads out. I'm a med student at UNC so I need a place that is worry-free and quiet for studying. The evergreens is just that. UPDATED- I lived here right before the switch to new management in July 2014. I Loved the old management. They were super on top of things. I never had any problems with my apt, the property, the people...it really was a great apartment complex (albeit a little on the pricier side). Now the new management is TERRIBLE! i spent months going back and forth with their people trying to get my security deposit back from those monsters. I moved out end of June 2014 and when I contacted them to about my security deposit, they couldn't find any records supposedly. I continued to contact them about my deposit and, long story short, they kept bouncing me around to different people on the management team. Some were nice, some were total jerks. In the end, NO ONE helped me and they stole 300$ from me. I finally gave up because I had moved away and didn't even want to deal with small claims for a measly 300$ (the security deposit was super low at the evergreens bc i had good credit). I KNOW that I left that apartment sparkling because my parents and I spent the last day or so cleaning. These people are CROOKS! DO NOT TRUST THEM OR LIVE HERE!!!!!! They will NOT resolve your problems and will keep giving you lip service until you just give up.

Noise was always a problem could always hear the neighbors closing their cabinet doors in the kitchen. The noise from upstairs always came down so whatever they did up there we could always hear. Report
Resident
2011 - 2013 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/14/2013
My boyfriend and I have lived here for about a two years and we love it. He worked in Durham and I go to school at UNC Chapel Hill. Commuting to school was easy. The Triangle Transit stop is a little over a quarter mile away in the Wal-mart shopping center and the pass is free from school. The location is wonderful. Everything is within a 10 to 15 minute drive. The grounds are kept clean and well lit, sometimes my boyfriend and I will go running at night and never had any problems. I especially love the flowers in the spring and the decorations during Halloween and Christmas. The apartments are large and spacious and haven't really had problems with noise (and we live on the 2nd floor). The garden tub is also really awesome. I don't think I can go back to a regular tub. The staff is so nice and willing to help at a moments notice. The only problem we've had here is my boyfriend got a laptop stolen out of this car. Before you start deeming this place unsafe, it was mainly his fault for putting it in plain sight over the whole weekend. Not storing valuables in the car is just common sense. The staff worked hard with us and the police and we got everything back. Despite this one incident, I have never felt unsafe here or had any other security problems. They have security cameras and courtesy officers willing to help. The rent is a little higher here, but we think it's worth the extra money. If only my boyfriend didn't get a job in Raleigh, or we should stay here. I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a place to live.
My boyfriend and I have lived here for about a two years and we love it. He worked in Durham and I go to school at UNC Chapel Hill. Commuting to school was easy. The Triangle Transit stop is a little over a quarter mile away in the Wal-mart shopping center and the pass is free from school. The location is wonderful. Everything is within a 10 to 15 minute drive. The grounds are kept clean and well lit, sometimes my boyfriend and I will go running at night and never had any problems. I especially love the flowers in the spring and the decorations during Halloween and Christmas. The apartments are large and spacious and haven't really had problems with noise (and we live on the 2nd floor). The garden tub is also really awesome. I don't think I can go back to a regular tub. The staff is so nice and willing to help at a moments notice. The only problem we've had here is my boyfriend got a laptop stolen out of this car. Before you start deeming this place unsafe, it was mainly his fault for putting it in plain sight over the whole weekend. Not storing valuables in the car is just common sense. The staff worked hard with us and the police and we got everything back. Despite this one incident, I have never felt unsafe here or had any other security problems. They have security cameras and courtesy officers willing to help. The rent is a little higher here, but we think it's worth the extra money. If only my boyfriend didn't get a job in Raleigh, or we should stay here. I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a place to live. Read less

My apartment living experience at The Flats @55Twevle is good. The maintain Dept. Mr. Edgar and Gab/staff are helpful. The Admin staff are professional and helpful. The grounds are beautiful and the inside leasing office is luxurious. Inside the apartments not so luxurious for the rent price. Valet trash service is offered included in rent price should be optional. The business center with computers/fax machine is wonderful when it is open. Location of the Flats apartment are very good. Near by hospitals, shopping center. Over all I enjoy living at the Flats apartments and plan to continue living here depending on rent increase. Anonymous

Resident
2009 - 2012 Recommended Property Reviewed 11/30/2012
I lived here for three years and moved out only because I accepted a job out of state. I very much enjoyed my time here. The office staff was always very friendly and so helpful. I had very few issues with my apartment but when I did need something fixed, maintenance was very quick. The complex is well kept and clean. The location is great being that it is close to both Durham and Chapel Hill and close to the highway. I really loved living here and will miss it. I am not sure if I fill find an apartment community that I will love as much as the Evergreens.

3

Natalielcook 02/15/2013

Hi. I saw the ? about noise and wanted to respond. I'm Natalie and I work at the evergreens. We have great residents who normally are very considerate of their neighbors.. that being said, it's still a shared community and you will have some noise from time to time from activity above you. We ask residents to make an extra effort to keep noise down after 9pm and before 9am. Most people are pretty good about doing this. I would say if you are fairly tolerate and can handle some noise a 1st or 2nd floor would be fine, but if you are going to bed early, a light sleeper or even work from home during the day you may want to consider a top floor home to be on the safe side. Hope this helps.

csogrady 12/18/2012

I was on the top floor - sorry!

anonymous 12/03/2012

if you had neighbors above you, how was the sound?

The apartment that we placed a hold on was very well cleaned and renovated. The place looked pretty safe according with the Durham police website. Under the reserve that I didn't stay in this place and my opinions are completely based on the two visits that we made to the place, I will highly recommend this place.

I was a Duke law school student. The evergreens unlike a "party apartment", students who live here can always enjoy quiet, fresh and refreshing environment. Students can freely study in their apartments. When you feel tired, go swimming in the sunshine, when you want some refreshment, go to the 24 hours gym to work out. As an international student, the Evergreens really made me feel like home!!! I highly recommend the Evergreens to those students or international students who want to find somewhere to enjoy life convinence and fabulous study and living environment!!

Report
Resident
2011 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/17/2011
The Evergreens at Mt. Moriah is a 10 minute drive to campus, is very reasonably priced, and has the best management I've ever experienced. The maintenance is extremely friendly and prompt (usually within an hour or two of when call is made). Very conveniently located (walking distance from New Hope Commons shopping complex and 1 minute from freeway entrance to I-40. The property is very well maintained and the management truly cares about accommodating their tenants. The complex is quiet and the neighbors are friendly. The Evergreens community embraces a southern hospitality culture and it has been a refreshing find for us. Would definitely recommend to anyone bringing a family to Durham.
The Evergreens at Mt. Moriah is a 10 minute drive to campus, is very reasonably priced, and has the best management I've ever experienced. The maintenance is extremely friendly and prompt (usually within an hour or two of when call is made). Very conveniently located (walking distance from New Hope Commons shopping complex and 1 minute from freeway entrance to I-40. The property is very well maintained and the management truly cares about accommodating their tenants. The complex is quiet and the neighbors are friendly. The Evergreens community embraces a southern hospitality culture and it has been a refreshing find for us. Would definitely recommend to anyone bringing a family to Durham. Read less

Report
Resident
2007 - 2010 Recommended Property Reviewed 02/12/2011
My roommate and I lived at Evergreens for a little over 3 years. Only issue we ever had was that our ACb broke in the first month, the maintenance guy was awesome and came out at 10pm to fix it! It is a very pet friedly place. We had a "puppy play group" that met almost every night for the dogs to run out their energy. We also liked the community paraties that they had. We lived on the 3rd floor and did not have a problem at all with hearing neighbors (we both worked nights). It was nice having almost every store you needed right up the road. Only reason we moved was that the price was getting a to be a little more than we wanted to pay. We loved Sheena in the office!

Report
Resident
2010 - 2011 Recommended Property Reviewed 01/16/2011
We have lived here for almost a full year now & from the start the complex & staff have been great. Our 3 bedroom is spacious, well layed out, & the only downside is our carpet looked very dirty & old in the main living area after just a few months of moving in. The pool & clubhouse are always neat & the grill by the pool is great for summer cookouts. They just replaced some of the fitness equipment & the playground & are slowly replacing the older (but still nice) windows in some of the units. My children love the pond: geese in the winter to watch & fishing in the nicer weather. They have the best events here: a great summer cookout with DJ, food, & karate & magic demonstrations, holiday parties for the kids & seperate ones for the adults as well. They really seem to care about making life easy & enjoyable...they want you to stay here. We hope to be here for a few more years. In regards to the safety concerns mentioned previously, there have been some instances of crime since we moved in (all little things) but the office staff has started a community watch group & there are courtesy officers on site as well. The complex itself is very private & so maybe that makes it an easy target in some ways but be safe & use your common sense, don't leave valuables in your car etc.
We have lived here for almost a full year now & from the start the complex & staff have been great. Our 3 bedroom is spacious, well layed out, & the only downside is our carpet looked very dirty & old in the main living area after just a few months of moving in. The pool & clubhouse are always neat & the grill by the pool is great for summer cookouts. They just replaced some of the fitness equipment & the playground & are slowly replacing the older (but still nice) windows in some of the units. My children love the pond: geese in the winter to watch & fishing in the nicer weather. They have the best events here: a great summer cookout with DJ, food, & karate & magic demonstrations, holiday parties for the kids & seperate ones for the adults as well. They really seem to care about making life easy & enjoyable...they want you to stay here. We hope to be here for a few more years. The complex itself is very private & so maybe that makes it an easy target in some ways but be safe & use your common sense, don't leave valuables in your car etc. Read less

How was this review?

Report
Resident
2010 Recommended Property Reviewed 10/26/2010
I've been living here about 2 months now, and I really love it. I'm in a 2-bedroom apartment and not only does it have a lot of space, but it *feels* spacious. The 9 foot ceilings really open up the living room/kitchen areas and make them feel so big that I sometimes forget it's an apartment. The interior is very good quality, though I will say that having hardwood or tile for the "kitchen" area would be nice for cleaning purposes. We (two occupants) live quite comfortably with 2 cats and use the second bedroom as an office. No pet rent, either! The porch/balcony is very comfy, and pretty decently sized. You won't fit a 4 chair table or anything, but that's pretty typical for an apartment. The only strange thing is that first floor apartments don't have a gate or door on their porches, so you can't actually leave the apartment through the back door. Well, I guess you could, but you'd have to jump over the railing on the porch which would be pretty silly... The complex itself is very nice. It has a tennis court, a sand volleyball court, and a pool if you want to get some exercise. There's also charcoal grills around the complex that you're free to use provided you buy the coal. You can rent a garage for something like $35 (one-time fee, I was told, which is amazing) and there's a hose and coin-operated car vacuum available. There's also no parking fees and tons of spaces. If I was going to pick a downside, it would be that the traffic can make getting to the highway a little annoying. The complex isn't actually on the highway, mind you, but the intersection of Mt. Moriah and 15-501 is the start of some construction, so the traffic patterns have been a little wonky recently. Once it's done I think the issue will mostly go away, since they're adding an extra lane to 15-501 in both directions. On the plus side, though, there's a ton of commercial stuff literally down the block from the complex, yet far enough away that you don't notice it. Between the two shopping centers there's a half dozen restaurants, a Wal Mart, Best Buy, Barnes & Noble, Starbucks, and at least 15 other stores. If you're looking to live in the Durham area, definitely take a look at the Evergreens. It's a great complex and a really convenient location, being right next to the intersection of 15-501 and I-40. It's a little more pricey, but so far it's been worth every penny.
I've been living here about 2 months now, and I really love it. I'm in a 2-bedroom apartment and not only does it have a lot of space, but it *feels* spacious. The 9 foot ceilings really open up the living room/kitchen areas and make them feel so big that I sometimes forget it's an apartment. The interior is very good quality, though I will say that having hardwood or tile for the "kitchen" area would be nice for cleaning purposes. We (two occupants) live quite comfortably with 2 cats and use the second bedroom as an office. No pet rent, either! The porch/balcony is very comfy, and pretty decently sized. You won't fit a 4 chair table or anything, but that's pretty typical for an apartment. The only strange thing is that first floor apartments don't have a gate or door on their porches, so you can't actually leave the apartment through the back door. Well, I guess you could, but you'd have to jump over the railing on the porch which would be pretty silly... The complex itself is very nice. It has a tennis court, a sand volleyball court, and a pool if you want to get some exercise. There's also charcoal grills around the complex that you're free to use provided you buy the coal. You can rent a garage for something like $35 (one-time fee, I was told, which is amazing) and there's a hose and coin-operated car vacuum available. There's also no parking fees and tons of spaces. If I was going to pick a downside, it would be that the traffic can make getting to the highway a little annoying. The complex isn't actually on the highway, mind you, but the intersection of Mt. Moriah and 15-501 is the start of some construction, so the traffic patterns have been a little wonky recently. Once it's done I think the issue will mostly go away, since they're adding an extra lane to 15-501 in both directions. On the plus side, though, there's a ton of commercial stuff literally down the block from the complex, yet far enough away that you don't notice it. Between the two shopping centers there's a half dozen restaurants, a Wal Mart, Best Buy, Barnes & Noble, Starbucks, and at least 15 other stores. If you're looking to live in the Durham area, definitely take a look at the Evergreens. It's a great complex and a really convenient location, being right next to the intersection of 15-501 and I-40. It's a little more pricey, but so far it's been worth every penny. Read less

Resident
2010 Recommended Property Reviewed 10/25/2010
I moved here almost 3 months ago with my husband, daughter, and dog and we just love living here. It's quiet, clean, beautiful, and the best: a wonderful staff. They are always very helpful and nice. I feel they are my friends here. :-) Besides that, there is a great shopping area very near here. It's only a 5 minute walk from here. This is the best place from all the other ones we visited here in Durham.

Report
Resident
2010 Recommended Property Reviewed 10/17/2010
The Evergreens at Mt. Moriah is a GREAT place to live! The apartments are spacious, safe, quiet, and well kept (inside and out). The staff is top notch! They are always very friendly and outgoing, and are always willing to help with anything that you may need. The location is prime! It's close to Duke/UNC, the airport, numerous major highways, shopping centers, groceries, outdoor trails, parks, ect... I would HIGHLY recommend these apartments to anyone!
The Evergreens at Mt. Moriah is a GREAT place to live! The apartments are spacious, safe, quiet, and well kept (inside and out). The staff is top notch! They are always very friendly and outgoing, and are always willing to help with anything that you may need. The location is prime! It's close to Duke/UNC, the airport, numerous major highways, shopping centers, groceries, outdoor trails, parks, ect... I would HIGHLY recommend these apartments to anyone! Read less

Report
Resident
2009 - 2010 Recommended Property Reviewed 10/16/2010
The Evergreens at Mt. Moriah is a nice place to live. Its as quiet as you'd ever expect an apartment complex to realistically be. I live on the top floor of my building and I rarely if ever hear my neighbors since I only share one common wall with them. If I do hear them its when they shut cupboard doors. My apartment has high ceilings which add the the feeling of having a lot of space and are great! I have a great balcony with room for chairs and there are ample places to put flowers and hanging pots and a nice view of the complex. Whenever I've had problems the staff is very friendly and quickly has the maintenance staff out to assess or fix the problem within a day. The first time tried to turn my air conditioning on this summer it didn't turn on. I called the emergency line on Sunday morning at 7:30 and Toby was knocking on my door 15 minutes later. He offered fans for my apartment until they could get an electrician there to fix it. He was extremely helpful. The Evergreens staff also throws great parties for the complex. The pool party in August was Vegas themed and heavily attended. Not only is it a great place to live, there is quick access to 15/501 and I-40, not to mention only being 10-12 minutes from both Duke and UNC. Less than a half mile away there's access to Wal-Mart, Home Depot, Kroger, Office Max, Best Buy, Starbucks, Bob Evans, Outback, Barnes and Noble, Kohl's and a host of other businesses. Less than three miles the other direction and we have access to one of the major sections of the Duke Forest with miles of hiking trails. If you're looking for a nice place to live with great staff, great location easy access to Duke or UNC, you've found the right place.
The Evergreens at Mt. Moriah is a nice place to live. Its as quiet as you'd ever expect an apartment complex to realistically be. Resident
2010 - 2016 Recommended Property Reviewed 10/14/2010
The staff at the Evergreens are a very special group of people. They made me feel right at home immediately. The management staff is very kind and understanding. When I moved in to my Apartment, everything was so clean and fresh. When I needed anything; I found the staff very open and welcoming. The maintenance staff are always very friendly and fun to talk to. It is common that I get a "thumbs up" from Gabriel when he drives by me in the maintenance cart. The pool and fitness room and 24 hour business center are great amenities. I would highly recommend this apartment complex.

Report
Resident
2009 - 2010 Recommended Property Reviewed 10/08/2010
As apartments go, overall just average. Best thing going for it is the location. Extremely convenient for me. I'm half way through my second year here and it seems that it's going down hill. The dog parks are disgusting. A new wave of tenants don't seem to care to pick up after their dogs. The dog waste containers around the complex are often over-flowing and, in the heat of the summer, smells like you live next to a waste treatment plant. The pool is constantly full of leaves and unattended children. While the office staff is pleasant, I feel they could do a much better job "policing" the problem tenants and keeping the grounds and waste recepticles clean. Then winter comes and your windows have so much condensation your constantly wiping up puddles of water and cleaning off the mold that grows on the frames. Snow removal is non-existant from the roads or walk-ways. Like another poster stated, "over-priced and over-rated.

JumpforB 10/14/2010

I am not sure if I believe that. I have lived here for a long time and have gotten to know the staff pretty well since they have been working here for like ever. I do sure enjoy the parties they throw for us. Plus I work the same times they do so when ever I ask they have brought my packages to my apt for me. I am not sure about the window issue, I do not have that problem, but I heard someone at the dog park that did and they said that all thier windows were replaced. I think that if you are really having issues with the staff, maybe you should say something. they all are really nice peeps and I am sure if they know you are having problems they will work with you. That is one of the only reasons why I am still here. shenna and natalie has always been great to me, I see them running around with thier heads cut off half the time trying to help everyone. Shenna even helped me with my laptop problems when I was there. I am sure they have already seen your guys comments, maybe someone should talk to them instead of slandering them? Just a thought? Rebecca -

anonymous 08/03/2012

jellybean24 10/29/2010

I am SOOOO glad to be moving away from the evergreens today:) This place has been hell for me for the past 6 months. I was given the option to be let out of my lease at any time since the office staff refused to handle my neighbor situation. I jumped all over the offer giving myself 2 weeks to pack, find another residence & rent a u-haul all while stil having to go to school and work full-time. At this point I really did not care if I got one to two hours of sleep per day, as long as it meant getting out of this place I was happy. I mean this place was nice the first 2 years but it was just this ONE neighbor. I think I would have been fine if the office staff actually did something besides write letters to defuse the situation. As you can see the letters only made things worse causing the neighbor to purposly make noise to annoy me. The lady actually admitted that she was doing so and then had the nerve to try and speak to me and get mad when I just kept walking past her. I felt like I had no need to speak to her and it was best if I did not. I hope the community waits until this lady moves away before renting this apt out again or be certain there will be more complaints. Who am I kidding, they don't care and they won't do anything except say" Do you know how many noise complaints we get per day?" and then send a mass letter. If you can not get the job done, get someone that can. You are there to be nice but also reasonable and solve problems that arise.

We've had run-ins with her at the pool and walks around the complex. She reminds me of Naonka that is currently on Survivor, except I don't think she goes out with men, if you know what I'm saying.

Report
Resident
2010 Recommended Property Reviewed 08/30/2010
My roommate and I moved into our apartment in August 2009. We chose it because of it's close proximity to Duke, Kroger, Walmart, Target, etc...pretty much everything you need. From the very first visit, the staff was extremely enthusiastic and VERY helpful. We talked on the phone and emailed several times before we chose to move in...which is a big deal because we found other places to be fairly indifferent and unresponsive to our interest. We lived here for a year, and have never once had a problem with the staff. A few times our A/C went out, but everything was fixed within 24 hours. We even called the off-hours maintenance guy to fix the A/C, and he came all the way from HIllsborough and did not mind at all. So nice!! I have never felt unsafe here, even when I took the dog for a walk at 11PM or midnight. The property is well-lit and everyone who lives here is very friendly! Finally, I will say that my roommate and I were sad to move, and we only did so because we gained another roommate and needed to expand to a townhome. Otherwise, we would have gladly stayed! I highly recommend!!!

From the very first visit, the staff was extremely enthusiastic and VERY helpful. Finally, I will say that my roommate and I were sad to move, and we only did so because we gained another roommate and needed to expand to a townhome. Otherwise, we would have gladly stayed! I highly recommend!!! Read less
