Report
Resident
2009 - 2010 Recommended Property Reviewed 06/14/2010
My husband and I moved into the complex in July of last year and chose it because of its floor plan, the pool, location (nearby Kroger and several stores/restaurants) as well as how great we were treated by the lady who patiently showed us the buildings as we tried to decide between floor plans. We live on the 3rd floor and couldn't believe after our last apartment experience how QUIET this one is. Honestly we had thought our neighbors next door had moved out because we never heard them. The stairs between apartments are cement and I think this absorbs sound better, because we never heard anyone clopping up and down the steps. There are lots of young and old couples in this complex, as well as single folks and lots of us with dogs. There are plenty of pet waste stations and most everyone does a great job at picking up after the pups. The balcony is spacious. I've always felt safe here. We have only had a few minor maintenance requirements (our apartment was missing a cable jack, our toilet began leaking) but they have always been quick to respond. We never once had an issue with parking, and chose the back of the complex where there seemed to be extra spaces because we had this problem at the last place we lived. There are always plenty of spots even at 9, 10 p.m. If I had to change anything, it would be adding a long-cabinet pantry in the kitchen. My husband and I recently got hired in the Greensboro area and will be having to move - we are both so sad to go. We're having a difficult time as it is finding an apartment that even compares to our experience here.
My husband and I moved into the complex in July of last year and chose it because of its floor plan, the pool, location (nearby Kroger and several stores/restaurants) as well as how great we were treated by the lady who patiently showed us the buildings as we tried to decide between floor plans. We live on the 3rd floor and couldn't believe after our last apartment experience how QUIET this one is. Honestly we had thought our neighbors next door had moved out because we never heard them. The stairs between apartments are cement and I think this absorbs sound better, because we never heard anyone clopping up and down the steps. There are lots of young and old couples in this complex, as well as single folks and lots of us with dogs. There are plenty of pet waste stations and most everyone does a great job at picking up after the pups. The balcony is spacious. I've always felt safe here. We have only had a few minor maintenance requirements (our apartment was missing a cable jack, our toilet began leaking) but they have always been quick to respond. We never once had an issue with parking, and chose the back of the complex where there seemed to be extra spaces because we had this problem at the last place we lived. There are always plenty of spots even at 9, 10 p.m. If I had to change anything, it would be adding a long-cabinet pantry in the kitchen. My husband and I recently got hired in the Greensboro area and will be having to move - we are both so sad to go. We're having a difficult time as it is finding an apartment that even compares to our experience here. Read less

My sister went upstairs and asked the neighbor what was going on up there and she said that she was blasting her music and intentionally making loud noises because of the letters from the office. I was at work when this happened and when my sister called, I was furious!! This lady us a middle school teacher and is acting like a child. She told my sister that I cursed her out so bad and made her feel low. I never even cursed ONCE at this lady! The neighbor above her came downstairs to ask her what her problem was because she had her music so loud. The management here SUCKS, they are too nice to the troublemakers. This lady should have been evicted long ago for a breech in her contract and disturbance. I am moving and I can not wait to get away from this place.

daynah85 09/28/2010

:( I feel your pain. When we were at Alexan Farms, we could hear every single footstep in the apartment above us, and it always seemed like he especially wanted to walk around after 11 pm. Some of our classmates lived in the building too and had the same problem - but said it wasn't because the person was deliberately stomping, but because the insulation between floors was inconsistent and shoddy. One of the girls went in that apartment above them and walked around normally while the other one stayed down in theirs and listened -- even with normal walking, it sounded like stomping :/ We were lucky to be on the 3rd for at Evergreens - no stomping above us! Although I don't know how our neighbors below us felt about our stepping.

Prospective Resident
Visited 2010 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/01/2010
My husband and I toured the community and really had a good experience. I will be attending Duke Law next year and we're looking around and this was the best place we've seen so far and we've looked at a lot. We plan to move there this summer if all goes as planned. We have friends living there that speak highly of it so we feel confident it will work out well. I'm writing on here bc i enjoyed my tour so much. The staff was so nice and friendly. I got excited about moving after speaking with all of them including the maintenance man that was in the office. It was all very positive and they truly seemed to like working there. The apartment was very large and clean. I looked at the 2 br and it seems to be perfect for a couple or roommates. No utilities are included, but the price was set reasonably so it shouldn't be a big deal. I can make it to Duke in just a few minutes by the back road, which is a big plus for me. My husband liked the tennis courts and garages. We're excited to move there. Hopefully it will live up to the high expectations we have.

Report
Resident
2007 - 2009 Recommended Property Reviewed 06/03/2009
My wife and i have to relocate for a new job and we really hate to leave this apt community. we've been looking around in Greenville and have not seen anything that compares to where we live now. we've been here close to 2 years and really like it. just wanted to give our 2 cents for those looking. we've felt safe here and the staff has always gone above and beyond for us with everything. maintenance is good and usually comes out for repairs too quickly and we're not ready for them. can't really complain about that. we had a neighbor being loud one time and the manager handled it the same day and it's been fine ever since. if you go to duke or unc it's the best location and you can take a back road and miss the traffic. they've also built all of these new restaurants next door, which we go to regularly. we're going to miss the summer pool party. it's always a pretty good time. overall - i recommend this place. hope this helps anyone looking.

My husband and I live on the 3rd floor and love it! The vaulted ceilings are awesome, the view from the deck is awesome, we usually don't hear our neighbors (only 2 or 3 times this year), maintence is amazing (I had to call this week to get them to help me reset something and they were in the apartment 4 minutes after I called the order in!), the location is wonderful for anyone that needs to get to UNC or DUKE quickly! I love it so much I even volunteered at Duke's BDW to convince people to come live here.

How was this review?
Useful
Thanks for voting!
Report
Resident
2008 Recommended Property Reviewed 07/30/2008
I moved to the Evergreens 3 months ago and love it. The office staff members are incredibly helpful, especially Shenna. She always smiles and and calls all the residents by name, which is no small feat considering the size of the complex. There is a real sense of community here that was lacking in my last apartment complex. Neighbors actually greet each other, stop to chat with other residents who are walking their dogs, and attend the special events the community puts on. There have been at least 2 such events since I moved in: A Durham Bulls game outing and a party at the pool. The pool and grilling area are very nice, as are the business center (free internet and printing) and fitness center. The free yoga classes that are offered twice a week are also a nice touch. It's nice to be able to play tennis in the evening on the lighted court. The neighborhood is kept very clean. People pick up after their dogs because there are ample "pooh pooh" stations that are kept well-stocked with waste bags. There is ample parking; I have never had to park more than 100 feet away from my door. One of the most important things I consider when choosing an apartment is my personal safety. I feel safer at the Evergreens than at other places I've lived in Durham. Location is also important, and we're close to retail stores, restaurants, entertainment, and the major highways. Furthermore, the apartments are reasonably priced, and there is usually some sort of rental deal going on. For all of these reasons, I highly recommend the Evergreens to anyone who is considering living here.
I moved to the Evergreens 3 months ago and love it. The office staff members are incredibly helpful, especially Shenna. She always smiles and and calls all the residents by name, which is no small feat considering the size of the complex. There is a real sense of community here that was lacking in my last apartment complex. Neighbors actually greet each other, stop to chat with other residents who are walking their dogs, and attend the special events the community puts on. There have been at least 2 such events since I moved in: A Durham Bulls game outing and a party at the pool. The pool and grilling area are very nice, as are the business center (free internet and printing) and fitness center. The free yoga classes that are offered twice a week are also a nice touch. It's nice to be able to play tennis in the evening on the lighted court. The neighborhood is kept very clean. People pick up after their dogs because there are ample "pooh pooh" stations that are kept well-stocked with waste bags. There is ample parking; I have never had to park more than 100 feet away from my door. One of the most important things I consider when choosing an apartment is my personal safety. I feel safer at the Evergreens than at other places I've lived in Durham. Location is also important, and we're close to retail stores, restaurants, entertainment, and the major highways. Furthermore, the apartments are reasonably priced, and there is usually some sort of rental deal going on. For all of these reasons, I highly recommend the Evergreens to anyone who is considering living here. Read less

Report
Resident
2004 - 2008 Recommended Property Reviewed 05/08/2008
I've lived here for about four years and really like the Evergreens. I use the fitness room often, which has an elliptical machine, and there is a nice pool. Staff are very friendly, and maintenance is helpful. Rooms are quite spacious, and our two bedroom apartment has two baths, which is nice. I've read other reviews where people think parking is an issue, but it's not that bad. You'll definitely find parking spots somewhere. You might not get a parking space directly in front of your building every single day, but walking a couple of yards every once in a while never hurts anyone. I have two bedrooms, and my room can get a little cold at night in the winter, I think due to inadequate insulation, but it's bearable. Definitely consider living here!
I've lived here for about four years and really like the Evergreens. I use the fitness room often, which has an elliptical machine, and there is a nice pool. Staff are very friendly, and maintenance is helpful. Rooms are quite spacious, and our two bedroom apartment has two baths, which is nice. I've read other reviews where people think parking is an issue, but it's not that bad. You'll definitely find parking spots somewhere. You might not get a parking space directly in front of your building every single day, but walking a couple of yards every once in a while never hurts anyone. I have two bedrooms, and my room can get a little cold at night in the winter, I think due to inadequate insulation, but it's bearable. Definitely consider living here! Read less

Resident
2007 - 2008 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/02/2008
We've been here for nearly a year and love it. The management and staff are super helpful, friendly and available. They have responded immediately any time we've needed help with anything. We found our apartment in mint condition when we moved in. The grounds are consistently well-maintained. We have used the pool a lot last summer and exercise room, both of which are beautiful and very clean. Also, I've used the residents' business office quite a bit. I'm a grad student with a family and I find the location to be perfect; very close to both Duke and UNC. I strongly recommend this apartment complex.

Useful
Thanks for voting!
Report
Resident
2007 - 2008 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/01/2008
I have lived here for nearly a year and very much enjoy it. The staff is friendly and responsive, the apartments are comfortable and the amenities pretty nice. The apartments are well-kept up, and although not sound-proof, we have not had much trouble with noise. The best part has been the two dog runs, and the fact that a number of our neighbors have dogs - we've met some wonderful people that way! I would recommend, if you can, getting a place at the back of the complex - right up against the woods. Finally, it's a good location for couples in which one person is at Duke and the other is at UNC - the TTA bus (which runs between Durham and Chapel Hill) is only a 10 minute walk, and it's a 12 minute drive to Duke.
I have lived here for nearly a year and very much enjoy it. The staff is friendly and responsive, the apartments are comfortable and the amenities pretty nice. The apartments are well-kept up, and although not sound-proof, we have not had much trouble with noise. The best part has been the two dog runs, and the fact that a number of our neighbors have dogs - we've met some wonderful people that way! I would recommend, if you can, getting a place at the back of the complex - right up against the woods. Finally, it's a good location for couples in which one person is at Duke and the other is at UNC - the TTA bus (which runs between Durham and Chapel Hill) is only a 10 minute walk, and it's a 12 minute drive to Duke. Report
Resident
2006 - 2008 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/01/2008
I first came by the evergreens because the holiday decorations at the entrance on Mt.Moriah Rd. were so 'over the top' cheerful and inviting. From the beginning I have found all the staff nothing but courteous, competent, friendly and helpful. Maintenance issues are always handled promptly. I had an emergency after hours call returned in about five minutes (something I did.. not an apartment problem). Much attention is paid to keeping the grounds and living spaces nice and attractive. The apartment manager responds to all questions and inquires almost immediately. We have easy access to both Chapel Hill and Durham, plus we can hop on I-40 in about 2 minutes. The complex backs up on a stretch of undeveloped woods, so I feel like I am living in a tree house. I hardly hear a peep from my neighbors. Ive been here two and 1/2 years now and feel this is a great value. Oh, and I really appreciate the complimentary cat sitting. My friend in NYC pays $20/day for the same service.
I first came by the evergreens because the holiday decorations at the entrance on Mt.Moriah Rd. were so 'over the top' cheerful and inviting. From the beginning I have found all the staff nothing but courteous, competent, friendly and helpful. Maintenance issues are always handled promptly. I had an emergency after hours call returned in about five minutes (something I did.. not an apartment problem). Much attention is paid to keeping the grounds and living spaces nice and attractive. The apartment manager responds to all questions and inquires almost immediately. We have easy access to both Chapel Hill and Durham, plus we can hop on I-40 in about 2 minutes. The complex backs up on a stretch of undeveloped woods, so I feel like I am living in a tree house. I hardly hear a peep from my neighbors. Ive been here two and 1/2 years now and feel this is a great value. Oh, and I really appreciate the complimentary cat sitting. My friend in NYC pays $20/day for the same service. Read less

Report
Resident
2003 - 2008 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/31/2008
I have lived here for five years and LOVE it! THe management staff is great, very caring and considerate. Whenever I stop by the office they always stop what they are doing (if possible) and chat. Very personable. The maitenance staff has always been excellent, always quick to respond to any issues, although I have to admit there havent been many. THey serve breakfast every Saturday not just stale donuts but bagles, cereal, juice, muffins and of course coffee but then that's available along with cookies everyday. I will be leaving the area next year so will have to say goodbye and that will be MY loss. SO...if you want a great place to live and want to deal with really great staff come to Evergreen's at Mt Moriah.

Resident
2008 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/22/2008
I moved in about two months ago and it's been really GREAT experience living here. Two months back I was in Texas and couldn't come to visit the place before I moved. It was very difficult for me to find a place to live without actually being there. I talked the manager and staff member, they were really helpful and honest with the everything. They made my move so much easier. The apartment turned out to be even much better than I expected. They even serve breakfast for free! Great management and service, wonderful neighborhood . I am enjoying my living experience here and I would strongly recommend it!! Joey

awesometom 03/31/2008

delilah339 03/31/2008

Hi, I have been living here for 3 years now. My husband and I work in RTP at the IBM center. I know it is a drive, but we love it here. The only reason why we would move out of here is to find a house. I am sorry that you did not like it, I suppose not everywhere is for everyone. That is your opinion! The Staff has always been great to me, even the manager prior to Natalie. This community is wonderful and my neighbors are great, I have dogs and so do they. So we have play dates in the park. It seems very personal here, we know the staff really well and their families and they know us. I am happy that you found a place that works for, but you can not go around slenderizing them for trying to do their best job possible, I am sure that they have hundreds of people to help and watch over. They have jobs and their families to go home to by the end of the day. You know, their job is sales, if they didn't SUCKUP to people, then they would not be doing their job. Just get over it, you are somewhere else apparently, why does it matter now? Delilah -

How was this review?

Thanks for voting!
Report
Resident
2007 Recommended Property Reviewed 10/31/2007
I thoroughly enjoyed my time at the Evergreen at Mt. Moriah. I lived there for 2 years '05-'07 and moved out due to relocation reasons out of state. If I did not have to move, I definately would have stayed. This was my first single apartment after graduating from UNC and out of all the apts I've stayed at, by far the best and this includes the one I'm staying at now. First of all, my apartment was very reasonablly priced. I was fortunate to lock in at a great special and even when I renewed my lease, the price did go up quite a bit but I talked to the manager (Natalie who is awesome by the way) and was able to negotiate to a fair price. My apartment was very spacious, clean, and had a new apartment feel to it. The apartments were built in '01 I believe but are still kept very nice. The apts I live in NOW were built in '01 but do not feel as clean and new (given that I'm in a bigger metropolitan city too). I had a nice pond side view, so I did not have to worry about hearing cars or people at night disturbing my sleep. It was nice especially during the warm weather to lay out on my balcony and hear the fountain in the pond. The walls are thin so I could hear my neighbors who argued often and their yappy dog below me but that was it. No bugs, seriously. I loved my bathroom, it was huge given the floor plan I chosed. I have a dog and the neighborhood is very dog friendly. For the most part, people are good about cleaning up after their dogs. The neighborhood consists of young professionals, patients being seen at Duke, and families. I loved that it was family oriented given I am a single female. The staff at the Evergreens did an excellent job with community events. Pool parties in the summer and Christmas silent auction event during the winter. The pool is nice and has a nice outdoor BBQ patio. Wayne and Toby (the maintenance guys) are friendly and awesome. We talked on a day to day basis in passing. Sheena the assistant manager is the friendliest and caring person ever. Really I know it all sounds too good, but it is. I had a nice niche developed, I even knew the postal man as he dropped off the mail we would chat time to time on a regular basis. Saftey wise. Of course you can't keep all the rift raft out so there were occasional car break ins during the winter. But the staff notified residents and I would see a policeman drive through the neighborhood at night. You should be good as long as you practice good safety precautions like no valuables in the car. It is very close to I-85 and shopping centers, restaurants, and fast food areas. Traffic can be congested as always on 15-501 but there are back roads. Definately miss and appreciated it, and I hope that it stays that way. If you're a new resident or decide to move there, please make a collective effort to keep these apts nice, safe, and well rounded as it is now. Hope this helped!
I thoroughly enjoyed my time at the Evergreen at Mt. Moriah. I lived there for 2 years '05-'07 and moved out due to relocation reasons out of state. If I did not have to move, I definately would have stayed. This was my first single apartment after graduating from UNC and out of all the apts I've stayed at, by far the best and this includes the one I'm staying at now. I was fortunate to lock in at a great special and even when I renewed my lease, the price did go up quite a bit but I talked to the manager (Natalie who is awesome by the way) and was able to negotiate to a fair price. My apartment was very spacious, clean, and had a new apartment feel to it. The apartments were built in '01 I believe but are still kept very nice. The apts I live in NOW were built in '01 but do not feel as clean and new (given that I'm in a bigger metropolitan city too). I had a nice pond side view, so I did not have to worry about hearing cars or people at night disturbing my sleep. Definately miss and appreciated it, and I hope that it stays that way. If you're a new resident or decide to move there, please make a collective effort to keep these apts nice, safe, and well rounded as it is now. Hope this helped! Read less

Report
Resident
2007 Recommended Property Reviewed 08/07/2007
I almost overlooked the Evergreens during my apartment search due to the negative comments on this website, but I was getting frustrated with what I had seen at other complexes and decided to give them a chance. I am really glad I did. Most of the negative reviews are more than 2 years old, and I really have not seen evidence of anything in them. The apartments are only a few years old, and are in great condition. The rent is quite competitive with the area, and several members of the office staff know be my name. The landscaping looks great, and the location is excellent... if you turn left out of the complex, you've got great shopping at New Hope Commons and Patterson Place, but if you turn right, you're in the country. The complex is relatively quiet and the neighbors I've met have all been very friendly. People around here clean up after their pets and keep their patios looking nice. Maintenance requests have been taken care of very quickly. The apartments offer ample storage and the rooms are big. I've really enjoyed the cabinet space in the kitchen. Haha, well, I'd better stop before I say too much, demand goes way up, & they raise my rent too much when I renew!
I almost overlooked the Evergreens during my apartment search due to the negative comments on this website, but I was getting frustrated with what I had seen at other complexes and decided to give them a chance. I am really glad I did. Most of the negative reviews are more than 2 years old, and I really have not seen evidence of anything in them. The apartments are only a few years old, and are in great condition. The rent is quite competitive with the area, and several members of the office staff know be my name. The landscaping looks great, and the location is excellent... if you turn left out of the complex, you've got great shopping at New Hope Commons and Patterson Place, but if you turn right, you're in the country. The complex is relatively quiet and the neighbors I've met have all been very friendly. People around here clean up after their pets and keep their patios looking nice. Maintenance requests have been taken care of very quickly. The apartments offer ample storage and the rooms are big. I've really enjoyed the cabinet space in the kitchen. Haha, well, I'd better stop before I say too much, demand goes way up, & they raise my rent too much when I renew! Read less

Report
Resident
2007 Recommended Property Reviewed 06/19/2007
I am suprised at the negative comments about the office staff. We moved in about a month ago and everyone has been very friendly and helpful. They arranged for us to have our apartment opened for us when we arrived to move in, even though it was late at night. The apartments are in like-new condition - the only thing that was concerning me was the carpet being worn, and they replaced it for us before we moved in at my request, without any hassle at all. There were a few things we noticed when we moved in and they were all taken care of by the maintenance crew extremely quickly (the A/C wasn't cooling well when we moved in and the maintenance guy met us in the office right after signing the lease and notifying them of the problem and fixed it on the spot). The apt complex is quiet and amenities are nice, and underused (we've been able to play tennis whenever we wanted). If something bad comes up, I'll post again, but for now we are very satisfied!
I am suprised at the negative comments about the office staff. We moved in about a month ago and everyone has been very friendly and helpful. They arranged for us to have our apartment opened for us when we arrived to move in, even though it was late at night. The apartments are in like-new condition - the only thing that was concerning me was the carpet being worn, and they replaced it for us before we moved in at my request, without any hassle at all. The apt complex is quiet and amenities are nice, and underused (we've been able to play tennis whenever we wanted). If something bad comes up, I'll post again, but for now we are very satisfied! Report
Resident
2003 - 2005 Recommended Property Reviewed 07/02/2006
The Evergreens is the best apartment community my wife and I ever lived in, period. Go check it out and see for yourself but that sentence sums up our experience. If you're interested, read on for details. <br><br>I don't know who posts here but but I can tell you from personal experience that the overly negative reviews are not telling an objective story and the people writing them obviously had a bone to pick with the place.<br><br>If you are actually looking for a good, affordable apartment complex that adequately serves both Duke anbd UNC you should look here and see if it suits your needs. I can't guarantee your experience there but I will tell you mine.<br><br>The location is very good, just off of 15-501 only 2 minutes from the I-40 exit. The complex is also 2 minutes from a shopping center featuring Wal-Mart, Best Buy and Barnes & Noble among many others. It's another 2 minutes across 15-501 from Home Depot, Kohl's and Kroger among others. A brand new shopping complex is being built there as I type this with further amenities. So if shopping is your thing, this place is great for you especially since most of those places are the only ones of their kind in southern Durham. <br><br>We had outstanding service from the staff in all ways, from maintenance issues to renewals to moving in to moving out. The first manager we had there was fantastic and the manager when we left was equally great, friendly and professional and showing genuine interest in the community. The grounds are very nice and well-kept and the pool, business center, laundry and workout room were always clean, functioning and welcoming if not necessarily the fanciest.<br><br>The rent deals we had were very good for the square footage. Compared to a similar looking community across 15-501 our apartment was far cheaper and larger. The complex itself is fairly new and the wear and tear is minimal. The resident mix was nice too, mostly grad student or nursing/med student with the occasional undergrads mixed in. A good number of families too. All in all, the environment was very quiet, peaceful and family-friendly.<br><br>Criticisms: car break-ins were too common and we lost a cheap car radio ourselves right before Christmas to a car burglar. (Though I never heard even a whiff of home break-in or any type of personal assaults and I never worried about my wife being home alone or anything like that.) The community is just outside (like 1 mile) the Chapel Hill town limits so you have to park somewhere in town to use the free buses (yes, they really are free in CH). Because of the aforementioned shopping centers, traffic can be messy at times, especially on the weekend.<br><br>All in all, we looked at about 8 communities in Chapel Hill and Durham before deciding and The Evergreens won out for the location, good price for space ratio and pleasant community feel. We were never disappointed and have zero regrets from our time there. <br><br>Good luck!
The Evergreens is the best apartment community my wife and I ever lived in, period. Go check it out and see for yourself but that sentence sums up our experience. If you're interested, read on for details. <br><br>I don't know who posts here but but I can tell you from personal experience that the overly negative reviews are not telling an objective story and the people writing them obviously had a bone to pick with the place.<br><br>If you are actually looking for a good, affordable apartment complex that adequately serves both Duke anbd UNC you should look here and see if it suits your needs. I can't guarantee your experience there but I will tell you mine.<br><br>The location is very good, just off of 15-501 only 2 minutes from the I-40 exit. The complex is also 2 minutes from a shopping center featuring Wal-Mart, Best Buy and Barnes & Noble among many others. It's another 2 minutes across 15-501 from Home Depot, Kohl's and Kroger among others. A brand new shopping complex is being built there as I type this with further amenities. So if shopping is your thing, this place is great for you especially since most of those places are the only ones of their kind in southern Durham. <br><br>We had outstanding service from the staff in all ways, from maintenance issues to renewals to moving in to moving out. The first manager we had there was fantastic and the manager when we left was equally great, friendly and professional and showing genuine interest in the community. The grounds are very nice and well-kept and the pool, business center, laundry and workout room were always clean, functioning and welcoming if not necessarily the fanciest.<br><br>The rent deals we had were very good for the square footage. Compared to a similar looking community across 15-501 our apartment was far cheaper and larger. The complex itself is fairly new and the wear and tear is minimal. The resident mix was nice too, mostly grad student or nursing/med student with the occasional undergrads mixed in. A good number of families too. All in all, the environment was very quiet, peaceful and family-friendly.<br><br>Criticisms: car break-ins were too common and we lost a cheap car radio ourselves right before Christmas to a car burglar. (Though I never heard even a whiff of home break-in or any type of personal assaults and I never worried about my wife being home alone or anything like that.) The community is just outside (like 1 mile) the Chapel Hill town limits so you have to park somewhere in town to use the free buses (yes, they really are free in CH). Because of the aforementioned shopping centers, traffic can be messy at times, especially on the weekend.<br><br>All in all, we looked at about 8 communities in Chapel Hill and Durham before deciding and The Evergreens won out for the location, good price for space ratio and pleasant community feel. We were never disappointed and have zero regrets from our time there. <br><br>Good luck! Read less

Report
Resident
2005 - 2006 Recommended Property Reviewed 01/28/2006
Just a note to all you traveling nurses out there- Please note that the evergreens is close to DUKE, clean, well landscaped, pet friendly, and I feel very safe here. I am writing this for those of you who really need to know the scoop for travelers- I have been placed in many places that are substandard and didn't feel safe- rest assured this is a good place, and by the way, the staff has always been more than nice and helpful to me. I know how difficult it is when you get to an assignment an you are not placed in good housing - you will be happy here. I also work an off shift and consider it very quiet here.
Just a note to all you traveling nurses out there- Please note that the evergreens is close to DUKE, clean, well landscaped, pet friendly, and I feel very safe here. I know how difficult it is when you get to an assignment an you are not placed in good housing - you will be happy here. I also work an off shift and consider it very quiet here. Read less

Resident
2003 - 2005 Recommended Property Reviewed 08/06/2005
I lived at the Evergreens for two years and enjoyed my stay. I had great neighbors and really enjoyed the Evergreens apartment community. I recently moved to live closer to my job. The management always answered my questions in a timely and professional manner. Also, the maintenance staff addressed any issues I had in a timely manner. Before I moved the Evergreens added a playground for children to enjoy. The Evergreens is located within minutes away from UNC, NC Central, Duke, and several shopping centers. I highly recommend the Evergreens to anyone interested in staying in a great apartment community.

The management always answered my questions in a timely and professional manner. Also, the maintenance staff addressed any issues I had in a timely manner. Before I moved the Evergreens added a playground for children to enjoy. The Evergreens is located within minutes away from UNC, NC Central, Duke, and several shopping centers. I highly recommend the Evergreens to anyone interested in staying in a great apartment community. Read less

Report
Resident
2004 - 2005 Recommended Property Reviewed 08/03/2005
After reading the negative comments of this complex, I want to take this opportunity to say what a wonderful living experience I have had for the past 15 months at The Evergreens. The service I have had from the office staff and the maintenance staff has been both courteous and professional, and all interaction has been very pleasant. My apartment had the feel of a house and not an apartment, and the neighbors were wonderful. I would strongly recommend this complex to anyone looking for a place that is quiet, has a professional management staff and has a safe environment. The only reason I am moving is because I am buying a house--otherwise I would continue to reside in this great complex, convenient to Chapel Hill, Durham, I-40 and other great places.
After reading the negative comments of this complex, I want to take this opportunity to say what a wonderful living experience I have had for the past 15 months at The Evergreens. The service I have had from the office staff and the maintenance staff has been both courteous and professional, and all interaction has been very pleasant. My apartment had the feel of a house and not an apartment, and the neighbors were wonderful. I would strongly recommend this complex to anyone looking for a place that is quiet, has a professional management staff and has a safe environment. The only reason I am moving is because I am buying a house--otherwise I would continue to reside in this great complex, convenient to Chapel Hill, Durham, I-40 and other great places. Read less

Report
Resident
2004 - 2005 Not Recommended Reviewed 07/17/2005
ABSOLUTELY ATROCIOUS MANAGEMENT! UNPROFESSIONAL, INCOMPETENT AND DISRESPECTFUL STAFF. To be fair, the facility and amenities are appropriate; however the management staff is extremely incompetent and unprofessional with customer relations and organization which is crucial in deciding on where to live. The management team has a high-turnover rate which contributes to the leasing office being impersonal and disorganized. However it is doubtful that the level of organization would improve with regular staff members. Living in many luxury apartments in this area, we have never been in one as disorganized and unprofessional as this one. From day 1, they have made numerous errors with billing. As tenants, we have made sure the rent and additional payments have always been received on time and promptly. Regular maintenance such as bug infestation spraying and air filter changes has never been done in the entire year here, despite the infestation of ants in the bedroom and living room. Notices were put on the door stating the date of these activities; however after waiting 12 hours without a maintenance crew in sight we realized they were not planning on actually fulfilling their duties. In addition, I was home an additional day before and after the scheduled date to see if they would come by and again disappointed. They now advertise a guest suite available for the tenants. We had booked the suite several months in advance for family flying in from out-of-state. We were called a week in advance confirming the dates which was one thing done correctly. On the day of, I paid in advance, the staff member even double-checked the book to confirm the dates and I picked up the key to the suite. Six hours after my family checked in, they had the audacity to call us stating we were in the wrong and that our family would have to leave end of story. They 1) never checked the books clearly 2) if there was any misunderstanding/miscommunication between staff members, they should have discussed it prior to contacting us 3) should have approached us after fully doing the research and do so respectfully rather than telling us we needed to vacate immediately. They were clearly in the wrong, and realized that after the fact. However, any professional management would not have approached us with such rude manners and attitude to kick out an entire family on a very busy weekend nevertheless where no hotel rooms were available. Furthermore,two weeks prior to our lease expiration we receive a letter at our door stating we they did not receive a 60-day notice and therefore we can not leave for an additional month. This is the kicker, given that we had told the head manager verbally 3 times several months in advance (the last time being a few weeks ago). She never stated there were forms to fill out AND we never received any forms at our door or mailbox regarding this matter. What management of an apartment is not organized enough to make sure tenants receive a notice 2-3 months prior to date of lease expiration? We called and spoke to various staff members all of whom were not accommodating or professional enough to listen. Instead, we get statements such as welldid you fill out the written forms? Again we receive unprofessional and defensive retorts rather than lets try and figure this out. After speaking with the head manager, she did state they 1) sent out vacant forms but at least 4 buildings never did get them so they were wrong and 2) she remembers our conversations about leaving the apartment, but was still unwilling to admit culpability on their part. In addition, forcing us to pay for an additional month is still not 60 days notice, therefore it is more apparent that they were unable to occupy the apartment for that month and just wanted us to pay them to have each month accounted for in their books. This sounds unjust and a bit unlawful on their part. To summarize, this is NOT a place to live based purely on poor management.

This sounds unjust and a bit unlawful on their part. To summarize, this is NOT a place to live based purely on poor management. Read less

Report
Resident
2003 - 2005 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/17/2005
I have lived here almost 3 years and at first many of the bad comments I have read are true, but the staff has been completly replaced with new employees, They have really impoved this place and added a lot in the 3 years I have lived here. Added 2 dog parks, grills, playground, community involvment, socials, contests, celebrates holidays (decorates), rents movies, imporved gym, pool always open,monthly newsletters. Nice landscaping. The only negative thing I have to say is that each time you renew the lease it wil increase a lot. Don't know why, we are moving becasue we can not afford it anymore.

This man is leasing apartments yet was convicted of assault and battery in the late 90's. Report
Resident
2004 Recommended Property Reviewed 10/07/2004
I was a bit wary to move in to the apartment complex after reading some of the reviews at the beginning of the year. However, when I checked out the complex, the staff was really nice and the complex was very clean. Turns out Evergreens had just come under new management and staff, and I have seen nothing but improvements since I have moved in. They have increased amenity, increased activities, and improved the athletic equipment. Whenever I have a maintenance problem or a complaint, Beverly and her staff are quick to help out. I am very happy to have moved here.

They have increased amenity, increased activities, and improved the athletic equipment. Whenever I have a maintenance problem or a complaint, Beverly and her staff are quick to help out. I am very happy to have moved here. Read less

Resident
2003 - 2004 Recommended Property Reviewed 07/26/2004
I have enjoyed this apartment community because of the fresh, fun, friendly staff at this complex.If there should be any type of problem(s)with the apartment, it is handled efficiently and expediently. Beverly also adds a cool professional and gracious air to her job as community manager and it is displayed in every facet of her duties. She makes sure she goes beyond the call of duty to offer refreshments and just say "hello" even when she is quite busy. The business center is the other added attraction to this community and is always clean and materials are always available. The once a month brunches are also a welcome addition.

Resident
2004 Recommended Property Reviewed 07/23/2004
Living in the Evergreens is ok, as long as you ignore their idiotic staff and put on a fake smile for them so they won't try to screw you in the end. For some reason, if there is a problem with anything, they never want to contact you, you have to contact them...when they actually knew that was going on the whole time. Also, the staff is petty and I have heard them talk about occupants behind their backs. Is this really high school? They are not professional at all, try to charge you for random things, lie about their wireless, and never fix anything unless you complain about it forever. The apartments are nice and are in a good location; just keep it short and sweet with the staff and you'll get by.

Report
Resident
2002 - 2004 Recommended Property Reviewed 06/10/2004
My wife and I have lived at the Evergreens for the past two years (as stated in her post on 6/8/04), and have thoroughly enjoyed our stay. <br> <br>Changes in management and staff have of course been reflected in changes in residential experience. As this is still a new apartment complex making it through a difficult economy in its baby years, such growing pains are to be expected. Yes, RAM Partners was great (put the luxury in "luxury apartments"). They did retract the trash pickup service, but this was for the very good reason that a few people couldn't handle not putting their trash out a few days in advance of scheduled pickup, which attracted vermin. And yes, RAM's successors fumbled around a bit by making relative mistakes, such as issuing the (unenforced) policy regarding residents not being allowed in the office on the weekend; as this was a business faux pas, we simply disregarded the policy and nothing came of it. But the people have always been, well, people. My wife and I have treated the staff as we do any other party with which we wish to conduct business--cordially and with respect--and this has never failed to merit the same treatment from any member of the staff, even when we were resolving the rare problem. <br> <br>I sincerely pity those who may have had a serious plumbing problem that took more time than it should have to be resolved by the staff. Luckily, though, our experience has been a stark contrast with both our previous apartment and the negative experiences described in previous posts here. I had a routine maintenance request put in yesterday around noon, and the maintenance was performed around 2:30 the same day, which, if not exemplary of our experience, is at least telling of it. <br> <br>At Pinegate, our previous apartment, our sole toilet was nonfunctional for about three days after our (immediate) emergency maintenance request. That is a serious issue worth complaining about, trust me. But I find that most of the complaints I read on this site about the Evergreens seem to come from the kind of people who walk into a place with complaints in mind, looking for the slightest excuse to issue them, as opposed to recognizing the overwhelming positive in that place and sensibly relativizing their judgments to the situation at hand. Initiating an interaction rudely is the best way to realize (or further substantiate) a self-fulfilling negative image of those with whom one interacts, and my expectation is that this is what happens with the majority of those who have complained about the Evergreens on this site. <br> <br>The current staff has only been here a short while, but they are proving themselves to be wonderful, proactive people. They installed a new, larger, and better-located dog park than the previous, in addition to excelling in response to resident concerns. Only time and how you deal with them will determine future experiences with them, but from my perspective, their future looks bright. <br> <br>If you like to gripe unreasonably, please don't move here. If you are mature enough to realize what merits complaint and what deserves kudos, I want you as my neighbor--then, please complain or compliment accordingly. <br> <br>N.B. To offset the apparent statistical selection bias on this site, I have given maximum rankings in all categories. My rankings otherwise would be: <br>Parking: 4 <br>Noise Level: 4 <br>Grounds: 4 <br>Safety: 5 <br>Construction: 4.5 <br>Maintenance: 4 <br>Staff: 4 (offset negatively only by previous staff) <br>Overall: 5 <br>Recommend: Yes! <br> <br>
My wife and I have lived at the Evergreens for the past two years (as stated in her post on 6/8/04), and have thoroughly enjoyed our stay. <br> <br>Changes in management and staff have of course been reflected in changes in residential experience. As this is still a new apartment complex making it through a difficult economy in its baby years, such growing pains are to be expected. Yes, RAM Partners was great (put the luxury in "luxury apartments"). They did retract the trash pickup service, but this was for the very good reason that a few people couldn't handle not putting their trash out a few days in advance of scheduled pickup, which attracted vermin. And yes, RAM's successors fumbled around a bit by making relative mistakes, such as issuing the (unenforced) policy regarding residents not being allowed in the office on the weekend; as this was a business faux pas, we simply disregarded the policy and nothing came of it. But the people have always been, well, people. My wife and I have treated the staff as we do any other party with which we wish to conduct business--cordially and with respect--and this has never failed to merit the same treatment from any member of the staff, even when we were resolving the rare problem. <br> <br>I sincerely pity those who may have had a serious plumbing problem that took more time than it should have to be resolved by the staff. Luckily, though, our experience has been a stark contrast with both our previous apartment and the negative experiences described in previous posts here. I had a routine maintenance request put in yesterday around noon, and the maintenance was performed around 2:30 the same day, which, if not exemplary of our experience, is at least telling of it. <br> <br>At Pinegate, our previous apartment, our sole toilet was nonfunctional for about three days after our (immediate) emergency maintenance request. That is a serious issue worth complaining about, trust me. But I find that most of the complaints I read on this site about the Evergreens seem to come from the kind of people who walk into a place with complaints in mind, looking for the slightest excuse to issue them, as opposed to recognizing the overwhelming positive in that place and sensibly relativizing their judgments to the situation at hand. Initiating an interaction rudely is the best way to realize (or further substantiate) a self-fulfilling negative image of those with whom one interacts, and my expectation is that this is what happens with the majority of those who have complained about the Evergreens on this site. <br> <br>The current staff has only been here a short while, but they are proving themselves to be wonderful, proactive people. They installed a new, larger, and better-located dog park than the previous, in addition to excelling in response to resident concerns. Only time and how you deal with them will determine future experiences with them, but from my perspective, their future looks bright. <br> <br>If you like to gripe unreasonably, please don't move here. If you are mature enough to realize what merits complaint and what deserves kudos, I want you as my neighbor--then, please complain or compliment accordingly. <br> <br>N.B. To offset the apparent statistical selection bias on this site, I have given maximum rankings in all categories. My rankings otherwise would be: <br>Parking: 4 <br>Noise Level: 4 <br>Grounds: 4 <br>Safety: 5 <br>Construction: 4.5 <br>Maintenance: 4 <br>Staff: 4 (offset negatively only by previous staff) <br>Overall: 5 <br>Recommend: Yes! <br> <br> Read less

Report
Resident
2002 - 2004 Recommended Property Reviewed 06/08/2004
I have lived in the Evergreens for 2 years. The only reason I am leaving is to move across the country. I think the Evergreens is the best place I've ever seen to live in. <br> <br>The apartments are huge and have great floorplans. <br> <br>I don't know what someone else was talking about with the thin walls. I've never heard a neighbor except when my window (and theirs) was open. And I even had a newborn baby live below me! <br> <br>My rent did go up when I renewed, but not by very much. And this is true of almost every apartment complex. Most of the time, your rent does go up a bit. <br> <br>The management has always been very nice to me. Maintenance requests are fixed very quickly and any questions I have had about the apartments or amenities have been answered quickly and to my satisfaction. <br> <br>They have free movie rentals, free popcorn, free cookies, free movie night once a month with pizza and everything, free saturday morning brunch by the pool, free luau to open the pool. It's great! <br> <br>The wireless internet is awesome. I love to sit by the pool and surf the web. Or even in the office. They also have two computers for you to use 24 hrs a day. The gym is great, the pool is always open and very clean. <br> <br>But best of all..... THERE ARE TWO DOG PARKS!!! <br> <br>There is a small one and a new larger one. The dogs here are all very friendly and I haven't seen any that aren't well behaved or on their way to being so. <br> <br>I take the bus every day to work. From my building in the very back of the complex it is a 15 minute walk. From the front buildings it is only 10 minutes up to New Hope Commons and the bus stop. The DATA and the TTA both run from there regularly. <br> <br>Oh, and there are also grills all over the place so it is easy to cook out. <br> <br>To sum up, this is the best apartment complex ever, and it is well worth every penny.
I have lived in the Evergreens for 2 years. The only reason I am leaving is to move across the country. I think the Evergreens is the best place I've ever seen to live in. <br> <br>The apartments are huge and have great floorplans. <br> <br>I don't know what someone else was talking about with the thin walls. I've never heard a neighbor except when my window (and theirs) was open. And I even had a newborn baby live below me! <br> <br>My rent did go up when I renewed, but not by very much. And this is true of almost every apartment complex. Most of the time, your rent does go up a bit. <br> <br>The management has always been very nice to me. Maintenance requests are fixed very quickly and any questions I have had about the apartments or amenities have been answered quickly and to my satisfaction. <br> <br>They have free movie rentals, free popcorn, free cookies, free movie night once a month with pizza and everything, free saturday morning brunch by the pool, free luau to open the pool. It's great! <br> <br>The wireless internet is awesome. I love to sit by the pool and surf the web. Or even in the office. They also have two computers for you to use 24 hrs a day. The gym is great, the pool is always open and very clean. <br> <br>But best of all..... THERE ARE TWO DOG PARKS!!! <br> <br>There is a small one and a new larger one. The dogs here are all very friendly and I haven't seen any that aren't well behaved or on their way to being so. <br> <br>I take the bus every day to work. From my building in the very back of the complex it is a 15 minute walk. From the front buildings it is only 10 minutes up to New Hope Commons and the bus stop. The DATA and the TTA both run from there regularly. <br> <br>Oh, and there are also grills all over the place so it is easy to cook out. <br> <br>To sum up, this is the best apartment complex ever, and it is well worth every penny. Read less

Report
Resident
2003 - 2004 Recommended Property Reviewed 05/14/2004
I've live here for the past year and a half and I think its the best apartment community that I have ever lived in. The old management was not great, but the new management is excellent. I once had a water leak and someone came to fix it within two hours. Also, when I moved from my one bedroom apartment to my two bedroom apartment, I had a ceiling fan and extra shelving installed for FREE! I have never had any problem with parking or noise as I did in the Belmont. And it is not true that the Evergreens raises your rent when you go to renew your lease. Before I moved into my two bedroom apartment within the community I was considdering staying in my one bedroom. The staff offered to give me the exact same terms of my origional lease - which were a lot cheaper than other apartment communities.

Report
Resident
2004 Not Recommended Reviewed 05/11/2004
I am in the process of moving and went to look at the Evergreens. I was very disappointed and decided from the moment I finished the "tour" of the place that I would never live there. First of all, I researched the Evergreens online and the floor plans show the bedrooms (in the 3 BR apt) being equal dimensions (16 x 11). When I toured the model apt, they were noticeably different in size. The 3rd BR was merely 10 x 12'9" (a huge difference from 16 x 11). I asked the staff about this and the guy replied, "OHHHHHHH, yeah, my manager just looked at that and is in the process of changing it as we speak." FYI - I just looked up their website and there have been no changes made to the bedroom dimensions. So, that was a little sketchy. Also, they were offering a great deal on the lease and I asked about next year and if my lease would be regular price if I stayed for 2 years? His reply, "Oh yeah, we have never raised the prices on leases for residents. Your rent will stay the same, give or take $10 or $20." However, I have a friend who said the opposite happened to her at the Evergreens. Sounded pretty sketchy to me, yet again. Another thing - he told me the pool stayed open year-round, yet it was closed "indefinitely" for maintenance. So, in all honesty, I don't know - I really haven't lived there, but I got enough of a taste of the Evergreens from just a visit. Just be careful where you look because a lease is very difficult and very expensive to get out of.
I am in the process of moving and went to look at the Evergreens. I was very disappointed and decided from the moment I finished the "tour" of the place that I would never live there. First of all, I researched the Evergreens online and the floor plans show the bedrooms (in the 3 BR apt) being equal dimensions (16 x 11). When I toured the model apt, they were noticeably different in size. The 3rd BR was merely 10 x 12'9" (a huge difference from 16 x 11). I asked the staff about this and the guy replied, "OHHHHHHH, yeah, my manager just looked at that and is in the process of changing it as we speak." FYI - I just looked up their website and there have been no changes made to the bedroom dimensions. So, that was a little sketchy. Also, they were offering a great deal on the lease and I asked about next year and if my lease would be regular price if I stayed for 2 years? His reply, "Oh yeah, we have never raised the prices on leases for residents. Your rent will stay the same, give or take $10 or $20." However, I have a friend who said the opposite happened to her at the Evergreens. Sounded pretty sketchy to me, yet again. Another thing - he told me the pool stayed open year-round, yet it was closed "indefinitely" for maintenance. So, in all honesty, I don't know - I really haven't lived there, but I got enough of a taste of the Evergreens from just a visit. Just be careful where you look because a lease is very difficult and very expensive to get out of. Read less

2004 Recommended Property Reviewed 05/11/2004
I live at The Evergreens at Mt Moriah and had the most pleasant experience. I will tell you the truth about my experiences. The person who wrote the review before mine must be crazy. (smile, shaking my head) <br>Lie # 1 Teh pool is closed....false, the pool has been open since mid April. I know I was there the day after. This is a first for me, as many communities' pools are still not open and won't be until Memorial Day!! <br>Lie #2 The Staff is rude, this is false. Since I have been here, they have handled all of my complaints within a timely manner and have been very helpful. <br>Lie #3 I have been here for a while and My rent has not increased, they even offered me a special for renewing early. <br>Wow, some people are really crazy, Don't beleive the lies.

Resident
2003 - 2004 Not Recommended Reviewed 05/10/2004
I have been waiting until I was out of the apartment and enough time had passed in moving out that the Asst. Manager, et. al. couldn't find something to charge me for...again. I was in this apartment when the old management company, RAM, left. The people they put in their place are HORRIBLE!! They lie, and when a big problem comes up that the Asst. Manager doesn't want to deal with, she tells you to talk to the Manager in their "District Office." Oddly enough, her manager's office is right off the lobby in the compex! AND the manager was new a year ago when I moved in. Nice apartments, thin walls, nothing done about noisemakers or people with dogs that are too big and not allowed. Maint. people have to come three times before a problem is fixed. I just have to say-- DONT do it. They didn't hit me for move out $$ because I kept the apartment immaculate, but trust me, there are better places and deals. Check out down the road near the supermarket.

Report
Resident
2002 - 2003 Not Recommended Reviewed 04/14/2004
I lived at the Evergreens a year ago and everything was cool until I moved out. After moving out I was hit with a $235 charge for "resurfacing the bathtub." Admitantly there was a dime sized chip in the top corner of the tub (NOT the basin or anywhere used in bathing), but I truly believe they were looking to get as much money from my roomate and I because of the concessions we were offered by previous management. Management also tried to charge for stains in the rug caused by a leak in the building itself (no fault of either of us) but we were able to sufficiently refute that charge. <br> <br>My advice, stay away. If for no other reason but to send a message that the current management are crooked and coniving.
I lived at the Evergreens a year ago and everything was cool until I moved out. After moving out I was hit with a $235 charge for "resurfacing the bathtub." Admitantly there was a dime sized chip in the top corner of the tub (NOT the basin or anywhere used in bathing), but I truly believe they were looking to get as much money from my roomate and I because of the concessions we were offered by previous management. Management also tried to charge for stains in the rug caused by a leak in the building itself (no fault of either of us) but we were able to sufficiently refute that charge. <br> <br>My advice, stay away. If for no other reason but to send a message that the current management are crooked and coniving. Read less

Report
Resident
2002 - 2004 Not Recommended Reviewed 04/07/2004
I have lived at the Evergreens for one year and seven months. At first the management was great, addressing you by your name, getting to know each indiviudal, and striving to make the community a wonderful place to live. In fact, the atmosphere WAS peaceful, UNTIL the OTHER management arrived. They make no efforts to help the residents with any issues. They are also very rude when going to the office and not even acknowledging your presence. Trying to get a package is like trying to get through a maximum security prison. I would not suggest moving to the Evergreens until the management improves and you know your needs will be taken care of. You could spend the money you pay there in a place that actually makes you feel comfortable.

The property has deterioted to the point whereby I don´t have friends over because of the filthy stairs and breezeways. The only reason I´m here is I can get to work in 5 minutes. Resident
2003 Not Recommended Reviewed 11/02/2003
i never lived here, but i can understand why the reviewers feel the way they do just based on the treatment i received from these clowns when i stopped by to tour the community. the price they gave me was astronomical, and when i asked if they had a preffered employers discount, they claimed to have never heard of the company i worked for, which was GlaxoSmithKline. Then she said she would knock a whopping $20.00 off my rent if i put flyers up at my work to advertise the Evergreens for them! i had to ask her if she was serious. she also seemed inept at understanding why i wouldn´t want to live in a unit that overlooked the pool. obviously i wouldn´t want to deal with the noise, but based on the reviews posted here, the pool is never open anyway so i wouldn´t have to worry about that! <br>needless to say, i thanked these crazy people for their time and found a much better place to live. my heart goes out to all the poor residents of the evergreens that have to deal with these people.

Resident
2003 Not Recommended Reviewed 10/03/2003
when my roommate and i first moved into these apartments, we were so excited because we thought we got a deal. how wrong we were... <br> <br>after moving in there has been nothing but problems. shortly after moving here, we recieved a noise violation when i was in texas visiting family and my roommate was at work. please tell me, how can i recieve a noise violation when i am not home? <br> <br>a month ago i had a problem with my refrigerator. because of cheap installation, the water connection broke and i came home to a flooded kitchen. i immediately called the office and was spoken to like i had a slight leak in my sink. she couldn´t seem to grasp the fact i was in standing water. after finally conveying the message, they said a maintance man would be down in ten minutes. 30 minutes later i had moved my fridge, turned off the water, and starting cleaning up before any sight of help. <br> <br>the managment here is shady. they are rude, and i do not trust them. all of my neighboors share my same opinion. as soon as my lease runs out, my roommate and i are gone. we both have been leasing for 3 years, and this is the worst experience with management i have ever experienced.

Resident
2003 Not Recommended Reviewed 10/01/2003
Where life is a living hell. I have lived here for about six months and I can´t stand it. If it didn´t cost an arm and a leg to get out of my lease I would have left a while back. The staff is absolutely the rudest bunch of people I have ever met. They did seem really nice at first when I moved in, but all it took was a few weeks and there was problem after problem. My ac has been broke for three months now and I still can´t get them to fix it.Luckily now the wheather has changed and the ac isn´t that important. This place is absolutely horrible. None of my neighbors like it here either. I don´t know of anyone who will be renew their lease when the time comes. If your even thinking about stopping by for a look just stop, turn around, and run the other way. There are so many more really nice apartments in the area. I am sure the deals that the evergreens are giving now can be beat by most.

Resident
2002 - 2003 Not Recommended Reviewed 09/25/2003
We have lived in Evergreens for over a year. When we moved in the Management Team was supreme, which was overseen by Ram. Anything you needed, no matter what was handled in a professional manner. Now is a different story! We decided to renew our lease because of the hassles of moving. The new Assistant Manager could not even do the math on our lease! We were given a prorated discount, only to be told at rent time they couldn´t honor that!! They finally did honor the original deal when we refused to pay more than originally quoted. The grounds look terrible, worse than ever. The hallway in my building is totally disguisting with dirt and old spills. However, they had the nerve to leave a nasty note on my door (for everyone to read) about moving a small end table. It´s gone down hill, there´s a reason they are giving all these great deals! You get what you pay for.

Resident
2003 Recommended Property Reviewed 08/11/2003
Anytime there is transition in leadership, it´s apparent that there will be problems before a new staff can settle in. We were able to lease a lovely 3 bedroom apartment for a reasonable price, several hundred lower than it was supposed to be. <br> <br>The area is QUIET. It´s one of the nicer apartment complexes that I´ve seen. The staff answers questions quickly and they are usually available to help. I haven´t had any trouble with them. <br> <br>You can tell that they are working on getting the things that the residents need. At times, they have told me things that they could provide (i.e. pool parties), only to find out later that there were several stipulations. However, these problems are minor compared to what we´re getting for our money. I couldn´t recommend a better place to live for the price.

Report
Resident
2002 - 2003 Not Recommended Reviewed 08/08/2003
I lived in this community for 16 months and recently moved out. My husband and I drove through the property last night and noticed that the complex has deteriorated greatly. There is an RV parked in the parking lot (which was always a HUGE violation of rules), broken down cars, and a generally run-down appearance. The landscaping is definitely lacking; it seems like everything is dying. We were very disappointed with the new management who decided to cheat and lie their way out of giving us our security deposit. It is sad to see a community- that once was beautiful and welcoming- suffer like it has. It is obvious that the Evergreens is having financial problems, which forced them to let go of Ram Partners management. The complex definitely had potential.

2003 Recommended Property Reviewed 08/01/2003
To Drive Me Crazy -- <br>If you don´t like it so much, then why are you living here? I have lived in 5 apartments in the past 2 years, and I have to say that I like this one the best. The grounds are well-kept and I thought the staff was nice, especially Mindy. What do you expect, a maid service? If you want that then live in a hotel. I´m sick of people complaining when they don´t know how good they´ve got it. This place is one of the best I´ve lived in in this area, no doubt about it. Maybe if you were nicer to the staff then they´d be nice to you. I´ve never had a problem with any staff or maintenence person at Evergreens. So for all of you out there who read the negative messages on this board - think twice about them. I think it´s great and I´m NOT leaving!

2003 Not Recommended Reviewed 07/25/2003
Originally I posted a review out of anger, but then a ´friend´ enlightened me that this could possibly lead to trouble. I would suggest that the staff think seriously about business management night classes. I would also suggest that they recognize where they work. This is one of the ritzier places in the area and has gone down hill as a result of the new management. Residents are unhappy and RUN LIKE HELL once their leases end. It takes a well trained and intelligent person to know how to serve a resident´s needs appropriately. The deceitful and erratic behavior of the staff is unnecessary. Personal emotional problems and attitudes should be kept out of the office. Can one blame a resident for not wanting to attend one of the ´pool parties´ when the ´hosts´aka staff, blast the music at illegal levels? This is our HOME, not a place where we want to be blown out of our rooms. I can speak for my husband and I that this is a temporary situation until we gradute. But there are MANY families with CHILDERN who deserve more respect than what the staff here provide.

Report
Resident
2002 - 2003 Not Recommended Reviewed 06/19/2003
I lived at the Evergreens for 14 months and was very pleased until the management changed hands. The previous office staff always greeted you with a smile and made you feel very welcome. I can never remember a time where they were unfriendly such as the current office staff. Not to mention names but there´s not one friendly face in the office now. Maybe if your a new resident and you just leased an apt. you were treated properly but just wait until you get settled in and see how you like it then. <br> <br>Let´s see, where should I start! <br>Let´s begin with the May newsletter mentioning that residents were not allowed in the office during the weekends. I thought the staff was there for the residents. The old management company would have never let that happen. <br>Second, the pool issue. Isn´t the pool one of the enticing things that brought you to the Evergreens. I guess they figure we just wanted to look at how pretty it is during the hot summer and tease our children. <br>Third, Let me mention the grass and landscaping. There was never a time when I could not allow my children to play in the grass. Since management has changed, my children have not been allowed to play outside in the grassy areas due to the grass being as tall as they are and not to mention the breezeways at how they´re never blown off from when they did mow and all the grass gathered in the breezeways of the buildings. <br> <br>Now let´s mention the dumpsters. <br>I have never seen the trash pile up so high in front of the dumpster or for that matter it was never put in front of the dumpsters at all before. I had friends from out of town visit me and my family and was embaressed when they entered the property at the second entrance by the dumpsters and it looked and smelled like the local trash dump. <br> <br>These are just a few of the complaints, but the list could go on and on. The grounds can be taken care of but the new office staff has to go. I have never seen such unprofessionalism and rudeness such as what takes place in the office now. They have no clue as to what they are doing in there! Whoever decided to let the old office staff go made a huge mistake because word travels fast and I am ashamed to say that I once lived there and will definitely not recommend The Evergreens as a place to live. <br> <br>For those who wrote good reviews about the property why choose to be anonymous. If I were pleased to be living there I would proudly state my name, but for me, I choose to be anonymous because I am embarressed to say that what was once a beautiful place to live is no longer that. I write this in hopes that it allows people to think twice before considering it home. <br> <br> <br>
I lived at the Evergreens for 14 months and was very pleased until the management changed hands. The previous office staff always greeted you with a smile and made you feel very welcome. I can never remember a time where they were unfriendly such as the current office staff. Not to mention names but there´s not one friendly face in the office now. Maybe if your a new resident and you just leased an apt. you were treated properly but just wait until you get settled in and see how you like it then. <br> <br>Let´s see, where should I start! <br>Let´s begin with the May newsletter mentioning that residents were not allowed in the office during the weekends. I thought the staff was there for the residents. The old management company would have never let that happen. <br>Second, the pool issue. Isn´t the pool one of the enticing things that brought you to the Evergreens. I guess they figure we just wanted to look at how pretty it is during the hot summer and tease our children. <br>Third, Let me mention the grass and landscaping. There was never a time when I could not allow my children to play in the grass. Since management has changed, my children have not been allowed to play outside in the grassy areas due to the grass being as tall as they are and not to mention the breezeways at how they´re never blown off from when they did mow and all the grass gathered in the breezeways of the buildings. <br> <br>Now let´s mention the dumpsters. <br>I have never seen the trash pile up so high in front of the dumpster or for that matter it was never put in front of the dumpsters at all before. I had friends from out of town visit me and my family and was embaressed when they entered the property at the second entrance by the dumpsters and it looked and smelled like the local trash dump. <br> <br>These are just a few of the complaints, but the list could go on and on. The grounds can be taken care of but the new office staff has to go. I have never seen such unprofessionalism and rudeness such as what takes place in the office now. They have no clue as to what they are doing in there! Whoever decided to let the old office staff go made a huge mistake because word travels fast and I am ashamed to say that I once lived there and will definitely not recommend The Evergreens as a place to live. <br> <br>For those who wrote good reviews about the property why choose to be anonymous. If I were pleased to be living there I would proudly state my name, but for me, I choose to be anonymous because I am embarressed to say that what was once a beautiful place to live is no longer that. I write this in hopes that it allows people to think twice before considering it home. <br> <br> <br> Read less

I have all day at work to be at the computer so keep them coming and we will keep on telling the truth that this place is awful.

Report
Resident
2002 - 2003 Not Recommended Reviewed 05/14/2003
After reading all of the reviews, I must agree with the majority. When RAM Partners was running the property, the staff was professional and friendly. It felt like a community here. Now that the owners let RAM go, they are trying to manage the property. There are 8 or so owners who live in various states around the country. So, to the person who wrote that the people who are complaining must be problem residents, I must disagree. I am a professional who works at Duke on the night shift. My rent is turned in a week early every month, and I live by myself and am extremely quite. Plus, I do not leave garbage out. I actually have not met the staff, but talked to them on the phone. Both times I spoke with them (2 different people in the office on 2 different occassions), they were rude and short. With all of that said, I am very displeased with the quality of service from the staff. We were told that they don´t have time for residents on the weekends, so we can now not go into the office on Saturdays and Sundays. This, to me, is very unproffesional and rude. <br>The apartments themselves are pretty nice. The carpet is cheap and unravels (which they have not fixed yet) and the paint rubs off of the walls. Not to mention the kitchen counter and bath tub which are sinking. <br>Overall, I would recommend the apartments, but not when they come with the staff in the office.
After reading all of the reviews, I must agree with the majority. When RAM Partners was running the property, the staff was professional and friendly. It felt like a community here. Now that the owners let RAM go, they are trying to manage the property. There are 8 or so owners who live in various states around the country. So, to the person who wrote that the people who are complaining must be problem residents, I must disagree. I am a professional who works at Duke on the night shift. My rent is turned in a week early every month, and I live by myself and am extremely quite. Plus, I do not leave garbage out. I actually have not met the staff, but talked to them on the phone. Both times I spoke with them (2 different people in the office on 2 different occassions), they were rude and short. With all of that said, I am very displeased with the quality of service from the staff.
