This, to me, is very unproffesional and rude. <br>The apartments themselves are pretty nice. The carpet is cheap and unravels (which they have not fixed yet) and the paint rubs off of the walls. Not to mention the kitchen counter and bath tub which are sinking. <br>Overall, I would recommend the apartments, but not when they come with the staff in the office. Read less

Report
Resident
2001 - 2002 Not Recommended Reviewed 05/14/2003
I think most of these reviews have summarized this place pretty well. So, I will list all of the promises that were made to me when I moved in that still were not there a year and a half later when I moved. When I moved, out of curiousity I asked the staff about these things. Their answer was that they were not a priority in their budget at the moment. <br>So, here is a list of all of the promises that never came true: <br>-barbeque grills <br>-picnic tables <br>-walking trails <br>-dog park <br>-exterminator <br>-they removed door to door trash pickup <br>the pool doesn´t open until June and then randomly closes on hot summer days <br>-the equipment in the exercise room was stolen and never replaced <br>-social gatherings <br> <br>If you don´t care about these things and don´t really mind a rude office staff, then come on over to the Evergreens!

Report
Resident
2001 - 2003 Not Recommended Reviewed 05/14/2003
Last night, we mentioned this website to the office staff to let them know the residents´ concerns. Today, after speaking with the office manager, I was accused of writing the negative reviews and asked to reconsider what she believes I wrote. So, I am writing this review to prove that I did not write the others, as you can only post one review per account. When speaking with the office yesterday we relayed some of the opinions on this site to them. Today, the office manager told me that I must have written the review(s) since I said some statements that were verbatim from this site. I wonder if it ever occurred to her that I read the reviews and relayed them to her staff? <br> <br>I decided to voice my real since I was accused of writing the others: <br> <br>The apartments are very nice with garden tubs, large balconies, new appliances, etc. The anemities are lacking, however. The "year-round" pool is still not open and the weather has been over 80 degrees for quite sometime. The gate is locked, preventing access to just sit by the pool and read. The fitness center is small, smelly, and missing some of the equipment that was origianlly present. <br>I have not been pleased with the professionalism of the new staff. They do get maintenance requests taken care of, and make the residents feel unwelcome. As another reveiwer mentioned, in our May newsletter we were told not to come into the office on the weekends. That really makes the residents feel unwelcome in their own home. The sense of community is gone from the Evergreens. I wish that it could have developed into the property for which the previous management was striving.
Last night, we mentioned this website to the office staff to let them know the residents´ concerns. Today, after speaking with the office manager, I was accused of writing the negative reviews and asked to reconsider what she believes I wrote. So, I am writing this review to prove that I did not write the others, as you can only post one review per account. Today, the office manager told me that I must have written the review(s) since I said some statements that were verbatim from this site. I wonder if it ever occurred to her that I read the reviews and relayed them to her staff? <br> <br>I decided to voice my real since I was accused of writing the others: <br> <br>The apartments are very nice with garden tubs, large balconies, new appliances, etc. The anemities are lacking, however. The "year-round" pool is still not open and the weather has been over 80 degrees for quite sometime. The gate is locked, preventing access to just sit by the pool and read. The fitness center is small, smelly, and missing some of the equipment that was origianlly present. <br>I have not been pleased with the professionalism of the new staff. They do get maintenance requests taken care of, and make the residents feel unwelcome. As another reveiwer mentioned, in our May newsletter we were told not to come into the office on the weekends. That really makes the residents feel unwelcome in their own home. The sense of community is gone from the Evergreens. I wish that it could have developed into the property for which the previous management was striving. Read less

Report
Resident
2003 Recommended Property Reviewed 05/14/2003
Im a resident at Evergreens and have been here since it opened. I went and spoke with the office staff, which by the way were very nice to me and they cleared up alot of stuff that is being said here. <br> <br>The pool is only locked because the inspector said 1 month ago that they were #35 to be inspected. They were leaving it unlocked letting people sunbathe, but were told by inspectors that it had to be padlocked. It will be open next week. Also, residents CAN come on the weekends and get questions answered because I was just there this weekend. They just cant sign leases or do any of the business part because only 1 leasing agent is present on the weekend. Come on people, do you really think anyone should work 7 days a week? <br> <br>Im very disappointed about my neighbors and wonder what TYPE of people are here. Obviously you have nothing better to do than to COMPLAIN. I mean calling people fat names and making insults is really childish, and you should probably get some help with your self esteem, seriously. Grow up. <br> <br>To say that noone lives, here its funny because there were about 20 people getting apartments this weekend when I came to get my package. I was never kicked out or asked to leave. <br> <br>I actually spoke with the leasing professional, who by the way was wearing a very NICE suit this weekend, and told me about an upcoming pool party, and theyre putting in grills this summer and a doggie park. It will happen and Im just disgusted that I live among such people who are so negative and critical when they OBVIOUSLY dont know what they are speaking of. <br> <br>Me and my husband and NEIGHBORS are very happy here and will be renewing our lease next month. <br> <br>GET A GRIP <br>

Report
Resident
2003 Recommended Property Reviewed 05/14/2003
Everything about the Evergreens at Mt. Moriah is a perfect representation of what an apartment community should be. The grounds are well kept and beautiful, while the apartment themselves are spacious and new. Everyone visiting me has absolutely loved my one bedroom apartment and has been amazed at the space inside of it. The staff at the Evergreens is amazing and greets everyone with a cheerful attitude whether it´s on the phone or in person. My move in was unstressful because the paper work was ready and the apartment was spotless when I arrived. I couldn´t have asked for a more professional team of staff members to deal with. I do not understand where some of these reviews are coming from, they must be from people that have broken rules or not paid rent and have been asked to move out. Basically, I wouldn´t live anywhere else in the Durham/Chapel Hill area other than the Evergreens at Mt. Moriah.
Everything about the Evergreens at Mt. Moriah is a perfect representation of what an apartment community should be. The grounds are well kept and beautiful, while the apartment themselves are spacious and new. Everyone visiting me has absolutely loved my one bedroom apartment and has been amazed at the space inside of it. The staff at the Evergreens is amazing and greets everyone with a cheerful attitude whether it´s on the phone or in person. My move in was unstressful because the paper work was ready and the apartment was spotless when I arrived. I couldn´t have asked for a more professional team of staff members to deal with. I do not understand where some of these reviews are coming from, they must be from people that have broken rules or not paid rent and have been asked to move out. Basically, I wouldn´t live anywhere else in the Durham/Chapel Hill area other than the Evergreens at Mt. Moriah. Read less

Report
Resident
2002 - 2003 Recommended Property Reviewed 05/13/2003
Ive been living at Evergreens at Mt Moriah apartments for about a year now. I love the property and its BRAND NEW!! The prices are decent for the area and Its extremely quiet. There is never a problem with parking and Im super excited about the doggie park thats being put in this summer. Being on 60 acres I dont have to worry about just anyone coming in off the street. I am also happy with the new management team. Everytime I call my maintenace is taken care of the same day and the leasing agents are SUPER friendly. I´m always greeted at the door!! This is the kind of service that I expect especially from a class A property. Im very happy here and those that are writing are probably late on there rent and are always getting notices or leaving trash out or just something. Theres always going to be a few that make things bad, but when you do what your supposed to do then everything runs smooth. <br> <br>I recommend Evergreens at Mt Moriah to everyone and know that youll be happy. Come and see yourself. The warmness of the staff is unbelievable. <br> <br>Class A, Brand New, and AWESOME!!!!!!!(EVEN A STANDARD GARDEN TUB!!!!)
Ive been living at Evergreens at Mt Moriah apartments for about a year now. I love the property and its BRAND NEW!! The prices are decent for the area and Its extremely quiet. This is the kind of service that I expect especially from a class A property. Im very happy here and those that are writing are probably late on there rent and are always getting notices or leaving trash out or just something. Theres always going to be a few that make things bad, but when you do what your supposed to do then everything runs smooth. <br> <br>I recommend Evergreens at Mt Moriah to everyone and know that youll be happy. Well I have been here for about 15 months and can´t wait to move. The office staff is completely rude and nasty. They will promise you everything and not produce anything. Everybody we know is completely unhappy here and nobody is renewing there lease. I mean not one person we know is staying here. People have broken there contracts and have paid thousands to leave early. They are a bunch of liars and thieves and have no regard for residents or there problems. If you are looking for an upscale place that will quickly become east Durham and the GHETTO then this place is for you. Please I do not know who is reading this but STAY FAR AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!!!!

Report
Resident
2002 - 2003 Not Recommended Reviewed 04/29/2003
I have lived here for almost a year and a half now. When we first moved in, the staff was wonderful and the property was beautiful. However, they were having problems filling the apartments and let go of Ram Management. Now, the owners of the property are responsible for the management of it. However, the eight of them live in various states in the US. So, now we have an office staff that is rude, and makes the residents feel as if they are doing us a favor by allowing us to live there. The residents are not allowed in the office on the weekends anymore since they are "too busy" for us. Our whole building had a mouse problem, but they told us that we all needed to keep our apartments cleaner and that they didn´t have an extermination company yet. (Which they still do not.) Crime is no stranger here either. Tires being stolen off of cars in the parking lot, cars being broken into, etc. Instead of replacing the linoleum in the kitchen when the construction workers burned a whole in it, the maintenance replaced 2 squares of it. These of course began to peel up. We went through relacing squares 3 times before they would replace the entire floor. I could go on about how this complex went down hill, but I don´t have enough time or room. It may seem inciting when you see it, but trust me and all of my neighbors, you will NOT be happy here.
I have lived here for almost a year and a half now. When we first moved in, the staff was wonderful and the property was beautiful. However, they were having problems filling the apartments and let go of Ram Management. Now, the owners of the property are responsible for the management of it. However, the eight of them live in various states in the US. So, now we have an office staff that is rude, and makes the residents feel as if they are doing us a favor by allowing us to live there. The residents are not allowed in the office on the weekends anymore since they are "too busy" for us. Our whole building had a mouse problem, but they told us that we all needed to keep our apartments cleaner and that they didn´t have an extermination company yet. (Which they still do not.) Crime is no stranger here either. Tires being stolen off of cars in the parking lot, cars being broken into, etc. Instead of replacing the linoleum in the kitchen when the construction workers burned a whole in it, the maintenance replaced 2 squares of it. These of course began to peel up. We went through relacing squares 3 times before they would replace the entire floor. I could go on about how this complex went down hill, but I don´t have enough time or room. It may seem inciting when you see it, but trust me and all of my neighbors, you will NOT be happy here. Read less

    Pet Limit: 2
